      ELENILTO MINERALS AND MINING LLC.             <br /><br /><br />

                   AUGUST 22, 2011                  <br /><br /><br />
﻿MINERAL DEVELOPMENT AGREEMENT      <br /><br /><br />
                                   <br /><br /><br />
             Among                 <br /><br /><br />
       THE GOVERNMENT OF           <br /><br /><br />
                                   <br /><br /><br />
    THE REPUBLIC OF LIBERIA,       <br /><br /><br />
    WESTERN CLUSTER LIMITED,       <br /><br /><br />
       SESA GOA LIMITED,           <br /><br /><br />
     BLOOM FOUNTAIN LIMITED        <br /><br /><br />
              AND                  <br /><br /><br />
                                   <br /><br /><br />
 ELENILTO MINERALS & MINING LLC    <br /><br /><br />
                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                   <br /><br /><br />
     Dated as of August 3, 2011    <br /><br /><br />
﻿﻿AN ACT TO RATIFY THE CONCESSION AGREEMENT AMONG THE                                  <br /><br /><br />
GOVERNMENT OF THE REPUBLIC OF LIBERIA, WESTERN CLUSTER LIMITED.,                     <br /><br /><br />
SESA GOA LIMITED, BLOOM FOUNTAIN LIMITED AND ELENILTO MINERALS                       <br /><br /><br />
AND MINING LLC                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
It is enacted by the Senate and House of Representatives of the Republic of Liberia  <br /><br /><br />
in Legislature assembled:                                                            <br /><br /><br />
SECTION I:                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
That from and immediately upon the passage of this Act, “AN ACT TO RATIFY            <br /><br /><br />
THE CONCESSION AGREEMENT AMONG THE GOVERNMENT OF THE                                 <br /><br /><br />
REPUBLIC OF LIBERIA, WESTERN CLUSTER LIMITED, SESA GOA LIMITED.                      <br /><br /><br />
BLOOM FOUNTAIN LIMITED AND ELENILTO MINERALS AND MINING LLC” as                      <br /><br /><br />
herein recited below word for word in the authentic English Version be, and the      <br /><br /><br />
same is hereby ratified.                                                             <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
SECTION II:    SHORT TITLE:                                                          <br /><br /><br />
This ACT TO RATIFY THE CONCESSION AGREEMENT AMONG THE GOVERNMENT                     <br /><br /><br />
OF THE REPUBLIC OF LIBERIA, WESTERN CLUSTER LIMITED, SESA GOA LIMITED,               <br /><br /><br />
BLOOM FOUNTAIN LIMITED AND ELENILTO MINERALS AND MINING LLC shall                    <br /><br /><br />
also be cited as the WESTERN CLUSTER CONCESSION AGREEMENT.                           <br /><br /><br />
SECTION III:                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
That any and all obligations, covenants, terms and conditions as contained in the    <br /><br /><br />
above mentioned ACT TO RATIFY THE CONCESSION AGREEMENT AMONG THL                     <br /><br /><br />
GOVERNMENT OF THE REPUBLIC OF LIBERIA, WESTERN CLUSTER LIMITED,                      <br /><br /><br />
SESA GOA LIMITED, BLOOM FOUNTAIN LIMITED AND ELENILTO MINERALS                       <br /><br /><br />
AND MINING LLC ALONG WITH ITS ADDENDUMACT TO RATIFY THE                              <br /><br /><br />
CONCESSION AGREEMENT AMONG THE GOVERNMENT OF THE REPUBLIC OF                         <br /><br /><br />
LIBERIA, WESTERN CLUSTER LIMITED, SESA GOA LIMITED, BLOOM                            <br /><br /><br />
FOUNTAIN LIMITED AND ELENILTO MINERALS AND MINING LLC shall be                       <br /><br /><br />
carried to full completion unless otherwise modified, amended or repealed.           <br /><br /><br />
SECTION IV:                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
This Act shall take effect immediately upon the publication into handbill.           <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
ANY LAW TO THE CONTRARY NOTWITHSTANDING.                                             <br /><br /><br />

﻿                                                                :kAL DEVELOPMENT AGREEMENT                                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
                                                 This Mint                Agreement (as hereinafter defined, the “Agreement”') is made     <br /><br /><br />
                                                 the 3rd of,              and among:                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
                                                                iRNMENT OF THE REPUBLIC OF LIBERIA                                         <br /><br /><br />

                                                                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
                                                                WESTERN CLUSTER LIMITED                                                    <br /><br /><br />

                                                                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
                              a corporate under the laws of Liberia (as hereinafter defined, the                                           <br /><br /><br />
                              “Company’’                                                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
                      SESA GOA LIMITED                                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
                      a publicly li,incorporated under the laws of India (“Scsa Goa”).                                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
 BLOOM FOUNTAIN LIMITED                                                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
 a corporatiorider the laws of Mauritius (as hereinafter defined, “Bloom’”).                                                               <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />

                                                                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />

meanings assia in Section 1.                                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
WITNESSET.                                                                                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
A.    Every Njie surface of the ground or in the soil or sub-soil, rivers, water                                                           <br /><br /><br />
courses, waters and continental shelf of Liberia is the property and                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
national Liberia and all rights related to the exploration for and                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
expioit^erals belong exclusively to Liberia.                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
B.    The Goifesircs to encourage the further exploration and development of                                                               <br /><br /><br />
Minerals, and wishes to promote and facilitate the operation of mining                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
eompanifcction therewith.                                                                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
C.    The Go'ilso desires, through the operation of mining companies, to                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
benefit n which Minerals are developed, including facilitating growth                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
centers tttion tor sustainable regional development, to create more                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
cmploynnunities, to encourage and develop local business and ensure                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
that skilbow and technology are transferred to citizens of Liberia, to                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
﻿acquire basic data regarding and related to the country's Mineral resources and to         <br /><br /><br />
preserve and rehabilitate the natural environment for further development of               <br /><br /><br />
Liberia.                                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
D.    On November, 28lh 2008, the Government issued a genera! solicitation for bid         <br /><br /><br />
proposals for the exploration and mining of iron ore in the “Western Cluster Iron          <br /><br /><br />
Ore Deposits” of Liberia, (“Western Cluster Project”) as described in Tender               <br /><br /><br />
Documents dated December 15, 2008.                                                         <br /><br /><br />
E.    On May 15th 2009, Elenifto Minerals & Mining Ltd, a company registered under         <br /><br /><br />
the laws of Anguilla (“Elenilto Anguilla”), submitted a bid in response to the             <br /><br /><br />
Western Cluster Invitation to Bid as set forth in the Bid Proposal of May 15, 2009         <br /><br /><br />
and subsequently in the Clarifications to bid proposals submitted on November              <br /><br /><br />
30,2009;                                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
F.    In December 2009. the Government notified Elenilto Minerals & Mining Ltd that        <br /><br /><br />
its bid had been accepted by (he Government and that Elenilto Minerals &*Mining            <br /><br /><br />
Ltd was determined to be the “Provisional Winner” of the Tender for the                    <br /><br /><br />
Rehabilitation and Development of the Western Cluster Iron Ore Project;                    <br /><br /><br />
G.    In order to cany' out the Western Cluster Iron Ore Project, Elenilto Minerals &      <br /><br /><br />
Mining Ltd formed Western Cluster Limited, a Liberian corporation, as a wholly             <br /><br /><br />
owned subsidiary;                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
H.    Subsequently, Scsa Goa sought to acquire, directly or indirectly, a majority         <br /><br /><br />
interest in the issued and outstanding share capital of the Company from Elenilto          <br /><br /><br />
Minerals & Mining Ltd, and the Government approved the acquisition of such                 <br /><br /><br />
interest by Sesa Goa (or its wholly owned subsidiary);                                     <br /><br /><br />
l. On June 7, 2011, Elenilto Anguilla filed a certificate of conversion with the           <br /><br /><br />
Secretary of State of the Stale of Delaware converting from an Anguillan                   <br /><br /><br />
company to a Delaware limited liability company undej the name “Elenilto                   <br /><br /><br />
Minerals & Mining LLC”;                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
J.    On July 25, 2011, Elenilto, Sesa Goa, the Company, and Bloom Fountain Limited,       <br /><br /><br />
a company formed under the laws of Mauritius (“Bloom”) and a wholly-owned                  <br /><br /><br />
subsidiary of Sesa Goa, have entered into a Share Purchase and Operation                   <br /><br /><br />
Agreement pursuant to which Bloom has acquired title to 51% of the outstanding             <br /><br /><br />
shares of capital stock of the Company and has agreed to have control over the             <br /><br /><br />
management and operations of the business of the Company and the Project;                  <br /><br /><br />
K.    . In compliance with the laws of Liberia, Elenilto shall pay all applicable taxes,   <br /><br /><br />
including withholding tax as provided herein, on the proceeds received in                  <br /><br /><br />
connection with the acquisition by Bloom of a majority interest in the issued and          <br /><br /><br />
outstanding share capital of the Company, and Bloom shall withhold from its                <br /><br /><br />
payment to Elenilto, and remit to the Government, the amount of withholding tax            <br /><br /><br />
required by this Agreement;                                                                <br /><br /><br />
L.    Elenilto, Bloom, and Sesa Goa, as the shareholders or parent thereof, of the         <br /><br /><br />
Company, shall be jointly and severally liable for all obligations of the Company;         <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
 •~N                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
﻿M.    Vtiiii the oojootivo oi the invitation to bid and the lender Documents                 <br /><br /><br />
published by the Government in December of 2008, the Government, Elenilto,                   <br /><br /><br />
Sesa Goa, Bloom, and the Company have entered into this Agreement for the                    <br /><br /><br />
purpose of confirming the terms and conditions under which the Government is                 <br /><br /><br />
willing to grant the Company Exploration Licenses for the Bomi Hills, Bea                    <br /><br /><br />
Mountain and Mano River iron ore deposits and confirming the terms and                       <br /><br /><br />
conditions that will govern the Company’s transition to Class A Mining Licenses              <br /><br /><br />
covering the Bomi Hills, Bea Mountain and Mano River iron ore deposits and its               <br /><br /><br />
operations under such Class A mining licenses.                                               <br /><br /><br />
N.    The Government is willing to grant the Company’s rights with respect to Mineral        <br /><br /><br />
exploration and mining in connection with the referenced deposits on the terms               <br /><br /><br />
and conditions set forth herein, and the Company is willing to accept such rights            <br /><br /><br />
on the terms and conditions set forth herein.                                                <br /><br /><br />
MOW, THEREFORE, the parties hereby agree as follows:                                         <br /><br /><br />
                                     SECTION 1 DEFINITIONS, TERMINOLOGY AND INTERPRETATION   <br /><br /><br />
The following terms wherever used in this Agreement shall have the respective meanings       <br /><br /><br />
set forth below':                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
“Acceptable Third Party Financial Institution’’ means a third party financial institution    <br /><br /><br />
with a long-term credit rating of at least A (or its equivalent) front at least two          <br /><br /><br />
internationally recognized credit-rating agencies.                                           <br /><br /><br />
“Affiliate” of any Person means any other Person that, directly or indirectly, Controls or   <br /><br /><br />
is Controlled by or is under common Control with, such Person.                               <br /><br /><br />
“Afireed Revenue Code” has the meaning given in Section 14.2(a).                             <br /><br /><br />
“Agreement” means this Mineral Development Agreement as well as all schedules and            <br /><br /><br />
exhibits annexed to it, as they may from time to time be amended.                            <br /><br /><br />
“Annual Social Contribution” has the meaning given in Section 8.2(a).                        <br /><br /><br />
“APMT” has the meaning given in Section 6.7(d).                                              <br /><br /><br />
“Big Four Firm” has the meaning given in Section 20.7.                                       <br /><br /><br />
“Bloom” has the meaning given in the preamble to this Agreement.                             <br /><br /><br />
“Business Day” means any day other than a Saturday or Sunday or a holiday declared by        <br /><br /><br />
the Government.                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
“Chairperson of the Winding Up Commission” means the person designated as the                <br /><br /><br />
Chairperson of the Winding Up Commission in accordance with Section 25.7(a).                 <br /><br /><br />
“Chairperson of the National Investment Commission” means the Chairperson of the             <br /><br /><br />
National Investment Commission of the Republic of Liberia.                                   <br /><br /><br />

                                                /                                            <br /><br /><br />
﻿   “Change of Control' means any assignment, sate, or transfer of interest of any type which         <br /><br /><br />
   results in a change in possession of the power to Control the Company, whether such               <br /><br /><br />
   power is vested in a single Person or a Group. A Change of Control of a shareholder               <br /><br /><br />
   (including any Shareholder), member, partner or joint venturer of the Company or of a             <br /><br /><br />
   Group made up of such Persons will constitute a Change of Control of the Company if               <br /><br /><br />
   such shareholder, member, partner, joint venturer or Group can Control the Company.               <br /><br /><br />
   “C1M Code” has the meaning given in the definition of Selected CRIRSCO Code.                      <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
   “Commission” has the meaning given in Section 25.7(a).                                            <br /><br /><br />

   “Company Event of Default” has the meaning given in Section 25.2.                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
   “Competent Person” has the meaning assigned in the Selected CRIRSCO Code, provided                <br /><br /><br />
   that for three years from the Effective Date the term “Competent Person” shall also               <br /><br /><br />
   include a geologist who is a citizen and resident of Liberia with a graduate degree in            <br /><br /><br />
   mineral geology from an internationally recognized geology program who lacks the                  <br /><br /><br />
   professional membership requirements imposed for qualification as a Competent Person              <br /><br /><br />
   under the Selected CRIRSCO Code but who otherwise has a minimum.af five years post¬               <br /><br /><br />
   graduate experience in non-governmental employment relevant to the style of                       <br /><br /><br />
   mineralization and type of deposit or class of deposit under consideration and to the             <br /><br /><br />
   activity which that person is undertaking, provided that (a) if such person is estimating or      <br /><br /><br />
   supervising the estimation of Mineral Resources, the relevant experience shall be in the          <br /><br /><br />
   estimation, assessment and evaluation of Mineral Resources, (b) if such person is                 <br /><br /><br />
   estimating, or supervising the estimation of Mineral Reserves, the relevant experience            <br /><br /><br />
   shall be in the estimation, assessment, evaluation and assessment of the economic                 <br /><br /><br />
   extraction of Mineral Reserves, and (c) such person has certified to the Minister that he         <br /><br /><br />
   has the requisite professional competence in the commodity, type of deposit and situation         <br /><br /><br />
   under consideration.                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
   “Confidential Information” has the meaning given in Section 22.2(a).                              <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
   “Control” (including the terms “Controlled by” and “under common Control with” and                <br /><br /><br />
   “Controls”) means the possession, directly or indirectly, of the power to direct or cause         <br /><br /><br />
   the direction of (or to block action by) the management of a Person. Without limiting the         <br /><br /><br />
   generality of the preceding sentence, the ability to control a Person is presumed to exist if     <br /><br /><br />
   a second Person or Group holds or can direct the exercise of at least 25% of the                  <br /><br /><br />
   Management Rights with respect to such first Person and no third Person or Group holds            <br /><br /><br />
   or can direct the exercise of a percentage of the Management Rights with respect to such          <br /><br /><br />
   first Person that exceeds the percentage of the Management Rights held by such second             <br /><br /><br />
   Person or Group.                                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
   “Controlling Person” has the meaning given in Section 23.11.                                      <br /><br /><br />

“Infrastructure” includes all facilities and, to the extent provided below, equipment,      <br /><br /><br />
constructed or acquired by purchase, lease or otherwise by the Company (other than          <br /><br /><br />
Mining Plant) and used by the Company in connection with Operations (other than in          <br /><br /><br />

breakwaters, terminal facilities and warehouses, and loading and unloading                  <br /><br /><br />
facilities).                                                                                <br /><br /><br />

generating plants and transmission lines, dams, water drains, water supply                  <br /><br /><br />
systems and systems for disposing of tailings, plant waste and sewage).                     <br /><br /><br />
(d)    Immovable public welfare facilities (including schools, clinics and public           <br /><br /><br />
halls).                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />

operation of any of the foregoing (including offices, machine shops,                        <br /><br /><br />
foundries, repair shops, employees’ housing and warehouses).                                <br /><br /><br />

described above.                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
“International Minina Standards” means such practices, methods and acts as are in           <br /><br /><br />
accordance with good standards of skill, diligence, judgment, prudence and foresight        <br /><br /><br />
practiced by prudent professionals employed by leading international firms in the           <br /><br /><br />
international mining industry (for example, firms that are members of the International     <br /><br /><br />
Council on Minerals and Metals), provided that the Government may by Law designate a        <br /><br /><br />
﻿particular uiiernaiionai Mining Standard as being generally applicable to all holders of          <br /><br /><br />
Class A mining licenses or exploration licenses issued under the Mining Law.                      <br /><br /><br />

has a corresponding meaning. “Mine”, when used as a noun, refers to the tangible shafts,          <br /><br /><br />

from the earth.                                                                                   <br /><br /><br />

constitute Infrastructure.                                                                        <br /><br /><br />

require. Headings to the clauses and sections of this Agreement are inserted for            <br /><br /><br />
convenience only and shall not affect its construction. Unless otherwise specifically       <br /><br /><br />

any regulations promulgated thereunder. References to “Sections,” “Appendices,”             <br /><br /><br />
“Schedules” and “Exhibits” without other attribution are references to Sections,            <br /><br /><br />
Appendices, Schedules and Exhibits forming part of this Agreement.                          <br /><br /><br />

reference to a party also includes such party’s permitted assigns or any transferee         <br /><br /><br />
pursuant to Section 23.                                                                     <br /><br /><br />

similar meaning, means this Agreement. The words “and” and “or” will include the            <br /><br /><br />
conjunctive and disjunctive, as the context may require or permit. The word “include”       <br /><br /><br />
(and any variation of that word), without other qualification, means “including but not     <br /><br /><br />
﻿limited io " Tin., Government, the Company and Elenilto have jointly participated in the       <br /><br /><br />
negotiation and drafting of this Agreement and it shall not be construed against any party     <br /><br /><br />
as the drafting party.                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 2 EFFECTIVE DATE                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
2.1    Effective Date.                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
This Agreement, after having first been signed on behalf of the parties as provided on the     <br /><br /><br />
signature pages of this Agreement, shall become effective and be binding on them on the        <br /><br /><br />
date (the ''Effective Date’7-) on which the last of the following conditions have been         <br /><br /><br />
satisfied: (i) attestation of this Agreement by the Minister of Justice, (H) approval of this  <br /><br /><br />
Agreement by the President of the Republic of Liberia, (iii) ratification of this Agreement    <br /><br /><br />
by the National Legislature of the Republic of Liberia (the •‘Legislature’’’), and (iv)        <br /><br /><br />
publication of this Agreement in handbills (at which point this Agreement shall take           <br /><br /><br />
effect as Law). The Ministry and the Ministry of Finance shall provide the Company with        <br /><br /><br />
a certificate signed by representatives of the Ministry of Finance- and the Ministry           <br /><br /><br />
certifying that the events described in clauses (i) through (iv) of the foregoing sentence     <br /><br /><br />
have occurred.                                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
2.2    Acquisition of Shares.                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
According to the terms of the Stock Purchaser and Operation Agreement executed                 <br /><br /><br />
between Sesa Goa, Elenilto, Bloom and the Company, Bloom has acquired legal and                <br /><br /><br />
beneficial ownership of 51% of the outstanding shares of capital stock of the Company          <br /><br /><br />
and simultaneously therewith, Bloom has transferred an amount of $90,000,000 (Ninety           <br /><br /><br />
Million United States Dollars only) to an escrow account opened with JP Morgan,                <br /><br /><br />
London Branch according to the terms of a cash escrow agreement executed between               <br /><br /><br />
Bloom, Elenilto and JP Morgan. In parallel. Bloom and Elenilto have also executed a            <br /><br /><br />
document escrow agreement under which, Bloom and Elenilto have deposited certain               <br /><br /><br />
documents, including the Up-Front Payment Guarantee that was deposited by Bloom.               <br /><br /><br />
Immediately and in any event within 2 (two) days after ratification and prior to the           <br /><br /><br />
Effective Dale, the Government shall, through the Minister of Justice, issue the valid         <br /><br /><br />
release notices under the above two escrow agreements. Forms of the valid release notices      <br /><br /><br />
are attached hereto as Exhibits 11A and 1 IB,                                                  <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 3 TERM OF THE AGREEMENT                                                                <br /><br /><br />
The term of this Agreement commences on the Effective Date. The initial term of this           <br /><br /><br />
Agreement is 25 years, subject to earlier termination as provided in this Agreement, and       <br /><br /><br />
will be automatically extended to match any extension under Section 5.10(a) of the term        <br /><br /><br />
of any Mining License.                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 4 EXPLORATION LICENSE; INTERIM EXPLORATION                                             <br /><br /><br />
RIGHTS; PRE-FEASIBILITY STUDY                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
4.1 Exploration Licenses.                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
 Not later than ninety (90) days after the Effective Date, the Company shall be                <br /><br /><br />
 granted Exploration Licenses for each of the Exploration Areas (as specified                  <br /><br /><br />
﻿herein or in accordance with the Exploration Regulations). 'I he terms of the   <br /><br /><br />
respective Exploration Licenses (the “Exploration Period” under the Exploration <br /><br /><br />
Regulations) shall terminate as scheduled below,                                <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
(a)    The Exploration License for the Bomi Deposit shall terminate on the      <br /><br /><br />
third (3/H) anniversary of the Effective Date.                                  <br /><br /><br />
(b)    The Exploration License for the Mano River Deposit shall terminate on    <br /><br /><br />
the fifth (5th) anniversary' of the Effective Date; and                         <br /><br /><br />
(c)    The Exploration License for the Bea Mountain Deposit shall terminate     <br /><br /><br />
on the seventh (7,?!) anniversary of the Effective Date.                        <br /><br /><br />
All of the above Exploration Licenses may be extended in accordance with the    <br /><br /><br />
Mining Law or the Exploration Regulations.                                      <br /><br /><br />
Exploration Rights.                                                             <br /><br /><br />
(a)    During the Exploration Period, the Company shall have exclusive right to <br /><br /><br />
conduct Exploration for Iron Ore within the Exploration Area.                   <br /><br /><br />
(b)    The Company shall conduct Exploration within the Exploration Area in     <br /><br /><br />
compliance with the Exploration Regulations, including Section 7 thereof,       <br /><br /><br />
and this Agreement, notwithstanding any conflicting provisions of the           <br /><br /><br />
Exploration License. Unless expressly otherwise. provided in this               <br /><br /><br />
Agreement, if there is a conflict between the terms of the Exploration          <br /><br /><br />
Regulations and the terms of this Agreement, the terms of this Agreement        <br /><br /><br />
shall control.                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
(c)    The rights of the Company to conduct Exploration under this Agreement    <br /><br /><br />
are limited to exploration for Iron Ore.                                        <br /><br /><br />
(d)    During the Exploration Period the Company may conduct only such          <br /><br /><br />
Exploration as does not require the filing with or application to, or the       <br /><br /><br />
obtaining of any consent, approval, license or permit from, the EPA unless      <br /><br /><br />
such filing or application has duly occurred and any such consent,              <br /><br /><br />
approval, license or permit has been duly obtained; provided that if EPA        <br /><br /><br />
fails to act timely, (he Minister upon notice by the Company of such            <br /><br /><br />
failure may permit continued Exploration until such time as the EPA does        <br /><br /><br />
act. A copy of each such consent, approval, license or permit obtained by       <br /><br /><br />
the Company from the EPA shall be promptly filed with the Minister. For         <br /><br /><br />
clarity, the Company may commence Exploration in the Exploration Area           <br /><br /><br />
following issuance of the Exploration License, provided that the Company        <br /><br /><br />
has complied with the Exploration Regulations.                                  <br /><br /><br />
(e)    Within no more than 120 days following the Effective Date, and no later  <br /><br /><br />
than the date of submission of the Company’s Exploration Program, the           <br /><br /><br />
Company shall provide the Government a project linkages plan which (i)          <br /><br /><br />
identifies the potentials for local suppliers, contractors and service          <br /><br /><br />
providers to service the Project, (ii) identifies key interventions to grow the <br /><br /><br />
minerals input industrial sector, and (iii) sets out a project local purchase   <br /><br /><br />
﻿                            plan with clear milestones identified in terms of an increasing percentage                         <br /><br /><br />
                            of local purchases of goods and services, and providing for bidding                                <br /><br /><br />
                            preferences for local suppliers, contractors and service providers (provided                       <br /><br /><br />
                            that such Persons offer quality, terms, delivery, service, quantity and price                      <br /><br /><br />
                            at least comparable to those obtainable from other sources) (the                                   <br /><br /><br />
                            “Exploration Period Project Linkages Plan”), The Company shall update                              <br /><br /><br />
                            the Exploration Period Project Linkages Plan once every 12 months during                           <br /><br /><br />
                            the Exploration Period.                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
4.3    Retained Production Areas.                                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
In addition to designation of Proposed Production Areas in accordance with                                                     <br /><br /><br />
Section 5.1(a), prior to tire expiry of the Exploration Period, the Company may :                                              <br /><br /><br />
also nominate an area of Land for the purposes of access to and from the Proposed                                              <br /><br /><br />
Production Areas, the development and operation of Infrastructure, or as                                                       <br /><br /><br />
reasonably required in connection with existing and future Operations, including                                               <br /><br /><br />
reasonable buffer zones around Proposed Production Areas (“Retained Production                                                 <br /><br /><br />
Areas"). Any such Retained Production Areas shall be deemed to be part of the                                                  <br /><br /><br />
applicable Proposed Production Area and shall be subject to the rights and                                                     <br /><br /><br />
obligations set out under this Agreement (other than the Company’s right to                                                    <br /><br /><br />
conduct Exploration in such Retained Production Areas).                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
4.4    Termination of Exploration Rights and Lapse of Exploration Area.                                                        <br /><br /><br />
Except as provided in Section 5.1(d) with respect to Exploration conducted in a                                                <br /><br /><br />
Proposed Production Area timely designated in compliance with the requirements                                                 <br /><br /><br />
of Sections 5.1(a) and 5.1(b), from and after the expiration of the Exploration                                                <br /><br /><br />
Period the Company shall have no further rights under this Agreement or any                                                    <br /><br /><br />
prior agreement with or license or permit from the Government with respect to                                                  <br /><br /><br />
any portion of the Exploration Area other than that encompassed by Proposed                                                    <br /><br /><br />
Production Areas timely designated in compliance with the requirements of                                                      <br /><br /><br />
Sections 5.1(a) and 5.1(b) (such portion(s) in which the Company no longer has                                                 <br /><br /><br />
rights, the “Relinquished Area"). Unless otherwise permitted by the Government,                                                <br /><br /><br />
the Company shall, within a reasonable period, but not to exceed ISO days after                                                <br /><br /><br />
the expiration of the Exploration Period, cause the removal and proper disposal of                                             <br /><br /><br />
any property used by the Company or any of its contractors that is located on the                                              <br /><br /><br />
Relinquished Area.                                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
4.5    Third Party Rights in the Exploration Area.                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
The Company acknowledges that the Government may grant rights to one or more                                                   <br /><br /><br />
third parties to Explore for gold and other Minerals (but not, for the avoidance of                                            <br /><br /><br />
doubt. Iron Ore) in the Exploration Area, subject to the Company and each such                                                 <br /><br /><br />
third party working in good faith to reach agreement with respect to the conduct of                                            <br /><br /><br />
 their respective activities in the Exploration Area. The Company agrees that it                                               <br /><br /><br />
1 will engage in negotiations with any third party seeking such Exploration rights                                             <br /><br /><br />
regarding the conduct of their respective activities in the Exploration Area and                                               <br /><br /><br />
shall conduct such negotiations in good faith with the goal of reaching an                                                     <br /><br /><br />
agreement that is reasonably acceptable to the Company and such third party. The                                               <br /><br /><br />
Company agrees that, if the Company and such third party fail to reach such an                                                 <br /><br /><br />
﻿agreement, the Company will submit to an independent dispute resolution process          <br /><br /><br />
with such third party, which process shall be reasonable in light of the                 <br /><br /><br />
circumstances, including the financial resources of the third party. The Company         <br /><br /><br />
acknowledges that the Government shall have no obligation to intervene on behalf         <br /><br /><br />
of the Company in any dispute between the Company and such third party,                  <br /><br /><br />
whether in connection with such negotiations or otherwise, but may intervene to          <br /><br /><br />
help resolve such dispute.                                                               <br /><br /><br />
4.6 Pre-Feasibility Report,                                                              <br /><br /><br />
The Company agrees that it will prepare, in good faith and in accordance with            <br /><br /><br />
( International Mining Standards, a study in accordance with the requirements set        <br /><br /><br />
forth below and in Schedule 2 attached hereto (the “Pre-Feasibility Report”) to be       <br /><br /><br />
submitted together with its notice designating a Proposed Production Area                <br /><br /><br />
pursuant to Section 5.1. The Pre-Feasibility Report will include (i) preliminary         <br /><br /><br />
engineering studies and financial analysis regarding the route selection, design,        <br /><br /><br />
investment requirements and other relevant factors to permit the construction of         <br /><br /><br />
the Railroad and the rehabilitation of the leased areas in the Port, as described in     <br /><br /><br />
Section 6.7(c), (h) an evaluation of the feasibility, from technical and financial       <br /><br /><br />
standpoints, of different power generation alternatives that will enable the             <br /><br /><br />
Company to comply with its obligations under Section 19.3, and (in) an                   <br /><br /><br />
evaluation, from technical and financial standpoints, of downstream processing           <br /><br /><br />
alternatives, such evaluation to include pelletisation and iron-making. For the          <br /><br /><br />
purposes hereof, “preliminary”, means (i) with respect to any resource estimate          <br /><br /><br />
that will comprise part .of the Pre-Feasibility Report, the CRIRSCO Indicated            <br /><br /><br />
Resource standard and (ii) with respect to all other engineering studies in the Pre-     <br /><br /><br />
Feasibility Report, the Association for the Advancement of Cost Engineering Inc.         <br /><br /><br />
(AACE) Ciass 3 estimate standards or equivalent, specifically accuracy range of          <br /><br /><br />
±20%, with 5-15% of engineering completed, and 15-20% contingency. The Pre-              <br /><br /><br />
Feasibility Report for the Bomi and Mano River Deposits will be completed, and a         <br /><br /><br />
copy thereof will be provided to the Government no later than the second                 <br /><br /><br />
f anniversary of the Effective Date, while the Pre-Feasibility Report tor the Bea        <br /><br /><br />
Mountain Deposit will be completed and a copy provided to the Government no              <br /><br /><br />
later than the third anniversary of the Effective Date, it being understood the Pre-     <br /><br /><br />
Feasibility Report will be provided for informational purposes only and not              <br /><br /><br />
subject to approval by the Government. The parties shall discuss in good faith           <br /><br /><br />
which of any of the power generation alternatives described in clause (ii) of the        <br /><br /><br />
second sentence of this Section 4.6 indicated in the Pre-Feasibility Report as           <br /><br /><br />
feasible will be evaluated further as part of the Feasibility Report and select one of   <br /><br /><br />
such alternatives for such further evaluation.                                           <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 5 MINING LICENSES                                                                <br /><br /><br />
5.1    Designation of Proposed Production Areas and Application for a Minina License,    <br /><br /><br />
(a) If the Company identifies potentially exploitable Iron Ore deposits in the           <br /><br /><br />
Exploration Area of a type covered by its Exploration License with respect               <br /><br /><br />
to such Exploration Area that constitute Indicated Mineral Resources, it                 <br /><br /><br />
may designate by notice to the Minister that all or one or more portions of              <br /><br /><br />
the Exploration Area are proposed production areas (each, a “Proposed                    <br /><br /><br />
Production Area”). The Company may give more than one notice under                       <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
 '"i \                                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
﻿:.!n.s Section 5. J;a), provided (hat, except as pcnuiUed pursuai*. !o Sections <br /><br /><br />
5.3(a) and 5.4, no such notice may be given with respect to any portion of      <br /><br /><br />
the Exploration Area at any time following the expiration of the                <br /><br /><br />
Exploration Period of the Exploration License. Each such notice shall set       <br /><br /><br />
forth:                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
(i)    the proposed boundaries of each Proposed Production Area                 <br /><br /><br />
covered by such notice,                                                         <br /><br /><br />
(ii)    the nature, location and estimated quality of the Iron Ore              <br /><br /><br />
constituting the Indicated Mineral Resource in such Proposed                    <br /><br /><br />
Production Area and                                                             <br /><br /><br />
(iii)    the form in which the Product(s) of the Iron Ore are expected to be    <br /><br /><br />
marketed by the Company.                                                        <br /><br /><br />
Each notice with respect to a Proposed Production Area shall be                 <br /><br /><br />
accompanied by (y) the report of a Competent Person setting forth his or        <br /><br /><br />
her conclusion that the deposit(s) constitute Indicated Mineral Resources,      <br /><br /><br />
and the basis for such conclusion, in the form required by the selected         <br /><br /><br />
CRIRSCO Code for the public reporting of Mineral Resources, and setting         <br /><br /><br />
forth the scope of any Iron Ore constituting Inferred Mineral Resources         <br /><br /><br />
located within the Proposed Production Area, and (z) evidence of payment        <br /><br /><br />
of the processing fee required by Section 16.1(a).                              <br /><br /><br />
Except as provided in Section 5.3(a), if no notice designating a Proposed       <br /><br /><br />
Production Area in compliance with the requirements of this Section 5.1(a)      <br /><br /><br />
and Section 5.1(b) is delivered to the Minister on or before the expiration     <br /><br /><br />
of the Exploration Period of the Exploration License, then such                 <br /><br /><br />
Exploration License shall automatically terminate without requirement of        <br /><br /><br />
action by the Minister or the Government. For the avoidance of doubt, the       <br /><br /><br />
termination of any single Exploration License shall not affect the              <br /><br /><br />
Company’s right to carry on Exploration and Operations in connection            <br /><br /><br />
with the remaining Exploration Areas or Production Areas, as the case           <br /><br /><br />
may be. that are not covered by the Exploration License so terminated. If       <br /><br /><br />
all of the Exploration Licenses have been terminated pursuant to this           <br /><br /><br />
Section 5.1, then this Agreement shall automatically terminate without          <br /><br /><br />
requirement of action by the Minister or the Government.                        <br /><br /><br />
Each Proposed Production Area (i) shall consist of such part of the             <br /><br /><br />
Exploration Area as in the light of Internationa! Mining Standards is           <br /><br /><br />
reasonable, taking into account the extent and nature of the Iron Ore or        <br /><br /><br />
other Mineral constituting Mineral Resources, for the mining and recovery       <br /><br /><br />
of such Mineral Resources, including the Retained Production Areas, and         <br /><br /><br />
(ii) shall form a compact block as much as possible, with the borders           <br /><br /><br />
aligned to the true north-south and east-west. A Proposed Production Area       <br /><br /><br />
may not include Land (i) located within the boundaries of any cities,           <br /><br /><br />
commonwealth districts, municipal districts, cemeteries, transportation or      <br /><br /><br />
communication facilities, aqueducts, military base, port, Poro or Sande         <br /><br /><br />
grounds, and other grounds reserved for public purposes, except with the        <br /><br /><br />
consent of the officials authorized to administer or control the affairs of     <br /><br /><br />
﻿silk's •mtuics, and .subject to such special terms uu'J i>aai;-ic conditions   <br /><br /><br />
as may be prescribed for the protection of surface users; (ii) the use of      <br /><br /><br />
which for Mining operations would violate Section 10.1 of the Mining           <br /><br /><br />
Law; or (iii) as otherwise reasonably agreed by the parties. A Proposed        <br /><br /><br />
Production Area may not include surface areas other than the surface           <br /><br /><br />
above the Iron Ore constituting Indicated and Inferred Mineral Resources       <br /><br /><br />
and any additional Land reasonably required for the extraction from the        <br /><br /><br />
earth of such resources. If other land is required to facilitate the           <br /><br /><br />
processing of extracted Iron Ore, the disposition of waste materials or        <br /><br /><br />
other activities not constituting actual extraction, the Company may           <br /><br /><br />
acquire that land as provided in Section 7,3.                                  <br /><br /><br />
(c)    The Company shall submit to the Government, within 60 days following    <br /><br /><br />
the notice given under Section 5.1(a), detailed maps for each Proposed         <br /><br /><br />
Production Area covered by such notice, based on actual surveys using the      <br /><br /><br />
most current technology, that, with respect to a Proposed Production Area,     <br /><br /><br />
set forth the boundaries and coordinates of the area containing the deposits   <br /><br /><br />
from which Iron Ore is expected to be Mined. The maps shall be of such         <br /><br /><br />
scale and contain such detail, including geographical and topographical        <br /><br /><br />
information, (x) as may reasonably be necessary to identify accurately the     <br /><br /><br />
boundaries of the Iron Ore constituting Indicated and Inferred Mineral         <br /><br /><br />
Resources within such Proposed Production Area and (y) as may otherwise        <br /><br /><br />
reasonably be required by the Liberian Geological Survey for the mapping       <br /><br /><br />
.....    of such Proposed Production Area.                                     <br /><br /><br />
(d)    If the Company wishes to carry out additional Exploration within a      <br /><br /><br />
Proposed Production Area it may do so, provided that the work is covered       <br /><br /><br />
by an exploration work program that has been approved under the terms of       <br /><br /><br />
the Exploration Regulations. No budget or annual expenditure                   <br /><br /><br />
requirements apply to such work, but all other provisions of the               <br /><br /><br />
Exploration Regulations as to the manner of carrying out such work and as      <br /><br /><br />
to reporting the results of such work remain applicable.                       <br /><br /><br />
5.2 The Feasibility Report                                                     <br /><br /><br />
(a) Unless the Company has complied with Sections 5.4(a) and (b)               <br /><br /><br />
(implementing the “marginal deposit” provisions of Section 5.3(1) of the       <br /><br /><br />
Mining Law), the Company shall within 18 months of the dale of                 <br /><br /><br />
designation of an area as a Proposed Production Area, file with the            <br /><br /><br />
Minister, the following:                                                       <br /><br /><br />
(i) a plan for the design, production and operation of efficient and           <br /><br /><br />
economic Mining, processing, rail transport, port loading, shipping            <br /><br /><br />
and marketing of Products from such Proposed Production Area                   <br /><br /><br />
prepared by an internationally recognized mine engineering                     <br /><br /><br />
consulting firm not affiliated with the Company or any of its                  <br /><br /><br />
principal direct or indirect shareholders (the “Feasibility                    <br /><br /><br />
Consultant”) substantially complying with Sections 5.6 through 5.8             <br /><br /><br />
(such plan, together with any and all amendments thereto, the                  <br /><br /><br />
“Feasibility Report”), and                                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
 i                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
﻿{i mi application for a Class A mining iicoiw. or an amendment to an          <br /><br /><br />
application for a Class A mining license or an amendment to a                 <br /><br /><br />
Mining License, as the case may be, to permit the mining of such              <br /><br /><br />
deposits in the form required by the Mining Law and such                      <br /><br /><br />
Regulations as are then in effect; and                                        <br /><br /><br />
(iii) a certificate of the chief executive officer of the Company dated the   <br /><br /><br />
dale of submission to the effect that (x) the Company has complied            <br /><br /><br />
through the date of such certificate in all material respects with its        <br /><br /><br />
obligations under this Agreement (except as to such defaults in the           <br /><br /><br />
performance by the Company of any of such obligations that have               <br /><br /><br />
been cured to the reasonable satisfaction of, or waived by, the               <br /><br /><br />
Minister), and (y) the Company is prepared to develop the Mine,               <br /><br /><br />
Mining Plant and Infrastructure in the manner set forth in the                <br /><br /><br />
Feasibility Report (other than as may reasonably be required to               <br /><br /><br />
respond to facts and circumstances not known to the Company at                <br /><br /><br />
the time the Feasibility Report was Filed), and setting forth the             <br /><br /><br />
manner in which the Company proposes to finance the construction              <br /><br /><br />
and acquisition of the Mine, the Mining Plant, the Infrastructure             <br /><br /><br />
and the related equipment (including the proposed proximate and               <br /><br /><br />
ultimate sources of such funds).                                              <br /><br /><br />
Except as otherwise provided in Section 5.3(a), the Company’s rights in       <br /><br /><br />
any Proposed Production Area timely designated under.and in compliance        <br /><br /><br />
with the requirements of Section 5.1(a) and (b) expire if the Company docs    <br /><br /><br />
not timely file.the maps required by Section 5.1(c) or does not timely file   <br /><br /><br />
the Feasibility Report and related materials as provided in this Section      <br /><br /><br />
5.2(a) and in Section 5.2(b).                                                 <br /><br /><br />
The Feasibility Report required by Section 5.2(a) shall be accompanied        <br /><br /><br />
by evidence of (he payment by the Company of the processing fee               <br /><br /><br />
f required by Section 16.1 (b).                                               <br /><br /><br />
If the Company proposes to produce Products from two or more separate         <br /><br /><br />
sites using similar extraction techniques and shared processing or            <br /><br /><br />
beneficiation facilities, a single Feasibility Report shall be required and a <br /><br /><br />
single Mining License shall be issued covering all such sites, subject to     <br /><br /><br />
the approval of the Minister of Finance for the treatment of such             <br /><br /><br />
operations and facilities as a single “mining project” under the Revenue      <br /><br /><br />
Code. If the Company proposes to use materially different extraction          <br /><br /><br />
techniques or substantially independent processing or beneficiation           <br /><br /><br />
facilities for separate mining sites, separate Mining Licenses and            <br /><br /><br />
Feasibility Reports shall be required for each site. Notwithstanding the      <br /><br /><br />
foregoing, nothing in this section 5.2 (c) shall require the approval of the  <br /><br /><br />
Minister of Finance for the treatment of any operations and facilities as a   <br /><br /><br />
single “mining project” where such operations and facilities are treated      <br /><br /><br />
as a single “mining project” pursuant to Section 5.2(d).                      <br /><br /><br />
Provided that the Company is using “shared infrastructure facilities” for     <br /><br /><br />
their operations, all operations covered and facilities shared by one or      <br /><br /><br />
more Mining Licenses granted in respect of the MDA shall be treated as        <br /><br /><br />
﻿ • ..ingle ‘ mining pi - >jcc: tor the purposes of the Revenue Code. As           <br /><br /><br />
 used herein, the Company shah be deemed to be using “shared                      <br /><br /><br />
 infrastructure facilities” for operations covered by more than one Mining        <br /><br /><br />
 License if such operations under the applicable Mining Licenses share            <br /><br /><br />
 the use of significant components of the Infrastructure, including shared        <br /><br /><br />
 use of rail, port, or processing plant Infrastructure.                           <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
 (e) If multiple Mining Licenses are required by Section 5.2(c), and the          <br /><br /><br />
 Company is not using shared infrastructure facilities for their operations,      <br /><br /><br />
 the Ministry will notify the Ministry of Finance of the applications of the      <br /><br /><br />
 Company, and the Minister of Finance is entitled to impose such                  <br /><br /><br />
 conditions upon such Mining Licenses as the Minister of Finance                  <br /><br /><br />
 reasonably deems necessary to comply with Revenue Code requirements              <br /><br /><br />
 of separating the costs and expenses of separate “mining projects”. The          <br /><br /><br />
 Minister of Finance reserves the right to require that a separate company        <br /><br /><br />
 be formed to hold each Mining License and related assets if it determines        <br /><br /><br />
 that to be the most appropriate means of separating the costs and                <br /><br /><br />
 expenses of separate “mining projects”.                                          <br /><br /><br />
