5.3    Extension Of The Due Dates For Filing Notices And Feasibility Report       <br /><br /><br />
(a)    The Company may extend for a period of six months cither but not both of   <br /><br /><br />
(i)    the time for designating Proposed Production Areas in compliance           <br /><br /><br />
with Sections 5. J(a) and (b) or                                                  <br /><br /><br />
(ii)    the time for filing the Feasibility Report and the related materials      <br /><br /><br />
required by Sections 5.2(a) and (b)                                               <br /><br /><br />
by payment., at least 30 days prior to the expiration of the time period          <br /><br /><br />
otherwise applicable, of the extension fee provided for in Section 16.1(c)        <br /><br /><br />
or (d), respectively, provided that the Company may not utilize for any           <br /><br /><br />
Proposed Production Area both the postponement provided for in clause             <br /><br /><br />
(ii) of this Section 5.3(a) and thd postponement provided for in Section          <br /><br /><br />
5.4.                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
(b)    If, as contemplated by Section 5.1(a), the Company has timely designated   <br /><br /><br />
more than one Proposed Production Area within a single Exploration Area,          <br /><br /><br />
but believes that development of one or more of such areas should be              <br /><br /><br />
postponed as provided in Section 5.4, it may file a Feasibility Report with       <br /><br /><br />
respect to the areas initially to be developed and postpone the filing of a       <br /><br /><br />
Feasibility Report for the other areas by complying as to those areas with        <br /><br /><br />
the provisions of Section 5.4.                                                    <br /><br /><br />
5.4    Postponement of Feasibility Report.                                        <br /><br /><br />
(a) If the Company believes that the “marginal deposit” provisions of Section     <br /><br /><br />
5.3(1) of the Mining Law are applicable to the Iron Ore resources                 <br /><br /><br />
contained in a Proposed Production Area, and has not theretofore obtained         <br /><br /><br />
an extension under clause (ii) of Section 5.3(a), it may apply to the             <br /><br /><br />
                                     \ i    CV-                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
﻿ Mini.-.O'- T, accordance '.vitli Section 5.3(1) ul the Mining Law within 12        <br /><br /><br />
 months of the date of designation of such Proposed Production Area under           <br /><br /><br />
 Section 5.1(a) for postponement of the obligation to deliver a Feasibility         <br /><br /><br />
 Report and related materials under Sections 5.2(a) and (b) for up to two           <br /><br /><br />
 years. The application shall be accompanied by                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
 (i) a certificate of a Competent Person to the effect that in his or her           <br /><br /><br />
 reasonable judgment sufficient information is available about the                  <br /><br /><br />
 Mineral Resource involved to conclude that it is not exploitable                   <br /><br /><br />
 under current technical and economic conditions, and the                           <br /><br /><br />
 production from such deposit cannot reasonably be expected to be                   <br /><br /><br />
 sold on commercially viable terms for a period of at least two years               <br /><br /><br />
 (plus a reasonable period for Mine and Mining Plant construction)                  <br /><br /><br />
 from the date on which the Feasibility Report is otherwise required                <br /><br /><br />
 to be filed under Section 5.2(a), and                                              <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
(ii) a certificate of the chief executive officer of the Company to the             <br /><br /><br />
effect that the Company has given the Competent Person referred                     <br /><br /><br />
to in clause (i) of this Section 5.4(a) all information available to the            <br /><br /><br />
Company relating to a determination as to the scope and other                       <br /><br /><br />
characteristics of the Mineral Resources included in the such                       <br /><br /><br />
Proposed Production Area.                                                           <br /><br /><br />
(b) The Minister shall approve the application unless the Company is at the         <br /><br /><br />
time in default in the performance of its obligations under this Agreement          <br /><br /><br />
in a material respect. Any such delay period, if approved, will operate to          <br /><br /><br />
extend the due date of the Feasibility Report to be filed under Section             <br /><br /><br />
5.2(a) for a period of two years from the date originally due under Section         <br /><br /><br />
5.2(a) or such lesser period of time as is requested by the Company.                <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
(c)    Not more than 180 and not less than 90 days prior to the end of the initial  <br /><br /><br />
delay period, the Company may apply for a second delay period of up to              <br /><br /><br />
two years upon complying in full with the requirements of Section 5.4(a)            <br /><br /><br />
as though they were applicable by their terms to a second delay period.             <br /><br /><br />
(d)    In order to retain its rights in a Proposed Production Area following an     <br /><br /><br />
approval by the Minister of a delay period, the Company:                            <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
(i)    shall pay (in addition to (he surface rent payable with respect to           <br /><br /><br />
such Proposed Production Area as provided in the Revenue Code)                      <br /><br /><br />
an annual postponement fee for each year of the delay, as                           <br /><br /><br />
determined in Section 16.1 (d), and                                                 <br /><br /><br />
(ii)    shall file the Feasibility Report, and related materials required by        <br /><br /><br />
Sections 5.2(a) and (b) applicable to such Proposed Production                      <br /><br /><br />
Area prior to the end of the delay period (or the second delay                      <br /><br /><br />
period, if applicable).                                                             <br /><br /><br />
(e) If a payment due under Section 5.4(d)(i) is not made when due, or if a          <br /><br /><br />
Feasibility Report, and related materials complying with Sections 5.2(a)            <br /><br /><br />
and (b) and applicable to such Proposed Production Area are not filed               <br /><br /><br />
﻿win. ri Jv.c pursuant tu Section 5.4fd)(ii), and such default is not cured         <br /><br /><br />
within the applicable cure period provided in Section 25.2, all rights of the      <br /><br /><br />
Company to such Proposed Production Area shall terminate.                          <br /><br /><br />
(f) If the Company elects to develop one or more of the areas as to which          <br /><br /><br />
development has been postponed as provided in this Section 5.4, it shall           <br /><br /><br />
timely file a new Feasibility Report encompassing its entire operation and         <br /><br /><br />
otherwise complying with the requirements of this Agreement governing              <br /><br /><br />
the filing and approval of Feasibility Reports. This requirement is to             <br /><br /><br />
ensure that the financial and technical capacity of the Company and the            <br /><br /><br />
environmental, social and other impacts of the proposed enlarged                   <br /><br /><br />
operation are considered in their entirety and not on a piecemeal basis.           <br /><br /><br />
The new Feasibility Report shall reflect the actual state of facts as of its       <br /><br /><br />
date with respect to the development contemplated by the original                  <br /><br /><br />
Feasibility Report, and may not merely incorporate the relevant provisions         <br /><br /><br />
of the initial Feasibility Report. If the new Feasibility Report is filed          <br /><br /><br />
before the original Feasibility Report is approved, it shall be deemed to          <br /><br /><br />
replace the original Feasibility Report. If it is filed at a later date, it shall  <br /><br /><br />
be deemed an amendment of the original Feasibility Report.                         <br /><br /><br />
Mining License.                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
The Minister will grant the Company a Class A mining license for the Mining of     <br /><br /><br />
the Iron Ore proposed to be extracted from each Proposed Production Area subject   <br /><br /><br />
to the satisfaction of the following requirements:                                 <br /><br /><br />
(a)    The Company timely complied with the requirements of Sections 5.1(a)        <br /><br /><br />
through (c).                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
(b)    The Company has not been notified by the Government that it is in default   <br /><br /><br />
in any material respect in the performance of its obligations under this           <br /><br /><br />
Agreement or under the Exploration Regulations except as to such defaults          <br /><br /><br />
as have been cured to the reasonable satisfaction of, or waived by, the            <br /><br /><br />
Government.                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
(c)    The Company has timely submitted a Feasibility Report, in accordance        <br /><br /><br />
with Sections 5.2(a) and (b) that complies with the requirements of                <br /><br /><br />
Sections 5.6 through 5.8, and the Feasibility Report has been approved by          <br /><br /><br />
the Minister pursuant to Section 5.9.                                              <br /><br /><br />
(d)    The Company and the Government have entered into an Environmental           <br /><br /><br />
Restoration Obligations Funding Agreement or the Company has furnished             <br /><br /><br />
the Environmental Restoration Obligations Guarantee.                               <br /><br /><br />
(c) The Company has furnished the Mining Guarantee.                                <br /><br /><br />
If the Company elected to postpone in accordance with Section 5.4 the submission   <br /><br /><br />
of a Feasibility Report, for one or more but less than all of such Proposed        <br /><br /><br />
Production Areas as contemplated by Section 5.3(b), on approval of the amended     <br /><br /><br />
Feasibility Report as contemplated by Section 5.4(f), the Minister shall amend the <br /><br /><br />
Mining License issued in connection with the original Feasibility Report (if       <br /><br /><br />
﻿previously issued) if the foregoing clauses (b) through (d) have been complied      <br /><br /><br />
with as applicable to the expanded project contemplated by the amended              <br /><br /><br />
Feasibility Report.                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
Any Mining License issued pursuant to this Agreement shall recite that it is issued <br /><br /><br />
subject to the terms and conditions contained in such Mining License and this       <br /><br /><br />
Agreement, and that it is not assignable or transferable in any way other than as   <br /><br /><br />
permitted by the terms of this Agreement.                                           <br /><br /><br />
Any failure by the Government to give notice in accordance with Section 5.5(b)      <br /><br /><br />
shall not affect the Government’s rights and remedies under this Agreement to the   <br /><br /><br />
extent the Company was in default in a material respect in the performance of its   <br /><br /><br />
obligations or the discharge of its liabilities under this Agreement or under the   <br /><br /><br />
Exploration Regulations which have not been cured to the reasonable satisfaction    <br /><br /><br />
of, or waived by, the Government.                                                   <br /><br /><br />
Components of the Feasibility Report.                                               <br /><br /><br />
(a) The Feasibility Report for a Proposed Production Area shall comply with         <br /><br /><br />
applicable Law and International Mining Standards, shall include the basic          <br /><br /><br />
technical and linancial components described in this Section 5.6(a) and             <br /><br /><br />
shall also include the additional components set forth in Sections 5.6(b)           <br /><br /><br />
through (g):                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
(i)    "" a description of the Iron Ore to be Mined, the Mining and                 <br /><br /><br />
processing methods proposed to be used, and the quality of the                      <br /><br /><br />
Produces) to be marketed;                                                           <br /><br /><br />
(ii)    a statement of the expected Production rates lor the Iron Ore to be         <br /><br /><br />
Mined over the term of the Mining License and for the output of                     <br /><br /><br />
the expected Product(s);                                                            <br /><br /><br />
(iii)    a report of a Competent Person setting forth his or her conclusion         <br /><br /><br />
as to the amount of Iron Ore constituting the Proven Mineral                        <br /><br /><br />
Reserves and Probable. Mineral Reserves in the Proposed                             <br /><br /><br />
Production Area, and die basis for such conclusion, and at die                      <br /><br /><br />
election of the Company, in the form required by the selected                       <br /><br /><br />
CRIRSCO Code for the public reporting of Mineral Resources;                         <br /><br /><br />
(iv)    a development plan setting forth the basic design and operating             <br /><br /><br />
specifications for each proposed Mine and related Mining Plant,                     <br /><br /><br />
Infrastructure and equipment (the “Development Plan”!. which                        <br /><br /><br />
shall, among other things,                                                          <br /><br /><br />
(1)    implement the requirements of Sections 6.6, 6.7 and 19.3;                    <br /><br /><br />
(2)    include maps at the scale required by the Ministry setting                   <br /><br /><br />
forth the proposed location of each proposed Mine and                               <br /><br /><br />
related Mining Plant and Infrastructure, and any other                              <br /><br /><br />
activities or improvements described in Section 6.7(e) or                           <br /><br /><br />
II .6 of the Mining Law and, in the case of each activity                           <br /><br /><br />
﻿referred to in Section 6.7(e) or Section 11.6(c), (e) or (f) of            <br /><br /><br />
the Mining Law, setting forth the capacity expected to be                  <br /><br /><br />
available for public utilization, provided that activities                 <br /><br /><br />
described in Section 11.6(a) or 11.6(b) of the Mining Law                  <br /><br /><br />
shall be limited to those reasonably necessary for the                     <br /><br /><br />
implementation of the Development Plan;                                    <br /><br /><br />
(3)    include a capital development plan (in reasonable detail);          <br /><br /><br />
(4)    include the capacity demonstration measures required by             <br /><br /><br />
clause (ix) of this Section 5.6(a);                                        <br /><br /><br />
(5)    include a construction (or acquisition), completion and             <br /><br /><br />
commencement of operations schedule for each proposed                      <br /><br /><br />
Mine and all related Mining Plant, Infrastructure and                      <br /><br /><br />
equipment proposed in the Development Plan                                 <br /><br /><br />
(6)    include a timetabte for development as follows: Bomi -              <br /><br /><br />
completion of construction and acquisition no later than                   <br /><br /><br />
September 30, 2016 and commencement of production no                       <br /><br /><br />
later than October 30, 2016; Mano - completion of                          <br /><br /><br />
construction and acquisition no later than September 30,                   <br /><br /><br />
2018 and commencement of production no later than                          <br /><br /><br />
October 30, 2018; Mid Bea - completion of construction                     <br /><br /><br />
and acquisition no later than September 30, 2021 and                       <br /><br /><br />
commencement of production no later than October 30,                       <br /><br /><br />
2021;                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
(7)    include final engineering studies and financial analysis            <br /><br /><br />
regarding the route selection, design, investment                          <br /><br /><br />
requirements and other relevant factors to permit the                      <br /><br /><br />
expansion of the Railroad and pie Port as described in                     <br /><br /><br />
Section 6.7 (for the purposes hereof, “final” means AACE                   <br /><br /><br />
Class 2 estimates or equivalent, specifically ±10%                         <br /><br /><br />
accuracy, 30-35% of engineering completed, 10-15%                          <br /><br /><br />
contingency); and                                                          <br /><br /><br />
(8)    include a construction, completion, and commencement of             <br /><br /><br />
operations schedule for the power generation alternative                   <br /><br /><br />
selected by the parties pursuant to Section 4.6 (the “Power                <br /><br /><br />
Plant”):                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
(v)    a plan for Operations (an “Operations Plan”) that sets forth the    <br /><br /><br />
Company’s plan for operating each proposed Mine and related                <br /><br /><br />
Mining Plant, Infrastructure and equipment, including expected             <br /><br /><br />
staffing requirements and implements the requirements of Sections          <br /><br /><br />
6.6 and 6.7,                                                               <br /><br /><br />
(vi)    a plan for marketing and selling the Products (including projected <br /><br /><br />
principal customers and projected means of transporting Produces)          <br /><br /><br />
from Liberia to such customers) for the Mining Term.                       <br /><br /><br />
Ci\    j                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
﻿•..'■■ii'1 jj'-'jir; RCcge;- plan j>; described in Section 5.6(c);              <br /><br /><br />
(viii) a financing plan, setting forth the manner in which the Company          <br /><br /><br />
proposes to fund the Development Plan and the methods the                       <br /><br /><br />
Company proposes to use to fund the LMP, the SIA and the SAP;                   <br /><br /><br />
and                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
(ix)    a program for capacity verification and testing to demonstrate that     <br /><br /><br />
the principal components of each proposed Mine and related                      <br /><br /><br />
Mining Plant, Infrastructure and equipment have substantially the               <br /><br /><br />
operating capacities set forth in the Development Plan, which shall             <br /><br /><br />
demonstrate that the completed facilities have the capacity to                  <br /><br /><br />
perform as specified in the Feasibility Report.                                 <br /><br /><br />
(x)    If the Mine, Mining Plant and Infrastructure are designed so that        <br /><br /><br />
any portion of the facilities for transporting ore to the port or the           <br /><br /><br />
facilities at the port will be used for less than the entire output of          <br /><br /><br />
the Mine, then the Feasibility Report shall include provision for               <br /><br /><br />
comparable testing of such portions of such facilities based on their           <br /><br /><br />
intended capacities. Thus, if the Feasibility Report and the                    <br /><br /><br />
Development Plan provide for a two-stage development, with                      <br /><br /><br />
transport and port facilities initially being sized for one Mine and            <br /><br /><br />
are later to be expanded to provide for a second (or expanded)                  <br /><br /><br />
Mine, the capacity demonstration tests for the transport and port               <br /><br /><br />
facilities shall be conducted once at the lower capacity levels and,            <br /><br /><br />
upon completion of any expansion, at the higher capacity levels.                <br /><br /><br />
(b)    The Feasibility Report shall include an Environmental Impact Assessment  <br /><br /><br />
Study Report (“EIA”) and an Environmental Management Plan (“BMP"')              <br /><br /><br />
complying with Section 5.7 and applicable Law, prepared by an                   <br /><br /><br />
internationally recognized independent environmental consultant not             <br /><br /><br />
affiliated with the Company or any of its principle direct or indirect          <br /><br /><br />
shareholders, as filed by the Company with and approved by the GPA.             <br /><br /><br />
(c)    The Feasibility Report shall include a Social Impact Assessment (“SIA”)  <br /><br /><br />
and Social Action Plan (“SAP”) complying with Section 5.8 and                   <br /><br /><br />
applicable Law.                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
(d)    The Feasibility Report shall include (i) final engineering studies and   <br /><br /><br />
financial analysis regarding the route selection, design, investment            <br /><br /><br />
requirements and other relevant factors to permit the expansion of the          <br /><br /><br />
Railroad and the Port as described in Section 6.7; and (ii) a mineral value     <br /><br /><br />
added study that assesses possible further value addition within Liberia to     <br /><br /><br />
Iron Ore Mined by the Company, including pelletization of such Iron Ore         <br /><br /><br />
and identifies the critical conditions for realization of such downstream       <br /><br /><br />
investments.                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
(e)    The Feasibility Report shall include a project linkages plan that (i)    <br /><br /><br />
identifies the potentials for local suppliers, contractors and service          <br /><br /><br />
providers to service the project, (ii) identifies key interventions to grow the <br /><br /><br />
minerals input industrial sector, and (Hi) sets out a project local purchase    <br /><br /><br />
﻿pi:: ■ ■>.•>(!'< milestones • ■t-v i-t;fic.I in terms oi si. increasing percentage <br /><br /><br />
of local purchases of goods and services, and providing for bidding                <br /><br /><br />
preferences for local suppliers, contractors and service providers (provided       <br /><br /><br />
that such Persons offer quality, terms, delivery, service, quantity and price      <br /><br /><br />
at least comparable to those obtainable from other sources);                       <br /><br /><br />
The Feasibility Report shall include a skills and technology development           <br /><br /><br />
plan that contains an annual projection of the Company’s commitments to            <br /><br /><br />
the development of local human resources and planned expenditure on                <br /><br /><br />
research and development within Liberia and the region indicating how the          <br /><br /><br />
Company proposes to discharge its obligations under Section 11, including          <br /><br /><br />
detailed plans and programs for the recruitment and training of citizens of        <br /><br /><br />
Liberia, including timetables and schedules, in connection with the                <br /><br /><br />
construction and operation of the proposed Mines, Mining Plant and                 <br /><br /><br />
Infrastructure.                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
The Feasibility Report shall include a confirmation from the Feasibility           <br /><br /><br />
Consultant substantially to the effect that:                                       <br /><br /><br />
(i)    the Company has the design, procurement and construction                    <br /><br /><br />
management capacity necessary to implement the proposed                            <br /><br /><br />
Development Plan, or has identified contractors with which it will                 <br /><br /><br />
contract for the design, procurement and production of each                        <br /><br /><br />
proposed Mine and related Mining Plant, Infrastructure and                         <br /><br /><br />
equipment that have the capacity to carry out such activities;                     <br /><br /><br />
(ii)    the Company has the management capacity to operate each                    <br /><br /><br />
proposed Mine and related Mining Plant, Infrastructure and                         <br /><br /><br />
equipment in accordance with the proposed Operations Plan;                         <br /><br /><br />
(iii)    each proposed Mine and related Mining Plant, as designed, will if         <br /><br /><br />
constructed in accordance with the designs and maintained in                       <br /><br /><br />
accordance with good maintenance practices, support the planned                    <br /><br /><br />
operating levels of such Mine as set out in the Feasibility Report;                <br /><br /><br />
(iv)    the Railroad, Port and Power Plant, as designed, will, if constructed      <br /><br /><br />
in accordance with the designs and maintained in accordance with                   <br /><br /><br />
good operating practices, (A) support the transport and loadoul of                 <br /><br /><br />
the projected production capacity of each proposed Mine for the                    <br /><br /><br />
term of this Agreement assuming each such proposed Mine and its                    <br /><br /><br />
related Mining Plant are operating at the design levels specified in               <br /><br /><br />
the proposed Development Plan; (B) will have at least the excess                   <br /><br /><br />
capacity required by the terms of this Agreement and (C) will have                 <br /><br /><br />
such additional useful life following the termination of this                      <br /><br /><br />
Agreement as set forth in the proposed Development Plan;                           <br /><br /><br />
(v)    the geotechnical survey work done in connection with locating all           <br /><br /><br />
proposed Mining Plant and Infrastructure is sufficient to support                  <br /><br /><br />
the conclusion that the sites of such proposed Mining Plant and                    <br /><br /><br />
Infrastructure are suitable for the construction and operation of                  <br /><br /><br />
those facilities;                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
\!                                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
﻿(vi)    the EIA done in connection with the proposed siting of, and the          <br /><br /><br />
subsequent operations of, each proposed Mine and related Mining                  <br /><br /><br />
Plant, Infrastructure and equipment was conducted in a matter                    <br /><br /><br />
consistent with the World Bank “Environmental Health and Safety                  <br /><br /><br />
Guidelines for Mining” and otherwise complies with the                           <br /><br /><br />
requirements of Section 5.7;                                                     <br /><br /><br />
(vii)    the design of each proposed Mine and related Mining Plant,              <br /><br /><br />
Infrastructure and equipment is in accordance with contemporary                  <br /><br /><br />
best practice for the design of mines and related facilities of similar          <br /><br /><br />
size and type and is appropriate for the climate and geography of                <br /><br /><br />
Liberia, and the Company has under license from the Government                   <br /><br /><br />
or has otherwise acquired rights to sufficient Land (£) to1                      <br /><br /><br />
accommodate in an environmentally sound manner in accordance                     <br /><br /><br />
with International Mining Standards and applicable Law all Mining                <br /><br /><br />
Plant and Infrastructure expected to be necessary for the Mining                 <br /><br /><br />
and all proposed processing of Iron Ore in accordance with the                   <br /><br /><br />
proposed Development Plan, (y) reasonably to insulate surrounding                <br /><br /><br />
areas in accordance with International Mining Standards from                     <br /><br /><br />
possible adverse impacts of Operations, and (z) to provide for all               <br /><br /><br />
activities proposed to be undertaken as part of its ongoing                      <br /><br /><br />
environmental protection plan;                                                   <br /><br /><br />
(viii) the completion verification procedures set forth in Section 6.1 and       <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
the capacity demonstration procedures set forth in the proposed                  <br /><br /><br />
Development Plan are sufficient reasonably to demonstrate that                   <br /><br /><br />
each proposed Mine and all related Mining Plant and Infrastructure               <br /><br /><br />
have been completed in accordance with the proposed                              <br /><br /><br />
Development Plan and can reasonably be expected to have the                      <br /><br /><br />
operating capacity specified in the proposed Development Plan;                   <br /><br /><br />
(ix)    the HMP, if implemented as proposed, will limit the likely amount        <br /><br /><br />

of environmental damage to limits established in the World Bank                  <br /><br /><br />

Company’s mine closing plan meets the standards established by                   <br /><br /><br />
World Bank “Environmental Health and Safety Guidelines for                       <br /><br /><br />
Mining” and the estimated cost for such plan (valued in current                  <br /><br /><br />
dollars) is reasonable, and such plan otherwise complies with the                <br /><br /><br />
requirements of Section 5-7; and                                                 <br /><br /><br />

assesses the costs of possible adding further value in Liberia to the            <br /><br /><br />
output of each proposed Mine and identifies and reasonably                       <br /><br /><br />
quantifies the critical conditions for the realization of such                   <br /><br /><br />
downstream investments.                                                          <br /><br /><br />

in such Feasibility Report, as so amended, complying with the                   <br /><br /><br />

The Environmental Impact Assessment Study Report and the Environmental          <br /><br /><br />
Management Plan,                                                                <br /><br /><br />
(a)    The EIA and the EMP shall comply with applicable requirements imposed    <br /><br /><br />
by the EPA and with this Section 5.7. The EIA shall at a minimum                <br /><br /><br />
identify pre-existing environmental conditions and set forth the potential      <br /><br /><br />
adverse impact of the construction and operation of the Mining Plant and        <br /><br /><br />
the Infrastructure proposed in the Feasibility Report shall take into account   <br /><br /><br />
all activities or improvements to be undertaken by the Company and              <br /><br /><br />
- referred to in Section 6.7(d), 6.7(e) or 11.6 of the Mining Law, and shall    <br /><br /><br />
otherwise comply with applicable Law. The EMP shall at a minimum set            <br /><br /><br />
forth detailed plans consistent with the EIA for the mitigation of              <br /><br /><br />
environmental harm attributable to, and the restoration or remediation of       <br /><br /><br />
the environment to the extent affected by, the implementation of the            <br /><br /><br />
Development Plan and subsequent Operations, including the actions to be         <br /><br /><br />
taken by the Company to comply with Sections 8.1 through 8.3 of the             <br /><br /><br />
Mining Law, International Mining Standards and other applicable Law,            <br /><br /><br />
and shall in any event comply with applicable EPA requirements and              <br /><br /><br />
• Section 5.7(b).                                                               <br /><br /><br />
(b)    The EMP must include a closure management plan and a closure             <br /><br /><br />
management budget designed to ensure that upon closure (j) each proposed        <br /><br /><br />
Mining Plant and Infrastructure shall not present any health or safely          <br /><br /><br />
issues (including provision for the control of acid drainage and other long¬    <br /><br /><br />
term environmental hazards) and (u) each Proposed Production Area and           <br /><br /><br />
the surroundings of any Mining Plant or Infrastructure not located in such      <br /><br /><br />
Proposed Production Area shall be restored to productive use or reforested      <br /><br /><br />
or where restoration is impractical, suitably remediated. The closure           <br /><br /><br />
management plan must include a list and assessment of risk and any              <br /><br /><br />
uncertainties associated with the preferred closure option, address the         <br /><br /><br />
social aspects of closure and rehabilitation, and provide a process for         <br /><br /><br />
participation by the community and other stakeholders in closure                <br /><br /><br />
management and monitoring. The closure management budget shall                  <br /><br /><br />
provide a realistic initial estimate of the expected closure cost, broken       <br /><br /><br />
down by principal activities. Notwithstanding any other provision of this       <br /><br /><br />
Agreement or applicable law, the Government acknowledges that the               <br /><br /><br />
Bomi and Mano River Deposits have been mined in the past by third               <br /><br /><br />
parties, and that nothing in this Agreement shall impose on Company, its        <br /><br /><br />
Shareholders or any of their affiliates or subcontractors any such closure or   <br /><br /><br />
other responsibilities or obligations with regard to or emanating from work     <br /><br /><br />
performed in such sites by third parties.                                       <br /><br /><br />
(c)    The EMP must also set forth the means by which the Company proposes      <br /><br /><br />
to ensure the availability of funds to finance its environmental restoration    <br /><br /><br />
﻿and remediation obligations under Sections 8.2 and 8.3 of the Mining Law                <br /><br /><br />
(the “Environmental Restoration Obligations”) so that the cost of closure               <br /><br /><br />
will be borne by the Company and not the public or the Government. The                  <br /><br /><br />
Company shall, at its election, (i) agree in writing with the Government to             <br /><br /><br />
a “pay-as-you-go” funding scheme (such agreement, an “Environmental                     <br /><br /><br />
Restoration Obligations Funding Agreement”) or (ii) provide financial                   <br /><br /><br />
support (an “Environmental Restoration Obligations Guarantee”! for such                 <br /><br /><br />
obligations in the form of a letter of credit in form and content reasonably            <br /><br /><br />
acceptable to the Minister of Finance and the Minister issued on behalf of              <br /><br /><br />
the Company from a third party financial institution with a long-term                   <br /><br /><br />
credit rating of at least A (or its equivalent) from at least two                       <br /><br /><br />
internationally recognized credit-rating agencies and providing for                     <br /><br /><br />
vedetenninalion of estimated closure costs at least once every three years              <br /><br /><br />
and corresponding adjustments in the amount of the letter of credit in                  <br /><br /><br />
amount reasonably acceptable to the Minister of Finance and the Minister.               <br /><br /><br />
In the case of third party credit support, if the party supplying the letter of         <br /><br /><br />
credit no longer has a long-term credit rating of at least A (or its                    <br /><br /><br />
equivalent) from at least two internationally recognized credit-rating                  <br /><br /><br />
agencies, the letter of credit must provide that if the Company does not                <br /><br /><br />
within 90 days thereafter secure a substitute letter of credit from another             <br /><br /><br />
third party financial institution satisfying the requirements of this section,          <br /><br /><br />
the letter of credit may be called upon for the maximum amount then                     <br /><br /><br />
available thereunder, subject to the requirement that such amount be                    <br /><br /><br />
deposited in a trust account from which it may be withdrawn only for the                <br /><br /><br />
purposes of financing the Company’s environmental restoration and                       <br /><br /><br />
remediation obligations. Nothing in this section shall be deemed to limit               <br /><br /><br />
the Company's obligations or liability for environmental restoration and                <br /><br /><br />
remediation under applicable Law.                                                       <br /><br /><br />
(d) The Company shall have held public hearings on the ElA and the EMP at               <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
least in Monrovia, in the county seat of each county in which a Proposed                <br /><br /><br />
Production Area is located an<£ in the county seal of each county in which              <br /><br /><br />
the Railroad, Port, Power Plant or any road described in Section 6.6 is                 <br /><br /><br />
located or to be located, and shall have included as pail of the Feasibility            <br /><br /><br />
Report a statement of the means taken to publicize the hearings, an                     <br /><br /><br />
indication of the numbers of persons who attended such hearings and their               <br /><br /><br />
affiliates, a summary of the issues raised at such hearings, and a discussion           <br /><br /><br />
of the actions taken by the Company in response to such hearings. The                   <br /><br /><br />

Infrastructure on the individuals and communities resident in and around                <br /><br /><br />

not located within a Pro|X)sed Production Area, or (ii) areas affected by the           <br /><br /><br />
proposed processing or transport of Product whether using Company-                      <br /><br /><br />

(b)    The SAP shall set forth reasonable measures, in light of the costs involved,  <br /><br /><br />
for the mitigation of the adverse impact referred to in Section 5.8(a) above,        <br /><br /><br />
as well as making provision for the continuing economic and social                   <br /><br /><br />
viability of centers of population that have formed and which may form as            <br /><br /><br />
a result of Operations during the term of this Agreement. The SAP shall              <br /><br /><br />
include a Resettlement Action Plan (“RAP") component if communes                     <br /><br /><br />
located in or adjacent to each Proposed Production Area or to Mining Plant           <br /><br /><br />

International Mining Standards be resettled for health or safety reasons.            <br /><br /><br />

resettlement to be undertaken at Company expense with key emphasis on                <br /><br /><br />
shelter and livelihood continuity.                                                   <br /><br /><br />

least in Monrovia, in the county seat of each county in which a Proposed             <br /><br /><br />
Production Area is located and in the county seat of each county in which            <br /><br /><br />
the Railroad, Port, Power Plant or any road described in Section 6.6 is              <br /><br /><br />
located or to be located, and shall include as part of the Feasibility Report        <br /><br /><br />
a statement of the means taken to publicize the hearings, an indication of           <br /><br /><br />
the numbers of persons who attended such hearings and, to the extent                 <br /><br /><br />
known to the Company, the names of the organizations such persons                    <br /><br /><br />
represent, a summary of the issues raised at such hearings, and a                    <br /><br /><br />
discussion of the actions taken by the Company in response to such                   <br /><br /><br />
hearings. The Ministry may set forth by regulation additional standards              <br /><br /><br />

notification of and conduct of such hearings, and may establish generally            <br /><br /><br />
applicable requirements for third party review of the SIA and the SAP                <br /><br /><br />
comparable to the technical review of the Development Plan and                       <br /><br /><br />
Operations Plan undertaken by the Feasibility Consultant.                            <br /><br /><br />
Approval of the Feasibility Report and Grant of Mining License.                      <br /><br /><br />
(a)    The Minister may, within 90 days of receipt of the Feasibility Report (the    <br /><br /><br />
“Review Period”), (i) appoint independent consultants and/or bankers, at             <br /><br /><br />
the Government’s own cost, to assist in its review of the Feasibility                <br /><br /><br />
Report, (ii) reasonably request additional information with respect to any           <br /><br /><br />
aspect of the Feasibility necessary to satisfy applicable requirements of            <br /><br /><br />
this Agreement and upon the provision of such additional information by              <br /><br /><br />
the Company, the Review Period shall recommence unless otherwise                     <br /><br /><br />
agreed with the Minister, and (iii) recommend reasonable changes in any              <br /><br /><br />
component of the Development Plan to the extent the Minister deems the               <br /><br /><br />
changes necessary to satisfy applicable Law on the requirements of this              <br /><br /><br />
Agreement. In the absence of notice from the Minister that the Feasibility           <br /><br /><br />
Report is incomplete, the Feasibility Report shall be deemed to be                   <br /><br /><br />
complete as to form and content at the end of the Review Period.                     <br /><br /><br />
(b)    Unless the Government has notified the Company that (i) the design or         <br /><br /><br />
Operation of each proposed Mine and related Mining Plant, Infrastructure             <br /><br /><br />
﻿and equipment in accordance with the Development Plan would violate            <br /><br /><br />
any provision of applicable Law; or (a) the Company is in default in any       <br /><br /><br />
material respect in the performance of its obligations or the discharge of its <br /><br /><br />
liabilities under this Agreement or under the Exploration Regulations (as      <br /><br /><br />
modified by this Agreement) which have not been cured to the reasonable        <br /><br /><br />
satisfaction of, or waived by, the Government, and provided that               <br /><br /><br />
immediately following the issue of a Class A mining license pursuant to        <br /><br /><br />
Section 5.9(g) the Company shall comply with Section 20.4, the Minister        <br /><br /><br />
shall approve the Feasibility Report, or the Feasibility Report as amended,    <br /><br /><br />
as the case may be, if:                                                        <br /><br /><br />
(i)    the Feasibility Report and its specific components comply with die      <br /><br /><br />
provisions of the Mining Law and the terms of this Agreement;                  <br /><br /><br />
(ii)    the EPA has approved the EMP and the EIA as complying with the         <br /><br /><br />
requirements of this Agreement, International Mining Standards                 <br /><br /><br />
and applicable Law, and                                                        <br /><br /><br />
(iii)    each of the EMP, the EIA, the SIA, the SAP, the Project Linkages      <br /><br /><br />
Plan and the Skills and Technology Development Plan have been                  <br /><br /><br />
generally made available to the public for at least 60 days prior to           <br /><br /><br />
the date of approval of the Feasibility Report, including by way of            <br /><br /><br />
(A)    posting thereof on-line on a Government provided website,               <br /><br /><br />
(B)    making available copies thereof for examination at the relevant         <br /><br /><br />
ministries during normal business hours, (C) publishing notice of              <br /><br /><br />
such posting and ayailability in one or more newspapers of wide                <br /><br /><br />
circulation in Monrovia and (D) publishing a summary thereof in                <br /><br /><br />
one or more of such newspapers provided that to the extent the                 <br /><br /><br />
Government does not effect (A) or (B) above within 45 days of                  <br /><br /><br />
being provided the relevant documents by the Company for such                  <br /><br /><br />
purpose, the Company shall not be required to have complied with               <br /><br /><br />
those provisions.                                                              <br /><br /><br />
(iv)    the capital expenditure plan shows that the Company’s debt/equity      <br /><br /><br />
ratio taking into account initial working capital at the                       <br /><br /><br />
commencement of regular commercial operations shall not exceed                 <br /><br /><br />
3:1,                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
(v)    the Company has provided an opinion of an internationally               <br /><br /><br />
recognized investment banking firm to the effect that it has                   <br /><br /><br />
reviewed the Company’s plan to finance the construction,                       <br /><br /><br />
equipping, start-up and entry into commercial production of each               <br /><br /><br />
proposed Mine and ail related Mining Plant and Infrastructure, and             <br /><br /><br />
that, in its professional judgment, it is reasonable to conclude that          <br /><br /><br />
the Company has available to it the financial resources necessary to           <br /><br /><br />
carry out all such activities in keeping with the schedule and other           <br /><br /><br />
terms of the Feasibility Report, the Feasibility Report as amended,            <br /><br /><br />
as the case may be, and this Agreement (such repoit to specify the             <br /><br /><br />
bases lor its conclusion), provided that to the extent the conclusion          <br /><br /><br />
of such investment banking firm is based on funding to be provided             <br /><br /><br />
by or through the Company’s shareholders or their related Persons,             <br /><br /><br />
﻿such shareholders or related Persons shall have agreed with the              <br /><br /><br />
Government to be jointly and severally liable to provide funding to          <br /><br /><br />
the Company, and                                                             <br /><br /><br />
(vi) Section 6.8 of this Agreement has been amended to reflect all           <br /><br /><br />
modifications thereof reasonably requested by the Government so              <br /><br /><br />
that the reporting obligations set forth therein arc appropriately           <br /><br /><br />
tailored to the specific type of Mine(s) covered by the                      <br /><br /><br />
Development Plan.                                                            <br /><br /><br />
(c)    Any failure by the Government to give notice to the Company in        <br /><br /><br />
accordance with Section 5.9(b) shall not affect the Government’s rights      <br /><br /><br />
and remedies under this Agreement to the extent the Company was in           <br /><br /><br />
default in a material respect in the performance of its obligations or the   <br /><br /><br />
discharge of its liabilities under this Agreement or under the Exploration   <br /><br /><br />
Regulations (as modified by this Agreement), which have not been cured       <br /><br /><br />
to the reasonable satisfaction of, or waived by. the Government.             <br /><br /><br />
(d)    The Minister shall be deemed to have approved the Feasibility Report  <br /><br /><br />
unless the Minister has notified the Company in writing of the reasons for   <br /><br /><br />
disapproval not later than 60 days after the end of the Review Period.       <br /><br /><br />
Following any such disapproval and the resubmission by (lie Company of       <br /><br /><br />
an amended, modified or supplemented application for a Class A mining        <br /><br /><br />
license or Feasibility Report, the Minister shall be deemed to have          <br /><br /><br />
approved the Feasibility Report unless within 60 days of such amendment,     <br /><br /><br />
modification or supplement the Minister has notified the Company in          <br /><br /><br />
writing of the reasons for disapproval.                                      <br /><br /><br />
(e)    In the event lire Minister has given the Company timely notice of its <br /><br /><br />
disapproval of the Feasibility Report (a “Disapproval Notice.” and such      <br /><br /><br />
disapproved Feasibility Report, a “Disapproved Feasibility Report”), the     <br /><br /><br />
Company and the Ministry shall discuss in good faith (i) what, if any,       <br /><br /><br />
amendments, modifications or supplements to the Disapproved Feasibility      <br /><br /><br />
Report would make the Feasibility Report acceptable to the .Ministry and     <br /><br /><br />
(ii) what would constitute a reasonable period of time for the Company to    <br /><br /><br />
submit to the Ministry for approval a Feasibility Report as so amended,      <br /><br /><br />
modified or supplemented. In the event that the parties fail to reach        <br /><br /><br />
agreement with respect to the matters described in the foregoing sentence    <br /><br /><br />
within 180 days of the date of the Disapproval Notice the parties shall      <br /><br /><br />
jointly appoint an expert who is a mining industry professional with         <br /><br /><br />
substantial working experience in the conduct of feasibility or related      <br /><br /><br />
studies who shall determine: (i) what, if any, amendments, modifications     <br /><br /><br />
or supplements to the Disapproved Feasibility Report should be made such     <br /><br /><br />
that the amended Feasibility Report should be approved pursuant to this      <br /><br /><br />
Agreement; and (ii) what would constitute a reasonable period of time for    <br /><br /><br />
the Company to submit to the Ministry for approval a Feasibility Report as   <br /><br /><br />
so amended, modified or supplemented.                                        <br /><br /><br />
(0 If the Company fails to submit to the Ministry for approval an amended,   <br /><br /><br />
modified or supplemented Feasibility Report within the time period (i.)      <br /><br /><br />
agreed by the parties, and has failed to cure such default within the        <br /><br /><br />
﻿applicable ours period provided in Section 25.2, or (ii; determined by the      <br /><br /><br />
expert in accordance with Section 5.9(e) (to the extent the expert              <br /><br /><br />
determines that such amendment, modification or supplement to the               <br /><br /><br />
Disapproved Feasibility Report is required), all rights of the Company to       <br /><br /><br />
the Proposed Production Areas covered by the Disapproved Feasibility            <br /><br /><br />
Report may be terminated by the Government upon prior written notice to         <br /><br /><br />
the Company and all right, title and interest in the Disapproved Feasibility    <br /><br /><br />
Report shall automatically vest in the Government subject to the Company        <br /><br /><br />
continuing to be able to use such information in connection with other          <br /><br /><br />
projects in Liberia. The provisions of Section 5.9(c) or (f) do not impose      <br /><br /><br />
any obligation upon the Minister to approve any amended, modified or            <br /><br /><br />
supplemented Feasibility Report, it being understood that all requirements      <br /><br /><br />
of this Section 5.9 shall apply thereto.                                        <br /><br /><br />
(g) No later than five Business Days following the latest to occur of the       <br /><br /><br />
conditions set forth in Section 5.5(a) through (e), the Minister shall grant    <br /><br /><br />
the Company a Mining License covering each Proposed Production Area             <br /><br /><br />
covered by the approved feasibility Report. In the case of the approval of      <br /><br /><br />
a Feasibility Report filed as contemplated by Section 5.4(f) that proposes      <br /><br /><br />
to add additional Proposed Production Areas to Production Areas for             <br /><br /><br />
which a Mining License has already been issued, the Minister shall amend        <br /><br /><br />
the Mining License to include the additional Proposed Production Areas.         <br /><br /><br />
Each Production Area so covered by a Mining License is an “approved             <br /><br /><br />
Production Area” for the purposes of this Agreement. Unless expressly           <br /><br /><br />
• otherwise provided in this Agreement, if there is a contlict between the      <br /><br /><br />
terms of any Regulations and the terms of this Agreement, the terms of this     <br /><br /><br />
Agreement shall prevail,                                                        <br /><br /><br />
5.10 Term of Mining Licenses.                                                   <br /><br /><br />
(a) The term of any Mining License granted to the Company under this            <br /><br /><br />
Agreement shall commence on the date such license is issued and shall end       <br /><br /><br />
on the earlier of (i) the date the Mining License is relinquished pursuant to   <br /><br /><br />
Section 5.10(c) or (ii) the date the Mining License is terminated pursuant      <br /><br /><br />
to Section 25 (the “Mining Term”). The Company is entitled to renew any         <br /><br /><br />
Mining License for consecutive additional terms not to exceed 25 years          <br /><br /><br />
each if the Company has complied with ail of its payment obligations            <br /><br /><br />
under this Agreement and under the Revenue Code, and the Government             <br /><br /><br />
has not notified the Company that it is in default in any materia! respect      <br /><br /><br />
with its other obligations under this Agreement or the Mining Law, other        <br /><br /><br />
than any defaults which have been waived by, or cured to the reasonable         <br /><br /><br />
satisfaction of, the Government, if:                                            <br /><br /><br />
(i)    the Company demonstrates that there continues to exist in one or         <br /><br /><br />
more approved Production Areas Proven Mineral Reserves of Iron                  <br /><br /><br />
Ore in sufficient quantities to support continued mining for ul least           <br /><br /><br />
80% of the renewal term requested by the Company (assuming no                   <br /><br /><br />
interruptions to production),                                                   <br /><br /><br />
(ii)    if the continued operations will involve significant additional         <br /><br /><br />
investment or significant changes in production processes (» c. a               <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
 41                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
﻿fundamental change in the technology or operation of any major                <br /><br /><br />
component of its Operations) the Company has delivered an                     <br /><br /><br />
updated Feasibility Report setting forth the Company’s                        <br /><br /><br />
development and operations plans for the extended term and which              <br /><br /><br />
otherwise complies with the requirements of Section 5.6 through               <br /><br /><br />
Section 5.8, and                                                              <br /><br /><br />
(iii) the Company satisfies such other conditions as are required by          <br /><br /><br />
applicable Law.                                                               <br /><br /><br />
The Company may apply for renewal of a Mining License not more than           <br /><br /><br />
three years and not less than one year prior to the date of expiration of the <br /><br /><br />
current Mining License.                                                       <br /><br /><br />
(b)    Any failure by the Government to give notice to the Company in         <br /><br /><br />
accordance with Section 5.10(a) shaii not affect the Government’s rights      <br /><br /><br />
and remedies under this Agreement to the extent the Company was in            <br /><br /><br />
default in a material respect in tile performance of its obligations or the   <br /><br /><br />
discharge of its liabilities under this Agreement or under the Mining Law     <br /><br /><br />
(as modified by this Agreement), which have not been cured to the             <br /><br /><br />
reasonable satisfaction of, or waived by, the Government.                     <br /><br /><br />
(c)    At any time following the issuance of the Mining License, the Company  <br /><br /><br />
may file a request with the Government to relinquish the Mining License       <br /><br /><br />
as of a date specified therein. Such request shall be filed at least 180 days <br /><br /><br />
prior to the desired relinquishment date and shall include the Company’s      <br /><br /><br />
confirmation of its obligation to, and willingness to carry out, the approved <br /><br /><br />
closure management plan applicable to the Operations carried out under        <br /><br /><br />
the Mining License and payment of the processing fee described in Section     <br /><br /><br />
16.1(f). The Government shall approve such request if                         <br /><br /><br />
(i)    on or prior to the date of such notice and on or prior to the date of  <br /><br /><br />
the issuance of the Government’s response to such request, the                <br /><br /><br />
Government shall not have notified the Company that the                       <br /><br /><br />
Company is iti default in any material respect in the performance of          <br /><br /><br />
its obligations or the discharge of its liabilities under this                <br /><br /><br />
Agreement, which defaults have not been cured to the reasonable               <br /><br /><br />
satisfaction of. or waived by, the Government, and                            <br /><br /><br />
(ii)    the Minister, the Minister of Finance and the head of the EPA have    <br /><br /><br />
reasonably determined that the arrangements made by the                       <br /><br /><br />
Company for funding the performance of its approved closure                   <br /><br /><br />
management plan are sufficient fo secure such performance,                    <br /><br /><br />
(iii)    the Exploration Guarantee (if applicable) has not been revoked and   <br /><br /><br />
the Exploration Guarantor satisfies the Exploration Guarantor Net             <br /><br /><br />
Worth Requirements,                                                           <br /><br /><br />
(iv)    the Environmental Restoration Obligations Guarantee (if               <br /><br /><br />
applicable) has not been revoked and the guarantor thereunder                 <br /><br /><br />
remains an Acceptable Third Party Financial Institution, and                  <br /><br /><br />
﻿(v) the Mining Guarantee has not been revoked and the Mining                             <br /><br /><br />
Guarantor satisfies the Mining Guarantor Net Worth                                       <br /><br /><br />
Requirements,.                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
The Government shall notify the Company of its decision no later than 120                <br /><br /><br />
days following the date of filing of such request. If the Government grants              <br /><br /><br />
such request, the Mining License shall be relinquished as of the date                    <br /><br /><br />
requested by the Company, provided, that, on such date, there is no                      <br /><br /><br />
payment default and no other material default unwaived by the                            <br /><br /><br />
Government in the performance by the Company of its obligations under                    <br /><br /><br />
this Agreement. Upon relinquishment of the Mining License this                           <br /><br /><br />
Agreement shall terminate and all provisions hereof relating to                          <br /><br /><br />
termination, including Section 26, shall apply.                                          <br /><br /><br />
(d) Notwithstanding the relinquishment of a Mining License pursuant to                   <br /><br /><br />
Section 5.10(c), the Company shall remain liable to the Government for all               <br /><br /><br />
obligations and liabilities that accrued prior to the date set as the effective          <br /><br /><br />
date of relinquishment and have not been waived by the Government.                       <br /><br /><br />
Upon relinquishment of a Mining License, all right, title and interest in the            <br /><br /><br />
feasibility Reports or portions thereof covered by such Mining License                   <br /><br /><br />
shall automatically vest in the Government subject to the Company                        <br /><br /><br />
continuing to be able to use such information in connection with other                   <br /><br /><br />
projects in Liberia.                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
5.11 Additional Capital Investment or Material Changes in Operations.                    <br /><br /><br />
If the Company proposes additional investment relating to changes in Mine                <br /><br /><br />
operating technology or procedures, which investment (i) exceeds 20% of the              <br /><br /><br />
investment amount provided for in the initial Feasibility Report or (u) which            <br /><br /><br />
investment constitutes a fundamental change in the technology or operation of any        <br /><br /><br />
major component of its Operations or a substantial expansion of the output of the        <br /><br /><br />
Mine, it may not make such investment until it has delivered and the Minister has        <br /><br /><br />
approved in the manner provided in Section 5.9 an updated Feasibility Report             <br /><br /><br />
setting forth the Company’s development and operations plans and otherwise               <br /><br /><br />
complying with the requirements of Section 5.6 through Section 5.8. If the               <br /><br /><br />
Company proposes to make substantial changes in its methods of Operations that           <br /><br /><br />
would materially affect employment or could materially affect the environment or         <br /><br /><br />
the social structures of the communities in the area affected by such changes, it        <br /><br /><br />
may not do so until it has updated its E1A, BMP, SIA and SMP, and the plans              <br /><br /><br />
referred to in Sections 5.6(e) and 5.6(1) to reflect the consequences of such            <br /><br /><br />
proposed changes, such plans have been made available for public comment for at          <br /><br /><br />
least 60 days in the manner required by clause (iii) of Section 5.9(b), and the          <br /><br /><br />
Minister (the EPA in the case of the E1A and the EMP) has approved such plans,           <br /><br /><br />
such approvals not to be unreasonably withheld or delayed.                               <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 6 CONSTRUCTION AND OPERATIONS                                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />

(a) Upon the issuance to the Company of a Mining License pursuant to                     <br /><br /><br />

Section 5, the Company shall incur capital expenditures and commence.                    <br /><br /><br />

applicable.                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
