Completion.                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
(a)    With respect to each proposed Mine, within 180 days of the scheduled      <br /><br /><br />
completion date thereof set forth in the Development Plan (subject to delay      <br /><br /><br />
on account of force majeurc), the Company shall demonstrate, through             <br /><br /><br />
performance of the proposed capacity demonstration testing program sol           <br /><br /><br />
forth in the Feasibility Study, that the Mine and all related Mining Plant,      <br /><br /><br />
Infrastructure and equipment have substantially the operating capacities set     <br /><br /><br />
forth in the Development Plan. As noted in Section 5.6(a), required              <br /><br /><br />
extended capacity demonstration covering major components of the Mine,           <br /><br /><br />
Mining Plant and Infrastructure may be conducted separately. Thus, if the        <br /><br /><br />
Feasibility Report and the Development Plan call for a two-stage                 <br /><br /><br />
development, with the initial stage being completion of a Mine, with the         <br /><br /><br />
initial Iron Ore processing facilities and railroad and port facilities tailored <br /><br /><br />
to the capacity of that Mine, followed by a second stage encompassing the        <br /><br /><br />
development of a second (or expanded) Mine and upgrade of the Iron Ore           <br /><br /><br />
processing facilities, railroad and port, each capacity demonstration test for   <br /><br /><br />
the first stage Mine, Mining Plant, Infrastructure and equipment shall be        <br /><br /><br />
completed within 180 days of the stage one scheduled completion date for         <br /><br /><br />
the components covered by that test, and each capacity demonstration test        <br /><br /><br />
for the second stage shall be completed within 180 days of the stage two         <br /><br /><br />
scheduled completion date for the components covered by that test.               <br /><br /><br />
(b)    The Company shall give the Ministry notice of, and the opportunity to     <br /><br /><br />
have representatives witness, ail testing required by the Development Plan       <br /><br /><br />
and shall evidence the satisfaction of each component of the required            <br /><br /><br />
capacity demonstrations by the timely delivery to the Minister of a              <br /><br /><br />
certificate of the Feasibility Consultant to the effect that the Company has     <br /><br /><br />
successfully completed such component of the capacity demonstration              <br /><br /><br />
program and has demonstrated the capacities required by such component           <br /><br /><br />
﻿(selling out the requirements and time period covered by the                    <br /><br /><br />
demonstrations and certifying specifically as to the actual results of the      <br /><br /><br />
demonstrations).                                                                <br /><br /><br />
(c) The Company shall pay minimum Royalties under this Agreement based          <br /><br /><br />
on the greater of actual Iron Ore shipments and assumed shipments equal         <br /><br /><br />
to 80% of design capacity as set forth in ihe approved Feasibility Report       <br /><br /><br />
from the outside day set forth in the first sentence of Section 6.2(a) for the  <br /><br /><br />
capacity demonstrations required by Section 5.6(a)(ix) until the date on        <br /><br /><br />
which such capacity demonstrations have been certified as required by this      <br /><br /><br />
Section 6.2. So long as the Company complies with the preceding                 <br /><br /><br />
sentence there are no other consequences for the failure of the Company to      <br /><br /><br />
satisfy the capacity demonstration requirements.                                <br /><br /><br />
6.3 Mining Term Operations.                                                     <br /><br /><br />
(a)    All Mining, processing or-treatment of Iron Ore by the Company shall be  <br /><br /><br />
conducted in accordance with International Mining Standards and                 <br /><br /><br />
applicable Law. The Company undertakes to use all reasonable efforts in         <br /><br /><br />
accordance with such standards and law to maintain the production of            <br /><br /><br />
marketable Iron Ore of the quality and in the quantity contemplated by the      <br /><br /><br />
Feasibility Report, provided it is economically and technically feasible to     <br /><br /><br />
do so.                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
(b)    The Company may not undertake any activity referred to in Section 6.7 or <br /><br /><br />
11.6 of the Mining Law except to the extent expressly covered in the            <br /><br /><br />
Company’s EIA and approved in the context of the Company’s EMP and,             <br /><br /><br />
then only within a Production Area or an area in which the Company is           <br /><br /><br />
otherwise entitled by Law and by agreement with any relevant Landowner          <br /><br /><br />
to carry on such activities. The preceding sentence does not authorize the      <br /><br /><br />
Company to take any action that would violate Section 10.1 of the Mining        <br /><br /><br />
law. The Company may not transfer to any Person timber removed from             <br /><br /><br />
the Land pursuant to Section 6.7(d)(4) or 11.6(a) of the Mining Law             <br /><br /><br />
without the consent of the Forestry Development Authority The Company           <br /><br /><br />
shall not deprive any Person of a constant and reasonable supply of usable      <br /><br /><br />
water from or pollute a previously utilized traditional source without          <br /><br /><br />
providing an alternative source of substantially the same quality and           <br /><br /><br />
quantity, nor shall the Company, without the Minister’s consent and at          <br /><br /><br />
least 30 days prior notice to the affected community, interfere with any        <br /><br /><br />
water rights enjoyed by any user under any agreement with the                   <br /><br /><br />
Government made prior to the date of execution of this Agreement; it            <br /><br /><br />
being understood that the Government shall be responsible for the removal       <br /><br /><br />
of the water bottling plant operated by the Liberia Bottling and Beverage       <br /><br /><br />
Company situated in Bomi County, at the sole expense ol'the Government;         <br /><br /><br />
The Company’s use of water under this Agreement will be subject to              <br /><br /><br />
charges as provided in applicable Law or in the absence of applicable Law,      <br /><br /><br />
as provided in Section 16.6.                                                    <br /><br /><br />
(c)    The Company shall cause all Mines, Mining Plant, Infrastructure and      <br /><br /><br />
equipment constructed, renovated or acquired by it to be maintained             <br /><br /><br />
﻿throughout the Mining Term in a sale and sound condition in accordance                                                     <br /><br /><br />
with International Mining Standards and the requirements of insurers.                                                      <br /><br /><br />
(d)    The Company shall construct and operate all Mines, Mining Plant, and                                                <br /><br /><br />
Infrastructure and equipment in accordance with the Development Plan                                                       <br /><br /><br />
and the Operations Plan set forth in the approved Feasibility Report. The                                                  <br /><br /><br />
Company may not make material changes in the Development Plan or the                                                       <br /><br /><br />
Operations Plan unless it applies for and receives the approval of the                                                     <br /><br /><br />
Minister, which approval may not be unreasonably withheld, to                                                              <br /><br /><br />
appropriate amendments to such plans, and to the extent applicable, the                                                    <br /><br /><br />
Feasibility Report and the related plans, reports and studies provided for in                                              <br /><br /><br />
Sections 5.6 through 5.8. Any such application shall be accompanied by                                                     <br /><br /><br />
the processing fee required by Section 16.1(e) or (f), as applicable.                                                      <br /><br /><br />
(e)    In the event of any loss or damage to (i) the property of the Company,                                              <br /><br /><br />
including any property leased or deemed to be leased from the                                                              <br /><br /><br />
Government or a third party; (ii) any property used in Operations title to_                                                <br /><br /><br />
which is retained by the Government or shall automatically revert to the                                                   <br /><br /><br />
Government upon termination of this Agreement (whether under Section                                                       <br /><br /><br />
26 or otherwise); or (m) any property which constitutes social                                                             <br /><br /><br />
infrastructure (c.g., schools or medical facilities) which is constructed by,                                              <br /><br /><br />
or on behalf of, the Company, the Company shall promptly proceed to                                                        <br /><br /><br />
restore such property:                                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
(i)    in the case of property described in the foregoing clause (i) or (ii),                                              <br /><br /><br />
to the extent necessary to begin or resume Operations as                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
contemplated by the Feasibility Report, and                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
(ii)    in the ease of property described in the foregoing clause (iii), to the                                            <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
extent necessary to allow the Company to fulfill its obligations                                                           <br /><br /><br />
under this Agreement for which such property is utilized.                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
(f)    The Company may contract the operation of all or an/ portion of a                                                   <br /><br /><br />
completed Mine, Mining Plant or Infrastructure to any Person organized                                                     <br /><br /><br />
under the Laws of Liberia who has the technical expertise and financial                                                    <br /><br /><br />
ability to conduct such operation and who is not a shareholder of the                                                      <br /><br /><br />
Company or an Affiliate of a shareholder of the Company. If the                                                            <br /><br /><br />
Company contracts any operation in accordance with the foregoing                                                           <br /><br /><br />
sentence, the Company is responsible to the Government for the                                                             <br /><br /><br />
compliance by such third party with all requirements of this Agreement                                                     <br /><br /><br />
applicable to the operations undertaken by such contractor as though such                                                  <br /><br /><br />
operations were undertaken by the Company. The requirements of Section                                                     <br /><br /><br />
11.1 shall apply to the operations of any such contractors). Material                                                      <br /><br /><br />
operating contracts shall be disclosed in each annual operating report of                                                  <br /><br /><br />
the Company under Section 6.8(e).                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
6.4 Recovery Shortfalls.                                                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
 (a) If in the reasonable opinion of the Government, the Company is failing                                                <br /><br /><br />
 without good cause to produce, transport and ship marketable Iron Ore at                                                  <br /><br /><br />
                      not less than 80% of the rate indicated in the approved Feasi     lility Report,                     <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                               r                         7 <br /><br /><br />
                              47                                         \U                                                <br /><br /><br />
                                                            M                                                         re   <br /><br /><br />
﻿it may give notice in writing to the Company. Within three months of the      <br /><br /><br />
receipt of this notice the Company shall                                      <br /><br /><br />
(i)    commence work to improve its operations to the reasonable              <br /><br /><br />
satisfaction of the Government, provided that the Company shall in            <br /><br /><br />
no event be obliged to conduct Mining, processing or treatment                <br /><br /><br />
activities otherwise than is economically and technically feasible at         <br /><br /><br />
the time, and                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
(ii)    submit to the Government evidence that the steps it is taking will    <br /><br /><br />
lead to compliance with Section 6.3(a).                                       <br /><br /><br />
If the Government remains unsatislied with the Company’s response to          <br /><br /><br />
such notice, the Government may commission an independent technical           <br /><br /><br />
study to determine a fair average recovery and/or shipment rate taking into   <br /><br /><br />
account the nature of the reserves then being mined, the nature of the        <br /><br /><br />
Mines, Mining Plant, Infrastructure and other equipment (assuming they        <br /><br /><br />
are of the design and quality set forth in the Feasibility Report and have    <br /><br /><br />
been prudently maintained and operated), and the economic and technical       <br /><br /><br />
feasibility of achieving increased recovery and/or shipment of Produces)      <br /><br /><br />
by the Company in accordance with the standards set forth in Section          <br /><br /><br />
6.3(a). Such study shall be carried out by an internationally recognized      <br /><br /><br />
independent mining engineering consultant appointed by the Government         <br /><br /><br />
from a list of three such consultants, none of whom shall be affiliated with  <br /><br /><br />
the Company or any of its principal direct or indirect, shareholders          <br /><br /><br />
(including any Shareholder or Scsa Goa), named by the Company on the          <br /><br /><br />
request of the Government. Each of the Government and the Company             <br /><br /><br />
may submit information to the consultant. The fees and expenses of such       <br /><br /><br />
consultant shall be borne by the Company, but unless the consultant           <br /><br /><br />
concludes the performance of the Company’s Production is at least 10%         <br /><br /><br />
less than the fair average recovery rate referred to in the first sentence of <br /><br /><br />
this Section 6.4(b), the Company shall be entitled to offset the fees and     <br /><br /><br />
expenses of such consultant against Royalties subsequently payable by the     <br /><br /><br />
Company under Section 15,1 of this Agreement.                                 <br /><br /><br />
If following the completion of such study, the Company fails within a         <br /><br /><br />
reasonable period to achieve the fair average recovery rate indicated by      <br /><br /><br />
such study, the Government may increase the Royally applicable to such        <br /><br /><br />
Products under Section 15.1 in proportion to the extent that recovery of      <br /><br /><br />
such Products by the Company is less than 90% of the fair average rate        <br /><br /><br />
indicated by such studies. But at no time shall the payment of such           <br /><br /><br />
increased Royalty free the Company from its obligation to satisfy Section     <br /><br /><br />
6.3(a).                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
In no event shall recovery shortfalls caused by a suspension order            <br /><br /><br />
incorrectly given in accordance with Section 24 hereof shall fall within the  <br /><br /><br />
scope of this Section 6.4 and shall not give any rights to the Government     <br /><br /><br />
in accordance with this Section 6.4.                                          <br /><br /><br />
﻿6.5 lnr.tfa Liberia-Based Value-Added Production Capacity.                          <br /><br /><br />
(a) The Company will work towards and assist the Government in achieving            <br /><br /><br />
.the policy of the establishment or expansion of downstream metals                  <br /><br /><br />
processing facilities in Liberia in relation to pelletization or other further      <br /><br /><br />
beneficiation, refining and/or metals manufacturing and fabricating (to the         <br /><br /><br />
extent not already carried out by the Company pursuant to an approved               <br /><br /><br />
Feasibility Report) if, in light of recognized economic, technical and              <br /><br /><br />
scientific standards, the Iron Ore mined by the Company is amenable to              <br /><br /><br />
such additional activities and provided it is economically and practically          <br /><br /><br />
feasible to do so.                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
(k) At any time if the Company wishes to establish its own beneficiation,           <br /><br /><br />
pelletisation, refining or manufacturing facilities in Liberia, it may do so        <br /><br /><br />
pursuant to applicable Law, provided that any such facilities shall be              <br /><br /><br />
deemed additional Mining Plant to be incorporated in an amended                     <br /><br /><br />
Feasibility Report satisfying the requirements of Sections 5.6 through 5.8.         <br /><br /><br />
(c)    The Company shall submit to the Minister copies of any studies relating to   <br /><br /><br />
the feasibility of establishing in Liberia the facilities as described in           <br /><br /><br />
Section 6.5(a) prepared by or at the direction of the Company.                      <br /><br /><br />
(d)    In the event that pelletisation facilities are proposed to be established in <br /><br /><br />
Liberia by an entity other than an Affiliate of the Company for the further         <br /><br /><br />
processing of Products of the type produced by the Company, the                     <br /><br /><br />
Company shall agree to make its Product(s) available to that entity for             <br /><br /><br />
further processing on conditions not less favorable than the conditions that        <br /><br /><br />
can be obtained by the Company for sale of such products outside of                 <br /><br /><br />
Liberia. This obligation of the Company is subject and subordinate to any           <br /><br /><br />
beneficiation, pelletisation, refining, manufacturing or marketing contracts        <br /><br /><br />
with third parties entered into by the Company prior to the Company’s               <br /><br /><br />
receipt of a request to commit Product(s) to such facilities, but in the case       <br /><br /><br />
of any such contract, onl/for such period of time as the Company has no             <br /><br /><br />
right to terminate (or to decline to renew or extend) such contract.                <br /><br /><br />
(e) Within five years of first production the Company must finance a pre¬           <br /><br /><br />
feasibility study for the establishment in Liberia of a facility for the next       <br /><br /><br />
value added step in the transformation of Iron Ore into steel. “Value               <br /><br /><br />
added” means at a minimum both an increase in value ami an increase in              <br /><br /><br />
purity (grade) of the Product(s) of the Company’s Mine(s). If at the time           <br /><br /><br />
of the study the parties cannot agree on the appropriate next value                 <br /><br /><br />
addition step or steps, the parties will select an international expert in          <br /><br /><br />
iron and steel production to define the appropriate focus of the pre¬               <br /><br /><br />
feasibility study, with the costs of such expert to be shared equally by the        <br /><br /><br />
Government and the Company.                                                         <br /><br /><br />
(I) The pre-feasibility study shall be conducted for the Government by an           <br /><br /><br />
internationally recognized independent consulting firm with significant             <br /><br /><br />
experience in the design of Iron Ore processing facilities and the                  <br /><br /><br />
production of iron and steel selected by the Company from a list of such            <br /><br /><br />
firms provided by the Government. Unless within 360 days of receipt of              <br /><br /><br />
﻿the completed pre-feasibility study the Company undertakes to establish                 <br /><br /><br />
(directly, with appropriate partners or by agreement with a third party)                <br /><br /><br />
such a value added facility, the Government shall be entitled to utilize the            <br /><br /><br />
pre-feasibility study for any purpose, including the establishment of such a            <br /><br /><br />
value added facility itself (directly or with partners) or to permit third              <br /><br /><br />
parties to utilize such pre-feasibility study to solicit third parties to               <br /><br /><br />
establish such a value added facility and, as between it and the Company,               <br /><br /><br />
shall retain all right, title and interest therein. If the Company fails to             <br /><br /><br />
notify the Government of its interest in establishing such a value add                  <br /><br /><br />
facility within 90 days of its receipt of a copy thereof, it shall be deemed to         <br /><br /><br />
have declined to establish such a value add facility.                                   <br /><br /><br />
6.6    Concerning Road Construction and Renovations.                                    <br /><br /><br />
The Company will build a two-lane asphalt paved all-weather road from                   <br /><br /><br />
Tubmanburg to Mano River (Kongo) for general public use with capacity for               <br /><br /><br />
handling heavy traffic (the “Road”), Not later than the second (2"'1) anniversary of    <br /><br /><br />
the Effective Date, the Company will begin preliminary work on the Road,                <br /><br /><br />
including a feasibility study (which shall include route, design and construction       <br /><br /><br />
specifications, completion milestones and such other provisions reasonably              <br /><br /><br />
required by the Ministry of Public Works), survey, and completion of the tender         <br /><br /><br />
process for construction. Prior to such time, the Ministry of Public Works will         <br /><br /><br />
develop the standards for the design, construction and paving of the Road.              <br /><br /><br />
..    . Construction of the Road shall begin within not more than one (1) year of the   <br /><br /><br />
Government’s approval of the feasibility study referenced in this Section 6.6. The      <br /><br /><br />
Road shall be completed to the satisfaction of the Ministry of Public Works as          <br /><br /><br />
soon as possible thereafter, but in any case within not more than two (2) years of      <br /><br /><br />
the Government’s approval of the feasibility study referenced in this Section 6.6.      <br /><br /><br />
Completion and conformity of the Road with agreed standards shall be certified          <br /><br /><br />
by an internationally recognized road engineering consulting firm.                      <br /><br /><br />
6.7    Concerning Railroad and Port Construction and Operations and Ore                 <br /><br /><br />
Transportation.                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
(a) The Development Plan shall provide for the construction by the Company              <br /><br /><br />
or another entity that is mutually acceptable to the Company and the                    <br /><br /><br />
Government of a railroad (the “Railroad”) from the Mines to that certain                <br /><br /><br />
portion of the Port as designated and marked on the map attached as                     <br /><br /><br />
Exhibit 10A, with the capacity to move from the Mines to the Port on a                  <br /><br /><br />
continuing basis the maximum sustained output of Products contemplated                  <br /><br /><br />
by the Feasibility Report. The Railroad shall be designed so that it can be             <br /><br /><br />
expanded on a commercially feasible basis to carry on a continuing basis                <br /><br /><br />
twice as much traffic as is contemplated by the preceding sentence but the              <br /><br /><br />
Company shall not be under any obligation to build such additional                      <br /><br /><br />
capacity except as it may elect pursuant to this Section 6.7. The                       <br /><br /><br />
Government or any third-party may elect to have the capacity of the                     <br /><br /><br />
Railroad expanded to service the requirements of the Government or such                 <br /><br /><br />
third-party with the costs of such expansion to be borne by the                         <br /><br /><br />
Government or such third parly, as applicable. The Government shall                     <br /><br /><br />
retain title to the fixed assets of the Railroad.                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
 \.                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
﻿N.A’vviiiisundiny tile foregoing commitment to develop and construct the     <br /><br /><br />
Railroad pursuant to the foregoing paragraph, the Company shall be           <br /><br /><br />
entitled, working in conjunction with the Ministry of Public Works           <br /><br /><br />
(MOPW), to develop new roads and/or rehabilitate existing roads from its     <br /><br /><br />
mining sites to the Port, along the corridor designated in Exhibit 10B       <br /><br /><br />
hereto (which exhibit shall be prepared by the MOPW and attached to this     <br /><br /><br />
Agreement as an exhibit when it has been approved by the MOPW), as           <br /><br /><br />
may be reasonably required by the Company, subject to compliance with        <br /><br /><br />
applicable Laws, including the receipt of all necessary approvals and        <br /><br /><br />
permits, in connection with such development or rehabilitation. As a         <br /><br /><br />
condition to the use by the Company of new or existing roads to transport    <br /><br /><br />
Iron Ore to the Port, the Company shall conduct a short-form feasibility     <br /><br /><br />
study in accordance with terms of reference and other criteria specified by  <br /><br /><br />
the Government. Subject to approval by the Government of such                <br /><br /><br />
feasibility study, for a period of three (3) years following the approval of <br /><br /><br />
such feasibility study, the Company shall be allowed to transport Iron Ore   <br /><br /><br />
to the Port via such roads by trucks in the manner specified in and in       <br /><br /><br />
accordance with such feasibility study. As soon as the Railroad becomes      <br /><br /><br />
operational and can be used to transport the iron Ore to the Port, the       <br /><br /><br />
Company shall cease transporting the Iron Ore by trucks and shall only       <br /><br /><br />
transport it by the Railroad. The Company shall be responsible, at the       <br /><br /><br />
direction of the MOPW, for performing and paying for repair of any           <br /><br /><br />
damages and abnormal wear to roads and other infrastructure caused by its    <br /><br /><br />
use of public roads to transport Iron Ore. The Government shall retain title <br /><br /><br />
to any such roads constructed by the Company.                                <br /><br /><br />
The Development Plan shall provide (i) for the rehabilitation by the         <br /><br /><br />
Company of the Port and, (ii) provided the Government and the Company        <br /><br /><br />
agree, in the event the Feasibility Report contains a finding that the       <br /><br /><br />
Freeport of Monrovia cannot reasonably support the Iron Ore exporting        <br /><br /><br />
volume anticipated for the Company’s Operations throughout the term of       <br /><br /><br />
this Agreement after opportunities for expansion of the Freeport of          <br /><br /><br />
Monrovia have been exhausted, for the construction by the Company or         <br /><br /><br />
another entity that is mutually acceptable to the Company and the            <br /><br /><br />
Government of a new port or jetty (and related logistic areas) as required   <br /><br /><br />
to support its operations which shall be suitable and at a reasonable        <br /><br /><br />
distance from the Company’s mining sites. The Government shall provide       <br /><br /><br />
Marine Services and retain legal title to the leased areas of the Port and   <br /><br /><br />
shall receive title to any fixed assets of the Port as built by the Company, <br /><br /><br />
while the Company shall have priority rights to possession and use of such   <br /><br /><br />
assets subject to the terms and conditions of this Agreement, including      <br /><br /><br />
those with respect to the rights of third parties to utilize such assets     <br /><br /><br />
described in Section 6.7(d). Immediately upon the expiration of the Term     <br /><br /><br />
or any extensions thereof or earlier termination of this Agreement, all      <br /><br /><br />
rights of possession, control, and use shall revert to the Government. For   <br /><br /><br />
the avoidance of doubt, the Company shall at no time be exempt from          <br /><br /><br />
complying with all applicable Laws, including in particular all Laws with    <br /><br /><br />
respect to environmental contamination and remediation, in respect of its    <br /><br /><br />
activities relating to the Port or the transportation of ore by railroad or  <br /><br /><br />
roads. The Government shall, in consultation with the Company, and on        <br /><br /><br />
﻿ror.idbL; rioiKc to the Company, authorize third    use of excess                   <br /><br /><br />
capacity of the Port, provided that the Company or the Government                   <br /><br /><br />
confirms that excess capacity exists and third party use of such excess             <br /><br /><br />
capacity does not unreasonably interfere with the efficient and economic            <br /><br /><br />
conduct of the Operations. The technical and commercial terms for such              <br /><br /><br />
third party use of the excess capacity shall be mutually agreed to in good          <br /><br /><br />
faith among the Government, the Company, and such third parties in                  <br /><br /><br />
accordance with acceptable international industrial standards. A formula            <br /><br /><br />
to share the revenue fees from such third-party use shall be agreed upon in         <br /><br /><br />
good faith between the Government and the Company. Such third party                 <br /><br /><br />
access and use shall be at no cost to the Company, and all related costs            <br /><br /><br />
shall be borne by the third party. The Company is not authorized to                 <br /><br /><br />
provide port operational services to any such third part)' users of the leased      <br /><br /><br />
areas of the Port or any new port that the Company may be authorized to             <br /><br /><br />
construct hereunder.                                                                <br /><br /><br />
(d)    The Company has priority use of the NIOC and LMC Iron Ore piers              <br /><br /><br />
located in the Port during the Exploration and Production Operating                 <br /><br /><br />
Periods and any extensions thereof, subject to all applicable Laws, the             <br /><br /><br />
terms of the Port Lease, and rights of third parties relating to the Port,          <br /><br /><br />
including the rights of APMT Terminals Liberia, Ltd. (“APMT”) as set                <br /><br /><br />
forth in the Act to Ratify the Concession Agreement Between the National            <br /><br /><br />
Port Authority and APM Terminals Liberia, Ltd., ratified September 17,              <br /><br /><br />
2010 (the '‘Freeport Concession Agreement'’), and APMT’s rights to use              <br /><br /><br />
the LMC Pier during the “Construction Phase” (as such term is defined in            <br /><br /><br />
Section 1.01 and Appendix 4 of the Freeport Concession Agreement) as                <br /><br /><br />
set forth in Sections 4.04 and 7.06 of the Freeport Concession Agreement.           <br /><br /><br />
The Company shall use its best efforts to reach a separate written                  <br /><br /><br />
agreement with APMT as to mutual use of and access to the LMC Pier                  <br /><br /><br />
during the “Construction Phase” (as such term is defined in Section 1.01            <br /><br /><br />
and Appendix 4 of the Freeport Concession Agreement), or until such                 <br /><br /><br />
earlier time as APMT no longer has need to use the LMC Pier. Any such               <br /><br /><br />
agreement with APMT shall, to the extent possible, minimize any material            <br /><br /><br />
adverse effects on the ability of. APMT to perform its operations or                <br /><br /><br />
complete construction as contemplated by the Freeport Concession                    <br /><br /><br />
Agreement and, in particular, Section 4.04(b) thereof.                              <br /><br /><br />
(e)    In accordance with applicable Law, and subject to a feasibility study at the <br /><br /><br />
sole expense of the Company to determine commercial viability to be                 <br /><br /><br />
approved by the Company and the Government, the Company shall make                  <br /><br /><br />
provision for additional passenger service and the transportation of non¬           <br /><br /><br />
bulk cargo on the Railroad.                                                         <br /><br /><br />
(f)    If the Government or one or more third parties wish to use the Railroad to   <br /><br /><br />
move bulk cargo, the Company shall permit such usage subject to the                 <br /><br /><br />
negotiation by the Company and the Government or such third party of                <br /><br /><br />
commercially reasonable rates for such usage. The costs of all required             <br /><br /><br />
additions to rolling stock and motive power to accommodate such usage               <br /><br /><br />
shall be borne by the Government or such third party', as applicable. If            <br /><br /><br />
accommodation of the requested additional usage would materially                    <br /><br /><br />
﻿adversely oifed the ability ol'lhe Company to move iron Ore to the Port or           <br /><br /><br />
handle Iron Ore trains at the Port, the Government or such third party shall         <br /><br /><br />
bear the cost of the additional investment needed to enhance the Railroad            <br /><br /><br />
to avoid such material adverse effect.                                               <br /><br /><br />
(g)    If the Government or one or more third parties wish to use the Railroad to    <br /><br /><br />
carry bulk cargo, the Company may continue to operate the Railroad itself            <br /><br /><br />
and carry out the operation of all trains on the Railroad, or the Company            <br /><br /><br />
may transfer operational responsibility for the Railroad to an operating             <br /><br /><br />
company owned by the Company and each other entity that has                          <br /><br /><br />
contributed to the capital investment (exclusive of motive power and                 <br /><br /><br />
rolling stock) in the railway, and such operating company may either                 <br /><br /><br />
operate the Railroad and all trains, or may be responsible solely for the            <br /><br /><br />
operation and maintenance of the fixed rail facilities and allow all persons         <br /><br /><br />
that meet non-discriminatory operating standards to operate their own bulk           <br /><br /><br />
cargo trains on the fixed rail facilities, Whether the operator is the               <br /><br /><br />
Company or such new operating company, the Railroad shall be operated                <br /><br /><br />
in a way that does not discriminate against the shipments of any Person.             <br /><br /><br />
(h)    During the Exploration Period, the Company shall develop preliminary          <br /><br /><br />
studies estimating the cost of constructing, respectively, each of the               <br /><br /><br />
Railroad and the Port, based on the Company’s estimate at the time of the            <br /><br /><br />
respective required rail and port capacity, the additional works and                 <br /><br /><br />
equipment that would be required, to double the capacity of the Railroad as          <br /><br /><br />
- • contemplated by Section 6.7(a) and' to rehabilitate and expand the Port or       <br /><br /><br />
construct a new port or jetty as contemplated, by Section 6.7(c), and the            <br /><br /><br />
estimated cost of such additional works and equipment. The capital                   <br /><br /><br />
development plan required by Section 5.6(a)(iv)(3) to be included in the             <br /><br /><br />
Feasibility Study shall set forth the estimated costs of constructing,               <br /><br /><br />
respectively, each of the Railroad and the Port, shall identify with                 <br /><br /><br />
reasonable specificity the additional works and equipment required to                <br /><br /><br />
double the respective capacity of the Railroad as contemplated by Section            <br /><br /><br />
6.7(a), and shall set forth the cost of such additional works and equipment          <br /><br /><br />
(if performed or provided immediately after the respective completion of             <br /><br /><br />
the initial railroad). The additional equipment referred to in this Section          <br /><br /><br />
6.7(h) does not include the motive power and rolling stock required to               <br /><br /><br />
increase the capacity of the Railroad.                                               <br /><br /><br />
(i)    If the Government or a third party wishes to provide for expansion of the     <br /><br /><br />
Railroad’s capacity as contemplated by Sections 6.7(a) and (f), the                  <br /><br /><br />
Company may elect to, but is not required to, itself carry out or contract           <br /><br /><br />
for the additional work required. If it does so elect, it shall agree to             <br /><br /><br />
complete the expansion within a commercially reasonable period of lime,              <br /><br /><br />
assuming that the necessary' funding is timely received and subject to force         <br /><br /><br />
majeure (it being understood that the Company is not obligated to incur              <br /><br /><br />
binding commitments until funding for those commitments is in hand). If              <br /><br /><br />
it does not so elect, the third party responsible for the expansion work shall       <br /><br /><br />
submit the expansion designs and work plan to the Company for approval,              <br /><br /><br />
which shall not be withheld unless such designs and works plans would                <br /><br /><br />
unreasonably interfere with Operations.                                              <br /><br /><br />

(k)    If there is a dispute with the Company as to any matter arising under         <br /><br /><br />
Sections 6.7(1), (g) or (i) that is not resolved within 60 days after it is          <br /><br /><br />
identified by any party to such dispute by notice to the other parties as a          <br /><br /><br />
“senior management dispute”, each party to such dispute shall promptly               <br /><br /><br />
designate a senior member of the management of its ultimate controlling              <br /><br /><br />
entity to participate in discussions to determine whether such dispute can           <br /><br /><br />
be resolved, ff the Government is a party to the dispute, the President shall        <br /><br /><br />
designate a minister of cabinet rank to participate on behalf of the                 <br /><br /><br />
Government.                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
(l)    If a resolution of any such dispute cannot be reached within 105 days after   <br /><br /><br />
designation pursuant to the preceding paragraph as a “senior management              <br /><br /><br />
dispute,” the Company, the Government or a third party that is a party to            <br /><br /><br />
the dispute may demand that the dispute, be submitted to a technical                 <br /><br /><br />
dispute resolution committee. The'Company shall designate two persons                <br /><br /><br />
to participate in such committee, and the other parlies to the dispute               <br /><br /><br />
(which may be the Government, the Government and one or more third                   <br /><br /><br />
parties, or one or more third parties) shall also designate two persons to           <br /><br /><br />
participate in such committee. One person designated by each side shall              <br /><br /><br />
have experience in cither railroad or port operations, as (he case may be,           <br /><br /><br />
and shall not be regularly employed or retained by any person party to or            <br /><br /><br />
/ having an interest in the outcome of the dispute. The four persons so              <br /><br /><br />
selected shall not be regularly employed or retained by any person party to          <br /><br /><br />
or having an interest in the outcome of the dispute and shall not be a               <br /><br /><br />
citizen of Liberia or of any country whose nationals have a material                 <br /><br /><br />
interest in the dispute. The four persons so selected shall choose a fifth           <br /><br /><br />
person who shall have experience in railroad operations, and shall not be            <br /><br /><br />
regularly employed or retained by any person party to or having an interest          <br /><br /><br />
in the outcome of the dispute and who shall chair the committee. The                 <br /><br /><br />
recommendations of the committee as to the resolution of the dispute shall           <br /><br /><br />
be binding on the parties to the dispute except that if the recommendations          <br /><br /><br />
of the committee depend upon a determination of the legal meaning of any             <br /><br /><br />
provision of this Agreement, the Company or the Government may seek                  <br /><br /><br />
arbitration under the terms of this Agreement as to the correctness of such          <br /><br /><br />
determination.                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
(m)    Disputes among third parties or between one or more third parties and the     <br /><br /><br />
Government are not subject to the terms of the two preceding paragraphs.             <br /><br /><br />

﻿ Company Reporting Requirements.                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
 The Company shall submit to the Minister (and the Minister of Finance, in the                                 <br /><br /><br />
 case of Section 6.8(f)) the following Production and financial reports, in addition                           <br /><br /><br />
 to the financial statements required by Section 17.4:                                                         <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
(a)    prior to the grant of a Mining License, those reports required by Section 6                             <br /><br /><br />
of the Exploration Regulations;                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
(b)    following the grant of a Mining License but prior to satisfaction of the                                <br /><br /><br />
capacity demonstration requirement set forth in Section 6.2, a six-monthly                                     <br /><br /><br />
report on the progress of construction of the Mining Plant and                                                 <br /><br /><br />
Infrastructure provided for in the approved Feasibility Report, indicating                                     <br /><br /><br />
progress and expenditures to date, and estimated date of satisfaction of the                                   <br /><br /><br />
capacity demonstration requirement;                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
(c)    a quarterly statistical report-'(which shall be delivered for every quarter,                            <br /><br /><br />
including months ending an annual reporting period) beginning with the                                         <br /><br /><br />
calendar quarter in which commencement of the Production Operating                                             <br /><br /><br />
Period occurred, setting forth (i) the amounts of Iron Ore Mined, the                                          <br /><br /><br />
amounts of Iron Ore processed at the Mine, the amounts of Product(s)                                           <br /><br /><br />
shipped to the port, the amounts of Product(s) exported, the amounts of                                        <br /><br /><br />
Product(s) otherwise disposed of and the stocks of mined Iron Ore and                                          <br /><br /><br />
Product(s) at the end of the period at the Mine and at the port (Produces)                                     <br /><br /><br />
in transit being deemed located at the port), (a) the number and location of                                   <br /><br /><br />
the workings on which work was performed during the preceding quarter,                                         <br /><br /><br />
(Hi) the number of workers employed thereon at the end of the quarter, and                                     <br /><br /><br />
(iv) a brief description of the work in progress at the end of the quarter and                                 <br /><br /><br />
of the work contemplated during the following quarter;                                                         <br /><br /><br />
(d)    a quarterly operating report, beginning with the calendar quarter in which                              <br /><br /><br />
the commencement of the Production Operating Period occurred,                                                  <br /><br /><br />
concerning the progress of Us operations in the Production Areas that are                                      <br /><br /><br />

6.9 Books and Records.                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
The Company shall maintain at its principal office in Liberia, or at such other             <br /><br /><br />
offices as the Minister may approve, copies of all maps, geological, mining or              <br /><br /><br />
other earth science reports and mineral analyses (together with all field data which        <br /><br /><br />
support such reports or data), production records, marketing and financial reports          <br /><br /><br />
and other data obtained or compiled by the Company as a result of Operations.               <br /><br /><br />
The Government shall have full access to inspect on site all such information, data         <br /><br /><br />
and material, following receipt by the Company of at least two Business Days’               <br /><br /><br />
prior written notice provided that such access does not unreasonably interfere with         <br /><br /><br />
Operations.                                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
6.10    Inspection.                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
The Ministry and other agencies of the Government having jurisdictions (such as             <br /><br /><br />
the EPA and any governmental entity at the time responsible for employee safety             <br /><br /><br />
and welfare) shall have the right to monitor Operations (including inspecting               <br /><br /><br />
relevant documents) from time to time and inay, without prior notice but at                 <br /><br /><br />
reasonable times of day and without materially interfering with the normal                  <br /><br /><br />
conduct of the Company’s business, visit and inspect any of the facilities and              <br /><br /><br />
Operations of the Company in Liberia, provided that nothing herein shall limit the          <br /><br /><br />
right of the Government to access or inspect facilities and Operations of the               <br /><br /><br />
Company in order lo investigate criminal, security, employee health and safety or           <br /><br /><br />
environmental matters, which inspections may, for the avoidance of doubt, be                <br /><br /><br />
conducted at any time.                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
6.11    Insurance.                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
(a) At all times during the Term (including during the construction period) the             <br /><br /><br />
Company will maintain, with financially sound and reputable insurers,                       <br /><br /><br />
insurance with respect to its properties, including any properties leased or                <br /><br /><br />
deemed to be leased from the Government or a third party, any other                         <br /><br /><br />
property used in Operations title to which is retained by the Government or                 <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
                                                                      O,                    <br /><br /><br />
                                     \v          J                                          <br /><br /><br />

﻿shall ;u«iunv!-'cai:y ;v;vcr '••• 'h" <’aw.:p-.;v !er-»in;Kion of the                    <br /><br /><br />
Agreement (whether puisuant to Section 26 or otherwise), and any                         <br /><br /><br />
properly which constitutes social infrastructure (e.g., schools or medical               <br /><br /><br />
facilities) which is constructed by, or on behalf of, the Company, against               <br /><br /><br />
such casualties and contingencies, of such types, on such terms and in such              <br /><br /><br />
amounts (including deductibles, co-insurance and self-insurance, if                      <br /><br /><br />
adequate reserves are maintained with respect thereto) as is customary in                <br /><br /><br />
the case of entities of established reputations engaged in the same or a                 <br /><br /><br />
similar business. Such insurance shall include protection against loss or                <br /><br /><br />
damage to such property, third-party liability insurance and, to the extent              <br /><br /><br />
commercially available on reasonable terms, business interruption                        <br /><br /><br />
insurance (as to which the Government shall be an additional named                       <br /><br /><br />
insured or loss payee as its interest so appears). The Company shall                     <br /><br /><br />
provide the Government at least annually with evidence as to the existence               <br /><br /><br />
of such insurance.                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
(b) Where an event occurs which gives rise to an ability to make a claim                 <br /><br /><br />
against the insurance maintained by the Company pursuant to Section                      <br /><br /><br />
6.11(a), unless the Government consents otherwise, the Company shall                     <br /><br /><br />
promptly file a claim with the relevant insurance company and, in the case               <br /><br /><br />
of third party liability insurance, the Government shall be entitled to file a           <br /><br /><br />
claim. Unless the Government consents otherwise, the Company shall                       <br /><br /><br />
be obligated to re-invest the proceeds of insurance covering loss or                     <br /><br /><br />
damage to any properly which constitutes social infrastructure which is                  <br /><br /><br />
constructed by, or on behalf of the Company or title to which is retained                <br /><br /><br />
by the Government or shall automatically revert to the Government upon                   <br /><br /><br />
termination of this Agreement (whether pursuant to Section 26 or                         <br /><br /><br />
otherwise) for the restoration or replacement of such property. In respect               <br /><br /><br />
of any other insurance coverage for loss or damage to property, the                      <br /><br /><br />
Company shall be entitled to re-invesl or retain the insurance proceeds as it            <br /><br /><br />
shall determine in its sole discretion, provided, that if the Company does               <br /><br /><br />
not re-invesl the proceeds and as result thereof there is no material                    <br /><br /><br />
production or processing in a Production Area, then in respect of that                   <br /><br /><br />
Production Area the Company shall relinquish the Mining License                          <br /><br /><br />
applicable to such Production Area.                                                      <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 7 LAND AND FACILITIES                                                            <br /><br /><br />
7.1 Surface Rights.                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
Subject to Section 6.3(b). the Company shall have the right, subject to the              <br /><br /><br />
requirements of applicable Law, to enter upon and utilize Land included in (i) the       <br /><br /><br />
Exploration Area, (ii) as otherwise specified in Sections 5.1(b) of this Agreement,      <br /><br /><br />
and, (iii) following the issue of a Mining License, in 3 Production Area for             <br /><br /><br />
purposes of and incidental to Operations; subject to the payment of reasonable           <br /><br /><br />
compensation to the Landowners or Occupants of Land so utilized for loss of or           <br /><br /><br />
diminution in the value of such Land or the products thereof attributable to             <br /><br /><br />
Operations.                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
 \                         &                            ’ •‘N                            <br /><br /><br />
﻿7.2    Limitation on Exploration and Production.                                             <br /><br /><br />
This Agreement may not be construed to permit the Company to Explore for Iron                <br /><br /><br />
Ore or any other Minerals outside of the Exploration Area or, following the end of           <br /><br /><br />
the Exploration Period, other than Exploration for Iron Ore in a Proposed or actual          <br /><br /><br />
Production Area, or to produce any Minerals from outside an approved Production              <br /><br /><br />
Area.                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
7.3    Acciuisition of Land Use Rights Outside a Production Area.                            <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
(a)    To the extent otherwise permitted by applicable Law and not already                   <br /><br /><br />
provided for in this Agreement, the Company is permitted to acquire                          <br /><br /><br />
surface land use rights in respect of Land which is not included in the                      <br /><br /><br />
Production Area sufficient to entitle it to construct, install and operate                   <br /><br /><br />
Mining Plant or Infrastructure. If following the approval of a feasibility                   <br /><br /><br />
Report the Company cannot reasonably obtain sufficient land use rights to                    <br /><br /><br />
enable it to construct, install and operate Mining Plant or Infrastructure                   <br /><br /><br />
provided for in the approved Feasibility Report, the Government will make                    <br /><br /><br />
available to the Company for such purposes Land owned by the                                 <br /><br /><br />
Government and not subject to a valid leasehold or other third parly                         <br /><br /><br />
interest and not otherwise required for the achievement of other                             <br /><br /><br />
Government programs. If the Government cannot make available to the                          <br /><br /><br />
Company sufficient surface rights in such Land and the Company is                            <br /><br /><br />
unable to acquire sufficient rights from relevant third parties on reasonable                <br /><br /><br />
terms and conditions, the Government shall assist the Company in                             <br /><br /><br />
acquiring sufficient rights for such purposes, including providing                           <br /><br /><br />
assistance for the purposes of clarifying the nature and extent of any title                 <br /><br /><br />
to Land. If no other surface rights are reasonably available to the                          <br /><br /><br />
Company for such purposes the Government will use its powers of                              <br /><br /><br />
eminent domain to obtain such rights from an unwilling third party.                          <br /><br /><br />
(b)    Surface rights made available by the Government from I,and owned by the               <br /><br /><br />
Government shall be subject to applicable provisions of the Revenue                          <br /><br /><br />
Code, including any obligation to pay surface rental.                                        <br /><br /><br />
7.4    Costs of Acquisition of Land Use Rights: Termination of Riuhts.                       <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
(a)    All costs incurred by the Company or by the Government at the request of              <br /><br /><br />
the Company in connection with the acquisition by the Company from                           <br /><br /><br />
parties other than the Government of rights in Land for activities provided                  <br /><br /><br />
for in an approved Feasibility Report, including costs incurred by the                       <br /><br /><br />
Government pursuant to its exercise of its powers of eminent domain, shall                   <br /><br /><br />
be borne by the Company. Payment shall be due within 30 days following                       <br /><br /><br />
receipt by the Company of a statement from the Government setting forth                      <br /><br /><br />
the amounts for which reimbursement is sought.                                               <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
(b)    The Company’s right to occupy such Land shall terminate at the end of the             <br /><br /><br />
Term, or, if earlier, at such time as it is no longer used in the Company's                  <br /><br /><br />
business if other use can be made of such Land without danger to the                         <br /><br /><br />
Occupants of Land or other users of the relevant areas or interference with                  <br /><br /><br />
the Company’s business.                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
