﻿ SECTION a COMMUNITY RESOURCES                                                        <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
8.1    Community Responsibility.                                                      <br /><br /><br />
It is the policy of the Government and the obligation of the Company to develop       <br /><br /><br />
programs lor the development and maintenance of the economic and social               <br /><br /><br />
viability of the centers of population that have formed and that may form as a        <br /><br /><br />
result of Operations during the term of this Agreement. Upon the reasonable           <br /><br /><br />
request of the Government at any time the Company shall work with the                 <br /><br /><br />
Government and the local communities affected by Operations to establish plans        <br /><br /><br />
and programs for the implementation of this objective, and thereafter the             <br /><br /><br />
Company shall in good faith cooperate with the Government with regard to its          <br /><br /><br />
efforts concerning the realization of such plans and programs, provided that the      <br /><br /><br />
Company shall be under no obligation to provide financial assistance or otherwise     <br /><br /><br />
commit resources for the purpose of achieving such plans and programs other than      <br /><br /><br />
as specified in this Agreement.                                                       <br /><br /><br />
8.2    Community Funding Obligation                                                   <br /><br /><br />
(a)    The Company shall provide the annual social contribution set forth below       <br /><br /><br />
(the “Annual Social Contribution”), as provided in this Section 8.2(a).               <br /><br /><br />
Commencing on the Effective Date and thereafter on each anniversary of                <br /><br /><br />
the Effective Date until the end of the year prior to the year in which the           <br /><br /><br />
Start of Commercial Production occurs with respect to the first Production            <br /><br /><br />
Area, the Company shall pay Two Million Dollars (US$2,000,000) within                 <br /><br /><br />
ten (10) days of the Effective Date for the first year of the Term; Two and           <br /><br /><br />
a Half Million Dollars (US$2,500,000) on each anniversary of the                      <br /><br /><br />
Effective Date until the year in which the Start of Commercial Production             <br /><br /><br />
occurs and on each anniversary of the Effective Date. Thereafter, the                 <br /><br /><br />
Company shall pay an Annual Social Contribution of Three Million and                  <br /><br /><br />
One Hundred Thousand Dollars (US$3,100,000) (adjusted annually for                    <br /><br /><br />
inflation in the manner provided for in Section 8.2(b)). The Annual Social            <br /><br /><br />
Contribution shall be deposited and held as provided in Exhibit 6. The                <br /><br /><br />
Annua! Social Contribution shall be in lieu of any obligation of the                  <br /><br /><br />
Company pursuant to Section 9.3(b) of the Exploration Regulations.                    <br /><br /><br />
(b)    The amount payable pursuant to Section 8.2 (a) shall be adjusted annually      <br /><br /><br />
for inflation for each payment after the initial payment in proportion to the         <br /><br /><br />
change in Deflator over the year ending on the last day of the month                  <br /><br /><br />
immediately prior to the due date of each payment. The Government’s                   <br /><br /><br />
determination of such amount shall be final, absent manifest error.                   <br /><br /><br />
(c)    The Annual Social Contribution and utilization of such funds for specific      <br /><br /><br />
projects shall be managed by a dedicated committee (the “Committee”) in               <br /><br /><br />
accordance with the structures established by the Government in                       <br /><br /><br />
consultation with the Committee from time to lime, provided that in all               <br /><br /><br />
cases (i) the Company shall at all times have at least one representative on          <br /><br /><br />
the Committee; (ii) structures and processes will be established to provide           <br /><br /><br />
for the participation (in a decision-making or advisory capacity as the               <br /><br /><br />
Government shall determine from time to time) of officials, businesses and            <br /><br /><br />
residents from the affected counties in the identification and selection of           <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                                             \                        <br /><br /><br />
﻿ projects to be supported with funds from the Annual Social Contribution;                   <br /><br /><br />
 (iii) no funds shall be disbursed from the Annual Social Contribution, if, in              <br /><br /><br />
 the Company’s view, the disbursement of the funds or the project                           <br /><br /><br />
 supported by the funds would cause.the Company to be in violation of                       <br /><br /><br />
 applicable Law, including any applicable anti-corruption laws; (iv) funds                  <br /><br /><br />
 from the Annual Social Contribution may be disbursed (A) only for direct                   <br /><br /><br />
 delivery of services and community Infrastructure improvements, and not                    <br /><br /><br />
 to fund the general work programs of administrative offices or officials                   <br /><br /><br />
 save funding of customary and reasonable compensation and benefits for                     <br /><br /><br />
 the Committee’s administrative assistant and of reasonable amount for                      <br /><br /><br />
 basic office supplies, and (B) except as provided in Exhibit 6, only for the               <br /><br /><br />
 benefit of Liberian communities in the affected counties, provided, that                   <br /><br /><br />
 residents of Bomi County, Grand Cape Mount County, and Gbarpolu                            <br /><br /><br />
 County and any other County identified in the Pre-Feasibility Report or the                <br /><br /><br />
 Feasibility Report as being directly impacted by Operations shall be the                   <br /><br /><br />
 primary beneficiaries. Projects supported with funds from the Annual                       <br /><br /><br />
 Social Contribution and the actual *8isbursements from the Annual Social                   <br /><br /><br />
 Contributions shall be publicly disclosed and shall be subject to the same                 <br /><br /><br />
 audit procedures provided for expenditures by the Government of Liberia                    <br /><br /><br />
 and as may be further provided by Law. Periodic reports and audit reports                  <br /><br /><br />
 shall be made available to the Company and to the public and the                           <br /><br /><br />
 Company shall have the right to independently audit (at its own expense)                   <br /><br /><br />
 any disbursement or expenditure made or project supported with funds                       <br /><br /><br />
 from the Annual Social Contribution and for this purpose shall be provided                 <br /><br /><br />
 with and have access to all relevant documentation and information.                        <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 9 PUBLIC HEALTH AND SAFETY                                                          <br /><br /><br />
9.1    Safety Procedures and Notifications.                                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
In connection with Operations, the Company shall install, maintain and use such             <br /><br /><br />
modern health and safety tjpvices, work gears and equipment, and shall practice             <br /><br /><br />
such modern health and safety procedures and precautions (including regular                 <br /><br /><br />
safety training instruction for its employees) as are in accordance with applicable         <br /><br /><br />
Law and International Mining Standards. The Company shall notify the                        <br /><br /><br />
Government promptly of any death of or serious injury to any employee of the                <br /><br /><br />
Company or any of its contractors or any other persons that occurs as a result of           <br /><br /><br />
Operations. For the purposes of this Section 9, a serious injury means an injury            <br /><br /><br />
that is likely to cause (he injured Person to lose five or more working days.               <br /><br /><br />
9.2    Security.                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
(a) The Company may, directly or by contract with a responsible provider of                 <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
security services, establish, manage and maintain its own asset and                         <br /><br /><br />
employee security and protection service for the purpose of maintaining                     <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
law', order and security in the Exploration Area, in each Proposed                          <br /><br /><br />
Production Area or in each Production Area and in the immediate vicinity                    <br /><br /><br />
of other locations at which Company has or maintains property and assets                    <br /><br /><br />
through its own security force and to do so always being subject (o                         <br /><br /><br />
applicable Law (including all Laws relating to apprehension and detention                   <br /><br /><br />
and human rights) and the “Voluntary Principles on Security and Human                       <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
                                                          0 N                             ) <br /><br /><br />
                           x 1                                                              <br /><br /><br />
﻿Rights” (as of October 2009 located at:                                       <br /><br /><br />
http://www,voluntarvDrinciDles.ore). provided that if at any time during      <br /><br /><br />
the Term the foregoing principles are no longer published on the Internet,    <br /><br /><br />
the last available published form shall apply to this Section 9.2(a) unless   <br /><br /><br />
and until the parties agreed upon an alternative set of principles to be      <br /><br /><br />
applied. Those members of the Company’s (or such contractor’s) security       <br /><br /><br />
services as being certified by the Ministry of Justice as being literate, as  <br /><br /><br />
having received training in police and law enforcement procedures given       <br /><br /><br />
by an outside contractor (which contractor has been certified by the          <br /><br /><br />
Ministry of Justice) and as having been provided with operating manuals       <br /><br /><br />
approved by the Ministry of Justice shall have enforcement powers within      <br /><br /><br />
the areas described in the preceding sentence, always being subject to        <br /><br /><br />
applicable Law.                                                               <br /><br /><br />
The Company’s security services will have (i) the power of apprehension       <br /><br /><br />
and detention in accordance with applicable Law, and (ji) ihe power, to the   <br /><br /><br />
extent permitted by applicable Law, to search and exclude or evict            <br /><br /><br />
unauthorized Persons from ihe areas described in Section 9.2(a). If any       <br /><br /><br />
person is detained by the Company’s security services, the appropriate        <br /><br /><br />
Government authority shall be notified immediately, and the person            <br /><br /><br />
detained shall be handed over to such authority as soon as practical and in   <br /><br /><br />
no case later than the earlier of 24 hours from the time of detention and     <br /><br /><br />
when requested by Liberian National Police. The Company’s security            <br /><br /><br />
services may not use unreasonable force in detaining, excluding or            <br /><br /><br />
evicting persons, whatever the nature of their intrusion, and any detention   <br /><br /><br />
facilities shall be adequately ventilated, reasonably clean and with access   <br /><br /><br />
to sanitary toilet facilities. In addition to the foregoing requirements, any <br /><br /><br />
security services provided by the Company in the Port or any new port,        <br /><br /><br />
whether directly or through a contractor, shall comply with the               <br /><br /><br />
International Code for the Security of Ships and Port Facilities (the “ISPS   <br /><br /><br />
Code”) and any port facility security plan adopted thereunder with respect    <br /><br /><br />
to the Port or any new port at which the Company conducts its Operations.     <br /><br /><br />
In accordance therewith, (he Company shall immediately notify the port        <br /><br /><br />
police of any security incident (within the meaning of the ISPS) and turn     <br /><br /><br />
over to the port police any person suspected of engaging in or threatening    <br /><br /><br />
to engage in a security incident who is detained by the Company or its        <br /><br /><br />
security services.                                                            <br /><br /><br />
The Company shall coordinate the activities of the Company security           <br /><br /><br />
services, or to the extent that a contractor provides such security services  <br /><br /><br />
to the Company, the Company shall procure that such contractor shall          <br /><br /><br />
coordinate with the Government’s police and law enforcement authorities       <br /><br /><br />
and report (or procure that the relevant contractor reports) quarterly to the <br /><br /><br />
Minister of Justice (with a copy to the Minister) on the activities of the    <br /><br /><br />
Company’s or its contractor’s security services (as applicable), including    <br /><br /><br />
numbers of persons detained and excluded or evicted, the reason for, the      <br /><br /><br />
place of and the period of any detention, and the disposition of each         <br /><br /><br />
detained person, provided that where the Company’s or its contractor’s        <br /><br /><br />
security sendees have detained any person, the Company or its contractor      <br /><br /><br />
(as applicable) shall report to the Minister of Justice (with a copy to the   <br /><br /><br />
﻿Minister) as soon as practicable and in any event within a month of the                                      <br /><br /><br />
relevant detention. Each such report shall be certified by the chief                                         <br /><br /><br />
executive officer of the Company (or by the equivalent person within the                                     <br /><br /><br />
contractor, as applicable) as being true and correct.                                                        <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
(d) The Company is and shall be fully responsible for the compliance of the                                  <br /><br /><br />
members of its security force, whether its employees or the employees of a                                   <br /><br /><br />
contractor, with all requirements of this Section 9.2 and for all                                            <br /><br /><br />
consequences of any breach of those requirements.                                                            <br /><br /><br />
9.3    Employee Housing.                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
The Company shall, either directly or indirectly, ensure access to housing for the                           <br /><br /><br />
employees of the Company and their resident spouses and resident dependent                                   <br /><br /><br />
children (up to the age of 21) and shall ensure that such housing conforms to                                <br /><br /><br />
minimum standards as agreed between the Government and the Company                                           <br /><br /><br />
including ensuring those requirements set out in Sections 9.4 to 9.6.                                        <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
9.4    Sanitation.                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
Access to housing under Section 9.3, will include provision for bathroom facilities                          <br /><br /><br />
with a toilet, sink and shower located in each house. The Company shall also                                 <br /><br /><br />
provide clean and accessible toilet (and, where the nature of the work makes it                              <br /><br /><br />
appropriate shower) facilities at its workplaces.                                                            <br /><br /><br />
9.5    Water Supply; Clean    and Safe Drinking Water.                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
Access to housing under Section 9.3, will include provision for a clean and sale                             <br /><br /><br />
pipe-borne water system for all houses. In addition, the Company shall construct                             <br /><br /><br />
hand pumps or other sources of water at its workplaces that ensure a convenient                              <br /><br /><br />
and uninterrupted supply ol'clean and safe drinking water. All drinking water                                <br /><br /><br />
shall meet or exceed the approved Government standards for drinking water                                    <br /><br /><br />
quality.                                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
9.6    Size of Houses.                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
Each family house will have separate bedrooms for parents and children, and, in                              <br /><br /><br />
addition separate bedrooms for male children and female children, i.c. a minimum                             <br /><br /><br />
of 2 or 3 bedrooms.                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 10 MEDICAL CARE                                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
Upon the commencement of construction of any Mine, Mining Plant or Infrastructure, the                       <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
Company shall construct or cause to be constructed, and during the period that a Mining                      <br /><br /><br />
License is in effect under this Agreement the Company shall maintain and operate or                          <br /><br /><br />
cause to be operated, health facilities to ensure the availability in each Production Area of                <br /><br /><br />
medical treatment, care and attention in accordance with applicable Law, and such other                      <br /><br /><br />
improved standards as may be agreed between the parties. All such facilities shall be                        <br /><br /><br />
staffed with qualified medical personnel and shall be properly equipped and supplied for                     <br /><br /><br />
the level of service required in accordance with international medical standards. No later                   <br /><br /><br />
than the commencement of Production, the Company shall have constructed or caused to                         <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
                                                                     0 Os.                                ./ <br /><br /><br />
 \                                     r. i                                                          \/-     <br /><br /><br />
﻿be constructed and shall maintain, at the Company’s primary Mining location, a hospital    <br /><br /><br />
facility providing a wide range of curative and preventative services supported by a small <br /><br /><br />
laboratory and meeting all standards under applicable Law. Such treatment, care and        <br /><br /><br />
attention shall be free of charge for the Company’s employees and their resident spouses   <br /><br /><br />
and resident dependent children up to the age of 21. Government officials and/or           <br /><br /><br />
employees assigned to and regularly employed in the Production Area in an official         <br /><br /><br />
capacity, and resident in or adjacent to the Production Area, and their resident spouses   <br /><br /><br />
and resident dependent children (up to the age of 21), shall, during the time of such      <br /><br /><br />
assignment, employment and residence, also be entitled to receive medical care on the      <br /><br /><br />
same basis as Company employees, provided that the Government agency which                 <br /><br /><br />
represents each such Government official or employee shall, at the time of the assignment  <br /><br /><br />
or regular employment, certify to the Company the names and full identification of the     <br /><br /><br />
Government official or employee, the resident spouses and resident dependent children      <br /><br /><br />
(up to the age of 21). The Company shall also provide reasonable access to such health     <br /><br /><br />
facilities to members of local communities for ambulatory or emergency care. It is         <br /><br /><br />
understood that “reasonable access” may include the imposition of fees that are            <br /><br /><br />
reasonable in light of the economic level of such communities, it being also understood    <br /><br /><br />
that such fees are unlikely to cover the cost of service.                                  <br /><br /><br />
SECTION II EMPLOYMENT, TRAINING AND EDUCATION                                              <br /><br /><br />
11.1 Employment.                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
(a)    Employment practices of the Company shall conform to applicable labor .             <br /><br /><br />
practices Law and other applicable Law and the Company will require any                    <br /><br /><br />
contractors or sub-contractors to comply with this provision with respect to               <br /><br /><br />
their own employment practices.                                                            <br /><br /><br />
(b)    None of the Company nor any other contractor or sub-contractor may hire             <br /><br /><br />
individuals who arc not citizens of Liberia for unskilled labor positions.                 <br /><br /><br />
(c)    The Company shall (and the Company will require any other contractors               <br /><br /><br />
or sub-contractors to) employ and give preference to the employment of                     <br /><br /><br />
qualified citizens of Liberia for financial, accounting, technical,                        <br /><br /><br />
administrative, supervisory, managerial and executive positions and other                  <br /><br /><br />
skilled positions as and when such positions become available unless and                   <br /><br /><br />
to the extent that such competent and suitably qualified citizens arc not                  <br /><br /><br />
available for such positions, it being the objective of the parties as soon as             <br /><br /><br />
is practicable that the Operations under this Agreement should be                          <br /><br /><br />
conducted and managed primarily by citizens of Liberia.                                    <br /><br /><br />
(d)    In furtherance of the obligations under Section 11.1(c), the Government             <br /><br /><br />
and the Company shall agree prior to the approval of the Feasibility Report                <br /><br /><br />
on progressive implementation of an employment schedule with the                           <br /><br /><br />
objective of citizens of Liberia holding at least 30% of all management                    <br /><br /><br />
positions including 30% of its ten most senior positions within five years                 <br /><br /><br />
of the initial grant to the Company of a Mining License under this                         <br /><br /><br />
Agreement, anil at least 70% of all management positions including 70%                     <br /><br /><br />
of its ten most senior positions within ten years of such date. Appointment                <br /><br /><br />
of a citizen of Liberia to a particular position does not preclude subsequent              <br /><br /><br />
employment of a citizen of another country- in such position and it shall, at              <br /><br /><br />
﻿a-.1. '.)c uuj Company's reasonable judg.-acu as to whether a Person             <br /><br /><br />
is suitably qualified for a particular position, having regard to all relevant   <br /><br /><br />
criteria, including such Person’s skills and training and any health and         <br /><br /><br />
safety considerations.                                                           <br /><br /><br />
(e) Subject to the above, the Company may at all times choose its employees      <br /><br /><br />
and shall be free to employ such Persons who are not citizens of Liberia as      <br /><br /><br />
are required for the efficient conduct of Operations in Liberia. Where           <br /><br /><br />
applicable Law stipulates minimum technical qualifications and/ or               <br /><br /><br />
minimum levels of competence for any technical post, the Government              <br /><br /><br />
undertakes to recognize equivalent technical qualifications and/or               <br /><br /><br />
certificates of competency held by Persons who are not citizens of Liberia,      <br /><br /><br />
provided that such qualifications and/or certificates of competency shall        <br /><br /><br />
have been issued by a recognized institution or statutory authority in any       <br /><br /><br />
other country having a substantial mining industry or internationally            <br /><br /><br />
recognized mining education institution.                                         <br /><br /><br />
1.2 Training of Liberians.                                                       <br /><br /><br />
(a)    Following the grant to the Company of a Mining License under this         <br /><br /><br />
Agreement, the Company shall provide on a continuing basis for the               <br /><br /><br />
training of citizens of Liberia in order to qualify them for financial,          <br /><br /><br />
accounting, supervisory, managerial, executive positions and other skilled       <br /><br /><br />
positions, and as required by Operations provide on-the-job training,            <br /><br /><br />
operate vocational training facilities, and utilize whatever other measures      <br /><br /><br />
are" necessary and reasonable to transfer to other citizen employees the         <br /><br /><br />
ability to work in skilled trades and to supervise other tradesmen and           <br /><br /><br />
laborers.                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
(b)    The Company shall facilitate the qualification of a Liberian geologist    <br /><br /><br />
under international resource reporting codes but shall not be required to        <br /><br /><br />
guarantee employment after training. The Government shall provide the            <br /><br /><br />
Company with a list of potential candidates for iron ore Competent Person        <br /><br /><br />
(CP) status accreditation under CRIRSCO guidelines. The Company shall            <br /><br /><br />
continue to hire and train Liberian geologists, including funding their          <br /><br /><br />
CRIRSCO accreditation as and when they qualify. The Company shall                <br /><br /><br />
furthermore facilitate applications by its own Liberian geologist employees      <br /><br /><br />
for accreditation and subsequent registration under CRIRSCO guidelines           <br /><br /><br />
as iron ore Competent Persons.                                                   <br /><br /><br />
(c)    The Company shall also provide for the following:                         <br /><br /><br />
(i)    Training of a high-calibre Liberian technical professional to             <br /><br /><br />
assume the role of Company Site Manager within 5 years from the                  <br /><br /><br />
Effective Date;                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
(ii)    Training of a high-calibre Liberian caterer or chef to assume the        <br /><br /><br />
role of Company Catering Manager ai the Site within 5 years from                 <br /><br /><br />
the Effective Date;                                                              <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
 65                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
﻿(iii)    Engagement of an international security services consultant to         <br /><br /><br />
provide training to the Company’s Liberian security contractor in               <br /><br /><br />
security risk evaluation and mitigation, and the preparation of                 <br /><br /><br />
emergency plans;                                                                <br /><br /><br />
(iv)    Engagement of an international medical services provider to train a     <br /><br /><br />
Liberian nurse employed by the Company at its first aid post                    <br /><br /><br />
health;                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
(v)    Training of Liberians from surrounding villages in various               <br /><br /><br />
exploration support infrastructure functions; and                               <br /><br /><br />
(vi)    Regular training in defensive driving techniques for Company            <br /><br /><br />
drivers, who will also benefit from regular first aid training from             <br /><br /><br />
the Company’s international medical services provider.                          <br /><br /><br />
11.3 General Education Funding,                                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
 (a) The Company shall, commencing on the Effective Date until the award of     <br /><br /><br />
 a Mining License, contribute annually on the anniversary of the Effective      <br /><br /><br />
 Date through a Company administered program a total of Two Hundred             <br /><br /><br />
 Thousand Dollars (US$200,000) (adjusted annually for inflation in the          <br /><br /><br />
 manner provided for in Section 11.3(b)) to education funding to be             <br /><br /><br />
 allocated as follows: (i) US$80,000 (Eighty Thousand Dollars) per year (as     <br /><br /><br />
 adjusted for inflation) towards geology or mining engineering scholarships     <br /><br /><br />
 at the University of Liberia and technical apprenticeships at the University   <br /><br /><br />
 of Liberia educational establishments, with such scholarships and              <br /><br /><br />
 apprenticeships preferably awarded to students from Bomi, Grand Cape           <br /><br /><br />
 Mount, and Gbarpolu Counties, (n) US$40,000 (Forty Thousand Dollars)           <br /><br /><br />
 per year (as adjusted for inflation) towards the creation and operation of a   <br /><br /><br />
 Mining and Geology' Institute at the University of Liberia for students        <br /><br /><br />
 rpajoring in mining engineering and geology, (iii) US$20,000 (Twenty           <br /><br /><br />
 Thousand Dollars) per year (as adjusted for inflation) towards the             <br /><br /><br />
 promotion of graduate training programs in Geology and Mining                  <br /><br /><br />
 Engineering or other related disciplines at the University of Liberia or such  <br /><br /><br />
 other state operated higher education institutions, and (iv) US$60,000         <br /><br /><br />
 (Sixty Thousand Dollars) per year (as adjusted for inflation) towards the      <br /><br /><br />
 facilitation of graduate training of and sponsor exchange programs for         <br /><br /><br />
 students majoring in mining engineering and geology, with preference for       <br /><br /><br />
 students from Bomi, Grand Cape Mount, and Gbarpolu Counties, in                <br /><br /><br />
 universities in other parts of the world (it being understood that such        <br /><br /><br />
 programs should be structured to provide reasonable incentive for such         <br /><br /><br />
 employees to return to Liberia on completion of their training). Following     <br /><br /><br />
 the grant of a Mining License to the Company under this Agreement, the         <br /><br /><br />
 Company shall increase the total annual contribution to the inflation          <br /><br /><br />
 adjusted equivalent of US$500,000 (Five Hundred Thousand Dollars),             <br /><br /><br />
 which shall be payable on the anniversary of the Effective Date for the        <br /><br /><br />
 remainder of the Term and shall be allocated for the purposes described in     <br /><br /><br />
 the foregoing sentence in the same proportions provided therein. The           <br /><br /><br />
   inflation adjustment shali account for the change in the Deflator between    <br /><br /><br />
   the Effective Date and the date of issuance of the Mining License. This      <br /><br /><br />
﻿ amount witi in turn bo adjusted annually for inllation in the manner                          <br /><br /><br />
 provided for in Section 11.3(b)).                                                             <br /><br /><br />
 (b)    The amounts payable pursuant to Section 11.3 (a) shall be adjusted                     <br /><br /><br />
 annually for inflation for each payment after the initial payment in                          <br /><br /><br />
 proportion to the change in Deflator over the year ending on the last day of                  <br /><br /><br />
 the month immediately prior to the due date of each payment. The                              <br /><br /><br />
 Government’s determination of such amount shall be final, absent manifest                     <br /><br /><br />
 error.                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
 (c)    The amount referred to in clause (n) of Section 11.3(a) shall be paid to the           <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
 general revenue account of the Government and earmarked for the                               <br /><br /><br />
 University of Liberia. The Company’s obligations under clause (iv) of                         <br /><br /><br />
 Section 11.3(a) shall include, but are not limited to, the funding up to the                  <br /><br /><br />
 amount provided in clause (iv) in each year (commencing in the year the                       <br /><br /><br />
 first Milting License is granted) of the expenses of at least one Liberian                    <br /><br /><br />
 citizen in a recognized graduate school for a master’s degree or the                          <br /><br /><br />
 equivalent in geology, mining engineering, or a related field. The                            <br /><br /><br />
 Company may condition such funding on an agreement of the student to                          <br /><br /><br />
 work for the Company, an Affiliate of the Company or an Affiliate of a                        <br /><br /><br />
 shareholder of the Company upon graduation.                                                   <br /><br /><br />
 (d)    The Company will, directly or indirectly in conjunction with the Ministry              <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
 of Education, ensure that there is available free primary and secondary                       <br /><br /><br />
 education (K-12) to the resident dependent children (up to the age of 21)                     <br /><br /><br />
 of the Company’s employees and of Government officials' and/or                                <br /><br /><br />
 employees assigned to and regularly employed in a Production Area in an                       <br /><br /><br />
 official capacity and who are resident in or adjacent to such Production                      <br /><br /><br />
 Area.                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
11.4 Scientific Research Fund.                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
                                                                  f                            <br /><br /><br />
The Company shall also make an annual contribution to the Scientific Research                  <br /><br /><br />
Fund of One Hundred Thousand Dollars (US $100,000 (adjusted annually for                       <br /><br /><br />
inflation in the manner provided for in Section 11.3(b)), commencing on the                    <br /><br /><br />
Effective Date and payable thereafter on the anniversary of the Effective Date,                <br /><br /><br />
through the Term. Such amount shall be adjusted annually for inflation in the                  <br /><br /><br />
manner provided in Section 11.3(b) and shall be paid into the general revenue                  <br /><br /><br />
account of the Government for the Scientific Research Fund.                                    <br /><br /><br />
11.5 Audit Rights.                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
The Company shall have the right to independently audit (at its own expense) the               <br /><br /><br />
use of any contributions made pursuant to Sections 11.3(a) and (c) or Section 11.4             <br /><br /><br />
and for this purpose shall be provided with and have access to all relevant                    <br /><br /><br />
documentation and information, The Company shall not be required to make any                   <br /><br /><br />
contribution under Sections 11.3 and 11.4 that, in its view, would cause the                   <br /><br /><br />
Company to be in violation of applicable Law including applicable anti-corruption              <br /><br /><br />
laws.                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />

                                                    67                                         <br /><br /><br />
﻿ SECTION 12 USE OF LIBERIAN GOODS AND SERVICES                                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
When purchasing goods and services related to Operations, the Company shall, and shall           <br /><br /><br />
cause its Major Contractors, and will use reasonable efforts to encourage its other              <br /><br /><br />
contractors, to, (i) organize their procurement practices to give meaningful opportunities       <br /><br /><br />
to bid for contracts to those entitled to preference pursuant to clause (ii) of this sentence,   <br /><br /><br />
and (ii) give preference to the maximum extent possible to materials and goods produced          <br /><br /><br />
in Liberia and services provided by natural persons who are citizens of Liberia resident in      <br /><br /><br />
Liberia or entities incorporated or formed in Liberia where natural persons who are              <br /><br /><br />
citizens of Liberia resident in Liberia are entitled to receive 60% or more of ail profits       <br /><br /><br />
from such entities, unless such materials or goods are not provided in Liberia or such           <br /><br /><br />
services are not provided by Liberian persons. Subject to the foregoing, the Company             <br /><br /><br />
and its contractors may freely contract with any Person. The Company must report to the          <br /><br /><br />
Minister within 60 days following the end of each Financial Year on the extent to which          <br /><br /><br />
the Company and its Major Contractors acquired during such year materials, goods and             <br /><br /><br />
services from the preferred sources described in the first sentence of this Section 12.' A       <br /><br /><br />
“Major Contractor” is a contractor or a subcontractor who received more than                     <br /><br /><br />
US$200,000 directly or indirectly from the Company in the relevant Financial Year and            <br /><br /><br />
who had significant operations in Liberia in that Financial Year. Merely maintaining a           <br /><br /><br />
representative office, or the mere presence of supervisory personnel to inspect or direct        <br /><br /><br />
work performed by other contractors, do not constitute “significant operations” for the          <br /><br /><br />
purposes of this Section 12.                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 13 ENVIRONMENTAL PROTECTION AND MANAGEMENT                                               <br /><br /><br />
•13.1    The Company’s Duty.                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
The environmental responsibilities of the Company during Exploration arc as set                  <br /><br /><br />
forth in the Exploration Regulations (as modified by this Agreement). Following                  <br /><br /><br />
the gram of a Mining License to the Company, the Company shall conduct its                       <br /><br /><br />
Operations in accordance with Sections 8.1 through 8.3 of the Mining Law,                        <br /><br /><br />
applicable Law, the World Bank/IFC Environmental Health and Safety Guidelines                    <br /><br /><br />
for Mining, the IFC Performance Standards on Environmental and Social                            <br /><br /><br />
Sustainability, the approved EMP.and this Agreement. The Company shall in any                    <br /><br /><br />
event take appropriate preventive measures to protect all streams and water bodies               <br /><br /><br />
within or bordering Liberia, all dry land surfaces, and the atmosphere from                      <br /><br /><br />
pollution, contamination or damage resulting from Operations. If Operations                      <br /><br /><br />
violate any requirement referred to in the two previous sentences or otherwise                   <br /><br /><br />
have material adverse impact on the environment, the Company shall proceed                       <br /><br /><br />
diligently to restore the environment as much as possible to its original and natural            <br /><br /><br />
state (or to remediate the negative impact where restoration is impractical) and                 <br /><br /><br />
shall take appropriate preventive measures to avoid further material adverse                     <br /><br /><br />
impact on the environment.                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
13.2 Environmental Reports and Audits.                                                           <br /><br /><br />
(a) The Company shall deliver to the Minister, within 60 days after each                         <br /><br /><br />
anniversary of the date of the issue of the Mining License, an                                   <br /><br /><br />
environmental report prepared by the Company which shall include an                              <br /><br /><br />
assessment of the Production Areas under such license plus all areas                             <br /><br /><br />
﻿outside oi the Production Areas in which the Company conducts                          <br /><br /><br />
Operations.                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
(b) The Company shall deliver to the Minister (i) once every two years                 <br /><br /><br />
commencing with the second anniversary of the submission of the first                  <br /><br /><br />
environmental report pursuant to Section 13.2(a) and (ii) on the last day of           <br /><br /><br />
the Mining Term, an environmental audit and assessment of the                          <br /><br /><br />
Production Areas under such license plus all areas outside of the                      <br /><br /><br />
Production Areas in which the Company conducts Operations, The audit                   <br /><br /><br />
shall be performed or supervised by an environmental consultant who is                 <br /><br /><br />
not a regular employee of the Company or an Affiliate of the Company                   <br /><br /><br />
and vvho is a registered engineer or scientist with at least ten years of              <br /><br /><br />
experience in making environmental compliance assessments and audits in                <br /><br /><br />
the mining industry, the identity of whom is agreed with the Minister. The             <br /><br /><br />
audit and assessment are for the purpose of determining whether                        <br /><br /><br />
Operations since the beginning of the relevant period that is the subject of           <br /><br /><br />
the audit are being conducted ia-conformily with applicable environmental              <br /><br /><br />
Law and the other requirements of this Agreement and the Company's                     <br /><br /><br />
approved BMP. Such audit and assessment wall also include an                           <br /><br /><br />
assessment of the status of the Company’s provision for restoration or                 <br /><br /><br />
remediation of the Production Areas and such other areas in which the                  <br /><br /><br />
Company conducts or has conducted Operations and its conformity with                   <br /><br /><br />
the requirements of the approved BMP. The audit and assessment will                    <br /><br /><br />
also include a full accounting for all changes during such relevant period             <br /><br /><br />
in the balance of any account established pursuant to the approved EMP to              <br /><br /><br />
fund such restoration and remediation. If any .such audit and assessment               <br /><br /><br />
for any relevant period identifies any failure to comply with the                      <br /><br /><br />
requirements of Section 13.1 or the EMP, the Company shall promptly                    <br /><br /><br />
remedy such situation at its own expense.                                              <br /><br /><br />
! 3.3 Government Environmental Inspections.                                            <br /><br /><br />
The Minister or the F.pX may conduct, at its own expense, periodic inspections of      <br /><br /><br />
Exploration Areas, Production Areas and other areas in which the Company               <br /><br /><br />
conducts Operations following receipt by the Company of at least two Business          <br /><br /><br />
Days’ prior written notice of such inspection, provided (hat no prior written notice   <br /><br /><br />
is required where the inspection relates to a concern regarding employee health        <br /><br /><br />
and safety or a negative environmental impact. As a condition to permitting such       <br /><br /><br />
inspection, the Company may require (i) receipt of a copy of written instructions      <br /><br /><br />
to conduct such inspection from an official senior to the official purporting to       <br /><br /><br />
conduct the inspection, manually and legibly signed on the letterhead of the           <br /><br /><br />
relevant ministry or Government agency, and (ii) viewing and copying the               <br /><br /><br />
identification of the persons claiming the right to conduct such inspection.           <br /><br /><br />
13.4 Updating the EIA and the EMP.                                                     <br /><br /><br />
(a) The Company shall periodically (not less frequently than every four years,         <br /><br /><br />
or as may otherwise be required by applicable Law) update the EIA and                  <br /><br /><br />
the EMP to reflect the actual status of Operations at the lime and updated             <br /><br /><br />
risk assessments generally applicable with respect to Operations or Mine               <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
 69                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
﻿ctosurc, and updated estimates ol' the oust of carrying out the closure            <br /><br /><br />
management plan.                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
(b) The Company shall also update the EIA and the BMP as a condition to            <br /><br /><br />
making any material changes in Operations, or any Mine, Mining Plant or            <br /><br /><br />
Infrastructure. The updated EIA and EMP (including an updated closure              <br /><br /><br />
management plan and budget) are to be submitted to and are subject to the          <br /><br /><br />
review and approval of the EPA in accordance with then-applicable                  <br /><br /><br />
environmental Law, such approval not to be unreasonably withheld or                <br /><br /><br />
delayed. As a condition of approval, the Minister or the EPA may require           <br /><br /><br />
additional funding to be provided or secured in accordance with the agreed         <br /><br /><br />
funding scheme pursuant to Section 5.7(c) if such action is required to            <br /><br /><br />
assure adequate and secure funding of estimated closure costs. The                 <br /><br /><br />
Company shall in any event comply with its undertakings contained in the           <br /><br /><br />
most recently approved EIA and EMP.                                                <br /><br /><br />
13.5    Scope of Duty to Cease Operations during Remediation.                      <br /><br /><br />
Any environmental remediation required by applicable Law or this Agreement to      <br /><br /><br />
occur during the Mining Term shall not require the Company to cease Operations     <br /><br /><br />
during the restoration or remediation period (except to (he extent necessary to    <br /><br /><br />
carry out such restoration or remediation) so long as the Company is proceeding    <br /><br /><br />
diligently to undertake the required restoration or remediation and has ceased any <br /><br /><br />
activities that constituted a violation of applicable Law or a breach of the       <br /><br /><br />
obligations of the Company under Section 13.1. This Section does not limit (he     <br /><br /><br />
right of the Minister to suspend Operations under Section 24 when Operations are   <br /><br /><br />
causing a material adverse impact on the environment.                              <br /><br /><br />
13.6    Ho Liability for Previous Negative Environmental Impact.                   <br /><br /><br />
(a)    The Company shall assume no liability for and shall have no liability to    <br /><br /><br />
any third party for any negative environmental impact within any part of           <br /><br /><br />
an Exploration Area, Production Area or any other area in which the                <br /><br /><br />
Company is conducting Operations in existence prior to commencement of             <br /><br /><br />
any Exploration or other Operations or resulting from ihe acts or omissions        <br /><br /><br />
by parties other than the Company or its Affiliates prior to commencement          <br /><br /><br />
of any Exploration or other Operations (“Previous Negative Environmental           <br /><br /><br />
Impact”).                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
(b)    The Government shall indemnify and hold harmless the Company from           <br /><br /><br />
any losses and liability incurred by it resulting from any claims made             <br /><br /><br />
against the Company by third parties which have arisen in connection with          <br /><br /><br />
Previous Negative Environmental Impact in respect of Land owned by the             <br /><br /><br />
Government which it has made available to the Company for the purposes             <br /><br /><br />
of Operations (excluding any Land that is made available to the Company            <br /><br /><br />
pursuant to the exercise by the Government of its powers of eminent                <br /><br /><br />
domain pursuant to Section 7.3), provided that:                                    <br /><br /><br />
              (i) the Company shall notify the Minister of Justice promptly of any <br /><br /><br />
                suit, action, proceedings, claims, investigations and negotiations <br /><br /><br />
﻿                                                                                          \ .     <br /><br /><br />
made against the Company in respect of this Section 13.6 (a "Third                                <br /><br /><br />
Party Company Claim”'):                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
(ii> the Company shall have the right to conduct all suits, actions,                              <br /><br /><br />
proceedings, claims, investigations and negotiations relating to any                              <br /><br /><br />
matter referred to in this Section 13.6; and                                                      <br /><br /><br />
(iii) in the conduct of any Third Party Company Claim, the Company                                <br /><br /><br />
shall:                                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
(A)    if so required by the Government, take all such steps or                                   <br /><br /><br />
proceedings as the Government may reasonably require                                              <br /><br /><br />
including steps to avoid, dispute, resist, mitigate,                                              <br /><br /><br />
compromise, defend or appeal against any such Third Party                                         <br /><br /><br />
Company Claim (provided that such steps or proceedings                                            <br /><br /><br />
shall be taken at the Government's cost and expense);                                             <br /><br /><br />
(B)    provide the Government with all such information and                                       <br /><br /><br />
reports concerning any such Third Party Company Claim                                             <br /><br /><br />
and any steps or proceedings taken by the Company as the                                          <br /><br /><br />
Government may from time to time reasonably request; and                                          <br /><br /><br />
(C)    not agree to settle and/or settle any such Third Party                                     <br /><br /><br />
Company Claim without prior written consent of the                                                <br /><br /><br />
Government (such consent not to be unreasonably                                                   <br /><br /><br />
withheld).                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 14 TAXATION                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
14.1    Law of General Applicability.                                                             <br /><br /><br />
The Company shall pay all Taxes and Duties and conform to all procedures                          <br /><br /><br />
t    pursuant to applicable Law except as may otherwise be provided in this                       <br /><br /><br />
Agreement.                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
14.2    Fiscal Regime.                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
(a) Exhibit 3 to this Agreement sets forth certain modifications to the Revenue                   <br /><br /><br />
Code. The modifications set out in Exhibit 3 shall be read in conjunction                         <br /><br /><br />
with the Revenue Code as if such modifications were in force and                                  <br /><br /><br />
constituted applicable Law for the purpose of determining the liabilities of                      <br /><br /><br />
the Company under the Revenue Code. The Revenue Code as it would                                  <br /><br /><br />
read were such modifications in force and constituted applicable Law is                           <br /><br /><br />
herein called the “Agreed Revenue Code”. The Agreed Revenue Code                                  <br /><br /><br />
shall apply to the Operations during the Term and the Company shall be                            <br /><br /><br />
bound by all the provisions thereof, except to the extent that the provisions                     <br /><br /><br />
of this Agreement vary the provisions of the Agreed Revenue Code.                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
 (b) The Government hereby agrees that with respect to those items set out in                     <br /><br /><br />
 Section 17 of the Agreed Revenue Code and subject to the limitations                             <br /><br /><br />
 (herein, the applicable Taxes and Duties shall be stabilized as of the                           <br /><br /><br />

        Effective Date for the period equal to the lesser of the Term or 15 years        <br /><br /><br />
        provided that such Taxes and Duties may be subject to adjustment as a            <br /><br /><br />
        result of periodic review of those items every five years, if the Company        <br /><br /><br />

        in Section 31.2. After the Effective date, should the Government reduce          <br /><br /><br />

        (c)    From the Effective Date until the expiry of two (2) years following Start <br /><br /><br />

        US$10,000,00 per item, which ever is less, in accordance with the                <br /><br /><br />
        Agreed Revenue Code, in respect of all items that arc exempted from the          <br /><br /><br />
        import duty as provided for in Section 14.2(c), all of which items are           <br /><br /><br />
        specified on Exhibit 7 hereto. For the avoidance of doubt, the Company           <br /><br /><br />
        shall not pay any Customs User Fee in respect of any goods which are             <br /><br /><br />
        subject to import duty but will be subject to inspection fees in                 <br /><br /><br />
        accordance with Section 16.3. The Company shall not be required to pay           <br /><br /><br />
        any Customs User Fee in respect of any goods on export of such goods             <br /><br /><br />
        but will be subject to inspection fees, where applicable, in accordance          <br /><br /><br />
        with Section 16.3.                                                               <br /><br /><br />
        (e)    Sections 14.2 (c) and (d) shall apply to the Company’s contractors and    <br /><br /><br />
        their subcontractors to the extent that such contractors and                     <br /><br /><br />
        subcontractors arc exclusively rendering goods or services to the                <br /><br /><br />
        Company in relation to its Operations or importing goods in connection           <br /><br /><br />
        with the Operations; provided that any such goods or services are                <br /><br /><br />
        identified as goods or services exclusively relating to the Operations.          <br /><br /><br />
        14.3 Withholding Tax.                                                            <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
        (a)    In the case of a transfer of an interest in the Company, the Company or   <br /><br /><br />

        consideration received directly or indirectly by the transferor or any           <br /><br /><br />
        other entity with respect to such transfer in accordance with the Law of         <br /><br /><br />
        general application within ten (10) days after the last day of the calendar      <br /><br /><br />
        month in which such transfer shall have occurred.                                <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
        (b)    The payment of withholding lax referred to in paragraph (a) above shall   <br /><br /><br />
        be accompanied by documentation of all amounts and the value of any              <br /><br /><br />
        a    \-                                                                          <br /><br /><br />

﻿       consideration paid with respect to such transfer and such other                                  <br /><br /><br />
       reasonable documentation as the Ministry of Finance may require. Such                            <br /><br /><br />
       documentation shall be certified as true, correct, and complete by the                           <br /><br /><br />
       chief executive officer and the chief financial officer of each of the                           <br /><br /><br />
       transferors and transferees of any interest.                                                     <br /><br /><br />

       (c) The Shareholders and Sesa Goa acknowledge that the sale of an equity                         <br /><br /><br />

       Section 14.3. Bloom agrees that it shall withhold 15% of the                                     <br /><br /><br />

       US$90,000,000 (Ninety Million Dollars), and remit such amount to the                             <br /><br /><br />
       Government directly from the escrow account by JPMorgan in                                       <br /><br /><br />

       applicable documentation provided above and by applicable Law,                                   <br /><br /><br />

       Minister of Justice to JPMorgan London, the withholding tax of                                   <br /><br /><br />

       . Dollars) shall be transferred directly to the general revenue account of                       <br /><br /><br />
       the Government of Liberia. Elenilto and Sesa Goa shall be liable to pay                          <br /><br /><br />
       such withholding tax to the extent Bloom does not withhold such amount                           <br /><br /><br />

 VALUE, EXPORT SALES PRICE                                                                              <br /><br /><br />

 “Royalty Rale'-) multiplied by the fair market value determined in                                     <br /><br /><br />
 accordance with Section 703 the Revenue Code, (such payment                                            <br /><br /><br />
 collectively, the “Royalty”).                                                                          <br /><br /><br />

 (b) lhe Royalty shall be paid to the general revenue account of the                                    <br /><br /><br />
 Government in Dollars on the date of shipment in respect of which                                      <br /><br /><br />

15.2    Fair Market Value, the Sales Price; Computation of Gross Income.                   <br /><br /><br />
fhe fair market value f.o.b. Liberia for purposes of Section 703 of the Revenue            <br /><br /><br />
Code and the sales price for computing gross revenue for purposes of Section 201           <br /><br /><br />
of the Revenue Code shall be:                                                              <br /><br /><br />
(a)    in (he case of a sale to a non-Affiliate f.o.b. Liberia, the actual sales price     <br /><br /><br />
paid or payable f.o.b. Liberia, and                                                        <br /><br /><br />
(b)    in the case of a sale to an Affiliate f.o.b. Liberia in connection with a back-     <br /><br /><br />
to-back sale by the Affiliate to a non-Affiliate f.o.b. Liberia, the actual                <br /><br /><br />
sales price paid or payable f.o.b. Liberia to the Affiliate by the non-                    <br /><br /><br />
Affiliate.                                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
In ail other cases the fair market value for purposes of Section 703 of the Revenue        <br /><br /><br />
Code and the transfer price for transactions between Related Persons provided for          <br /><br /><br />
in Section 713 of the Revenue Code (such transfer price to be used for computing           <br /><br /><br />
gross revenue for purposes of Section 201 of the Revenue Code) shall be                    <br /><br /><br />
determined in accordance with the Pricing Agreement provided for in Section                <br /><br /><br />
15.3.                                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
15.3    The Pricing Agreement.                                                             <br /><br /><br />
(a)    Prior to the approval of the Feasibility Report, the Government and the             <br /><br /><br />
Company shall enter into an agreement (the “Pricing Agreement”) which                      <br /><br /><br />
shall set out the method for determining (i) the lair market value of each                 <br /><br /><br />
Product consistent with the requirements of Section 703 of the Revenue                     <br /><br /><br />
Code and (ii) the transfer price for each Product consistent with the                      <br /><br /><br />
requirements of Section 713 of the Revenue Code.    /                                      <br /><br /><br />
(b)    Upon request from the Government, the Company shall deliver to the                  <br /><br /><br />
Government:                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
(i)    such documentation and information as may be required, pursuant                     <br /><br /><br />
to the Revenue Code, of a taxpayer in connection with the                                  <br /><br /><br />
calculation of any Royalties payable; and                                                  <br /><br /><br />
(ii)    such other information requested by the Government that is                         <br /><br /><br />
reasonably relevant to the determination of the fair market value or                       <br /><br /><br />
transfer price for each Product,                                                           <br /><br /><br />
(c)    If either party in good faith believes that the values for the fair market          <br /><br /><br />
value or the transfer price of any Product determined pursuant to the                      <br /><br /><br />
Pricing Agreement are no longer consistent with the requirements of                        <br /><br /><br />
Sections 703 and 713, respectively of the Revenue Code, the parties will                   <br /><br /><br />
seek to agree upon a revised Pricing Agreement.                                            <br /><br /><br />
