                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
 hi                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
﻿(u; railing agreement between the parties on. a Pricing Agreement for              <br /><br /><br />
determining the fair market value or the transfer price or any revisions           <br /><br /><br />
thereto, such matters shall be determined by a single arbitrator as provided       <br /><br /><br />
by Section 27.5, such arbitrator to be a recognized expert in the pricing of       <br /><br /><br />
Iron Ore. The Pricing Agreement and any decision by an arbitrator if such          <br /><br /><br />
is required shall be public and shall be posted by the Government                  <br /><br /><br />
electronically or through such other means as may be provided by                   <br /><br /><br />
regulation and shall be attached to this Agreement as Exhibit 4,                   <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 16 OTHER PAYMENTS TO THE GOVERNMENT                                        <br /><br /><br />
16.1    Processing and Delay Tees.                                                 <br /><br /><br />
All fees in connection with Exploration shall be in the amount and paid as         <br /><br /><br />
provided in the Exploration Regulations. The following additional processing       <br /><br /><br />
fees apply under this Agreement. No action will be taken with respect to any       <br /><br /><br />
filing or application referred to in any Section of this Agreement requiring the   <br /><br /><br />
payment of a processing fee with the application until the Minister receives       <br /><br /><br />
confirmation that the relevant fee has been paid. No approval or consent requiring <br /><br /><br />
the payment of a fee upon the granting of such approval or consent will be         <br /><br /><br />
effective until the Minister receives confirmation that the relevant fee has been  <br /><br /><br />
paid.                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
The processing fee for the fling of a notice designating one or more Proposed      <br /><br /><br />
Production Areas and the accompanying Mining License application is                <br /><br /><br />
US$10,000 per Proposed Production Area, payable on tiling of the notice.           <br /><br /><br />
(a)    The processing fee for the fling of a Feasibility Report is US$10,000.      <br /><br /><br />
payable on fling of the Feasibility Report.                                        <br /><br /><br />
(b)    The fee for a six month extension of the time to designate Proposed         <br /><br /><br />
Production Areas pursuant to clause (i) of Section 5.3(a) is US$15,000,            <br /><br /><br />
payable on filing of the notice of extension.                                      <br /><br /><br />
(c)    The fee for a six month extension of the time to file a Feasibility Report  <br /><br /><br />
pursuant to clause (ii) of Section 5.3(a) is US$100,000, payable on filing         <br /><br /><br />
of the notice of extension.                                                        <br /><br /><br />
(d)    The processing fee for an application to postpone development under         <br /><br /><br />
Section 5.4 is US$500,000, payable on filing of the application.                   <br /><br /><br />
(e)    The processing fee for an application to modify or amend a Feasibility      <br /><br /><br />
Report is USS 10,000, payable on filing of the application.                        <br /><br /><br />
(t) The processing fee in connection with an application for a consent             <br /><br /><br />
required under Section 23 is US$10,000, payable on filing of the request           <br /><br /><br />
for consent.                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
16.2    ECOWAS Trade Lew.                                                          <br /><br /><br />
Notwithstanding any general exemption from import duties applicable to the         <br /><br /><br />
Company under the Revenue Code or this Agreement, the Company shall be             <br /><br /><br />
﻿subject to the ECOWAS Trade Levy on all goods from non-fiCOWAS states               <br /><br /><br />
which it imports into Liberia at the rate established by applicable Law.            <br /><br /><br />
16.3    Inspection Fees.                                                            <br /><br /><br />
The Company shall be subject to inspection on all imports and exports. If at any    <br /><br /><br />
time the Government does not itself provide inspection services, the Company        <br /><br /><br />
shall utilize the services of the inspection entities approved by the Minister of   <br /><br /><br />
Finance at rates to be negotiated between the Company and the designated            <br /><br /><br />
inspection agency. Where the Government does provide such inspection services,      <br /><br /><br />
the Company shall pay such inspection fees to the Government as are in effect       <br /><br /><br />
from time to time under applicable Law.                                             <br /><br /><br />
16.4    Regulatory Fees.                                                            <br /><br /><br />
The Company shall pay such Taxes and Duties as arc generally applicable under       <br /><br /><br />
Law in Liberia with respect to driver's licenses, vehicle registrations, corporate  <br /><br /><br />
registration, residency and work permits and other license, registrations and       <br /><br /><br />
permits incidental to doing business or conducting activities in Liberia.           <br /><br /><br />
16.5    Mineral Development and Research Fund.                                      <br /><br /><br />
Pursuant to Section 18.4 of the Mining Law, the Company shall make a one-time       <br /><br /><br />
contribution of US $50,000 to the Mineral Development Fund, payable on the          <br /><br /><br />
Effective Date. Such amount shall be paid into the general account-of-the           <br /><br /><br />
Ministry of Finance for the Mineral Development Fund.                               <br /><br /><br />
16.6    Water Use Lew.                                                              <br /><br /><br />
The Company shall be liable to the payment of a water use levy to be negotiated     <br /><br /><br />
between the parties in light of the requirements of the Company as set forth in the <br /><br /><br />
Feasibility Report submitted pursuant to Section 5.6 and prior to the grant of a    <br /><br /><br />
Mining License under Section 5. f                                                   <br /><br /><br />
16.7    Up-Front Payments.                                                          <br /><br /><br />
The Company shall pay to the Government a fee of US$25,000,000 (the “Up-            <br /><br /><br />
Front Payment"), payable according to the following schedule:                       <br /><br /><br />
(i)    US$ 12.5 million within ten (10) days after the Effective Date; and          <br /><br /><br />
(ii)    US$ 12.5 million within ninety (90) days after the first payment;           <br /><br /><br />
Such amounts shall be paid into the general revenue account of the Government.      <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 17 FINANCIAL REPORTING AND CURRENCY                                         <br /><br /><br />
17.1 Accounting and Tax Matters.                                                    <br /><br /><br />
All of the Company ’s accounting under this Agreement shall be in Dollars and all   <br /><br /><br />
amounts paid or received, and obligations incurred or transactions carried out, in  <br /><br /><br />
currency that is Liberian Currency or in any other currency other than Dollars      <br /><br /><br />
﻿oiviiS Ivi converted to Dollars in accordance with and pursuant to the financial          <br /><br /><br />
reporting standard adopted by the Company pursuant to the requirements of                 <br /><br /><br />
Section 17.4 based upon the Prevailing Market Rate of Exchange of Dollars and             <br /><br /><br />
any such currency at the date of the applicable transaction.                              <br /><br /><br />
17.2    Exchange Control-                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
The Company shall at all times have the right, without restriction or penalty,            <br /><br /><br />
directly or indirectly, to obtain, hold, deal w-ith, remit, receive and disburse funds    <br /><br /><br />
in such manner, currencies and places as it chooses in direct connection with its         <br /><br /><br />
Operations. Without prejudice to the generality of the foregoing, the Company             <br /><br /><br />
shall have the unrestricted and unencumbered right to sell and receive payment for        <br /><br /><br />
Product(s) in any currency and all proceeds therefrom may be deposited in bank            <br /><br /><br />
accounts outside of Liberia and held there or remitted therefrom to anywhere in           <br /><br /><br />
the world, in any currency. Notwithstanding the foregoing, (he Company shall              <br /><br /><br />
maintain at least one account with a bank or financial institution in Liberia. The        <br /><br /><br />
Company shall also have the right to acquire from, and sell to, any Person                <br /><br /><br />
currency that is legal lender in Liberia at the Prevailing Market Rate of Exchange        <br /><br /><br />
in direct connection w ith Operations.                                                    <br /><br /><br />
17.3    Currency of Payments to the Government.                                           <br /><br /><br />
Except as otherwise expressly provided in this Agreement, payment of the                  <br /><br /><br />
Company’s obligations to the Government under this Agreement, including                   <br /><br /><br />
obligations for Taxes and Duties payable as a consequence of Operations, shall be         <br /><br /><br />
in Dollars. Any obligation originally stated in Liberian Currency shall be                <br /><br /><br />
converted to Dollars at the Prevailing Market Rate of Exchange. The Company               <br /><br /><br />
shall make payments of sums it collects on behalf of the Government, including,           <br /><br /><br />
but not limited to. Taxes withheld from the salaries or wages of its employees, and       <br /><br /><br />
any other sums payable to other Persons from which a portion is required by               <br /><br /><br />
applicable Law (as modified by this Agreement) to be withheld or retained by it           <br /><br /><br />
on behalf of the Government, in the currency in which such salaries or wages or           <br /><br /><br />
such other sums are paid. For the purposes of determining compliance by the               <br /><br /><br />
Company of required payments in Liberian Currency under any applicable Law                <br /><br /><br />
(including any Law determining minimum wages) the amount of any payment by                <br /><br /><br />
the Company made in Dollars shall be converted to Liberian Currency at the                <br /><br /><br />
Prevailing Market Rate of Exchange as of the date of payment.                             <br /><br /><br />
17.4    Financial Statements and Audit.                                                   <br /><br /><br />
(a) The Company shall deliver to the Government within 90 days after the end              <br /><br /><br />
 of each Financial Year of the Company:                                                   <br /><br /><br />
 (i)    a balance sheet of the Company as at the end of such year, and                    <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
 (ii)    statements of income, changes in shareholders’ equity and cash                   <br /><br /><br />
 flows of the Company for such year,                                                      <br /><br /><br />
 setting forth in each case in comparative form the figures for the previous              <br /><br /><br />
 fiscal year, all in reasonable detail, and certified by the chief financial              <br /><br /><br />
 officer of the Company as having been prepared in accordance with                        <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                              77                                                          <br /><br /><br />
﻿generally accepted accounting principles in the United Slates (“GAAP”) or          <br /><br /><br />
generally accepted accounting principles as reflected in International             <br /><br /><br />
Financial Reporting Standards as in effect from time to time in the                <br /><br /><br />
European Union (“IFRS”), consistently applied except as otherwise noted.           <br /><br /><br />
(b)    Such financial statements shall be accompanied by an opinion thereon of     <br /><br /><br />
independent public accountants of recognized international standing,               <br /><br /><br />
which opinion shall state that such financial statements present fairly, in all    <br /><br /><br />
material respects, the financial position of the companies being reported          <br /><br /><br />
upon and their results of operations and cash flows and have been prepared         <br /><br /><br />
in conformity with GAAP or IFRS, consistently applied except as                    <br /><br /><br />
otherwise noted, that the examination of such accountants in connection            <br /><br /><br />
with such financial statements has been made in accordance with generally          <br /><br /><br />
accepted auditing standards, and that such audit provides a reasonable             <br /><br /><br />
basis for such opinion in the circumstances.                                       <br /><br /><br />
(c)    Each year’s financial statements shall he accompanied by a certificate of   <br /><br /><br />
the chief financial officer of the Company to the effect that during the           <br /><br /><br />
Financial Year then ended the Company was in compliance with                       <br /><br /><br />
(i) Section 20.3, (ii) Section 20.4 (setting forth in such certificate the value   <br /><br /><br />
of the ratio provided for in such Section as at the end of each quarter of         <br /><br /><br />
such Financial Year) and (ili) Section 20-7 (or setting forth the extent of        <br /><br /><br />
non-compliance at such time (if any) and the actions taken and being taken         <br /><br /><br />
to remedy such non-compliance), and has made all deposits or                       <br /><br /><br />
contributions (if any) required by the closure management component of             <br /><br /><br />
the Company's approved EMP.                                                        <br /><br /><br />
(d)    Each year’s financial statements shall be accompanied by a listing of all   <br /><br /><br />
transactions with Affiliates and Related Persons of the Company reflected          <br /><br /><br />
in such financial statements, identifying the amount of the transaction, the       <br /><br /><br />
Affiliate or Related Person involved, and the nature of the transaction,           <br /><br /><br />
f certified by the chief financial officer of the Company as being correct and     <br /><br /><br />
complete. Transactions of the same type with the same entity that are              <br /><br /><br />
individually immaterial may be aggregated rather than separately listed.           <br /><br /><br />
The Company shall maintain contemporaneous documentation of each                   <br /><br /><br />
such transaction with any such Affiliate or Related Person evidencing the          <br /><br /><br />
pricing of the transaction, including all documentation required by the            <br /><br /><br />
Revenue Code or any regulations issued thereunder.                                 <br /><br /><br />
(e)    Each year’s financial statements shall be accompanied by certificate of the <br /><br /><br />
chief financial officer of the Company to the effect that (i) with respect to      <br /><br /><br />
goods or services covered by any Pricing Agreement in effect during the            <br /><br /><br />
relevant period, the Company’s transfer prices during such year were               <br /><br /><br />
computed in accordance with the requirements of such Pricing Agreement             <br /><br /><br />
and (ii) with respect to goods or services sold or provided in a transaction       <br /><br /><br />
between the Company and an Affiliate or a Related Person of the                    <br /><br /><br />
Company which are not covered by such Pricing Agreement, the prices                <br /><br /><br />
thereof imposed during the relevant period were computed in accordance             <br /><br /><br />
with Section 20.7.                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
﻿ (0      If the Minister of Finance determines that it is necessary for it to cause an  <br /><br /><br />
       independent review or audit the Company’s records or books, the                  <br /><br /><br />

       selected by the Minister of Finance to travel to the place where such            <br /><br /><br />
       information, books and records may be obtained and their accommodation           <br /><br /><br />
       costs for a reasonable amount of time necessary to complete their review.        <br /><br /><br />
       The Government agrees that its requests for inspection of information,           <br /><br /><br />
       books or records outside of Liberia shall be reasonable and the justification    <br /><br /><br />
       thereof well-documented.                                                         <br /><br /><br />

SECTION 18 INCIDENTAL RIGHTS AND OTHER MATTERS                                          <br /><br /><br />
18. L Imports.                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
/                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
The Company may import and use directly for Operations, and subsequently                <br /><br /><br />
export, any and all machinery, equipment, vehicles, supplies, consumable items,         <br /><br /><br />
fuels, petroleum products, explosives and any other thing whatsoever reasonably         <br /><br /><br />
required with respect to Operations. The Company shall at all times comply with         <br /><br /><br />
applicable Law regarding the safe use, sale, disposal and security of fuels,            <br /><br /><br />
petroleum products, and explosives.                                                     <br /><br /><br />
18.2 Taxes on Resale of Imported Items.                                                 <br /><br /><br />
The Company may sell, in Liberia, all imported items that are no longer needed          <br /><br /><br />
for Operations, except that the Company may not sell explosives, gasoline or            <br /><br /><br />
diesel within Liberia to third parlies without the consent of the Government. If        <br /><br /><br />
such imported items were exempted in all or part from Taxes and Duties on               <br /><br /><br />
import into Liberia, then the Company shall upon their sale pay to the general          <br /><br /><br />
revenue account of the Government those Taxes and Duties payable on such items          <br /><br /><br />
under applicable Law in effect on the date of sale calculated on the basis of the       <br /><br /><br />
lair market value of such items on the date of sale as determined in accordance         <br /><br /><br />
with the Revenue Code and fulfill all formalities required by Law in connection         <br /><br /><br />
﻿waii sucm saies; provided that the Company shall be entitled to export from           <br /><br /><br />
Liberia, exempt from all Taxes and Duties, any modules, plant, equipment,             <br /><br /><br />
construction material, machinery, and light and heavy vehicles, spare parts as well   <br /><br /><br />
as raw materials, intermediate inputs and consumables, including those items          <br /><br /><br />
referred to in Exhibit 7 to this Agreement, that were previously imported in          <br /><br /><br />
connection with the Operations which were exempt from any import tax.                 <br /><br /><br />
18.3    Right to Export Minerals and Other Rights.                                    <br /><br /><br />
The Company (i) may, directly or through appropriate contractual arrangements,        <br /><br /><br />
market and sell (at arm’s length international market and competitive prices) the     <br /><br /><br />
Product(s) obtained from Operations during the Term of the relevant Mining            <br /><br /><br />
License to any Person in any country or state, subject in all cases to the provisions <br /><br /><br />
of this Agreement, and (u) subject to its obligations to pay Royalty, Taxes and       <br /><br /><br />
Duties and other amounts due to the Government under this Agreement, may              <br /><br /><br />
receive all income and proceeds from such sales and deposit them in banks within      <br /><br /><br />
Liberia and outside of Liberia of its own choosing, provided that notice has been     <br /><br /><br />
given by the Company to the Central Bank of Liberia of its choice of external         <br /><br /><br />
bank and approval thereof by the Central Bank of Liberia has been obtained, if        <br /><br /><br />
such approval is required under applicable Law.                                       <br /><br /><br />
18.4    Dealership Licenses,                                                          <br /><br /><br />
The Company is not entitled to acquire a dealership license under the Mining          <br /><br /><br />
Law. This, restriction does not bar an Affiliate of the Company from acquiring        <br /><br /><br />
such a license if the Affiliate does not purchase Minerals or Products from the       <br /><br /><br />
Company.                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 19 ADDITIONAL UNDERTAKINGS OK THE GOVERNMENT                                  <br /><br /><br />
19.1    Access to Information                                                         <br /><br /><br />
The Company is entitled to obtain access to geological or other information           <br /><br /><br />
relating to the Exploration Area that is owned by or subject to the control of the    <br /><br /><br />
Government in the manner and- to the extent provided in the Exploration               <br /><br /><br />
Regulations,                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
19.2    Provision of Documents.                                                       <br /><br /><br />
Subject to Section 11.1 and except to the extent any such Person may be               <br /><br /><br />
disqualified by applicable Law, the Government shall promptly furnish to each         <br /><br /><br />
officer, director, employee and consultant of the Company, or of its Affiliates,      <br /><br /><br />
contractors and subcontractors, who is not a citizen of Liberia, and to the spouse    <br /><br /><br />
and minor children of each such Person, all documents and visas necessary to          <br /><br /><br />
enable such Person to enter and to leave, or travel within, the territory of Liberia. <br /><br /><br />
19.3    Electricity Generation and Transmission.                                      <br /><br /><br />
(a) The Company shall provide in its Feasibility Report for the installation of       <br /><br /><br />
one or more Power Plants in order to meet the Company’s reasonable                    <br /><br /><br />
needs for conducting Operations in Liberia and to comply with its                     <br /><br /><br />
﻿uuiigauoas umier Section L9..>(b), and in connection with the Power                           <br /><br /><br />
Plants, to construct necessary Infrastructure, provided that any proposed                     <br /><br /><br />
installation of hydropower capacity by the Company shall have the prior                       <br /><br /><br />
approval of the Minister and may not be approved unless sized to utilize                      <br /><br /><br />
(he optimal energy potential of the hydropower resources involved, as                         <br /><br /><br />
reasonably determined by the Minister after consultation with                                 <br /><br /><br />
internationally recognized hydropower consultants. In al! cases, the                          <br /><br /><br />
Company will be subject to, and agrees to comply with, the requirements                       <br /><br /><br />
of any applicable Law regulating the manner in which any such facilities                      <br /><br /><br />
shall be constructed, operated, maintained, repaired or expanded for the                      <br /><br /><br />
safety of the public or protection of the environment. Nothing herein shall                   <br /><br /><br />
be deemed to authorize the Company to construct any Power Plant within                        <br /><br /><br />
the Port or any new port constructed by the Company.                                          <br /><br /><br />
(b)    The parties acknowledge that, in the event the Company constructs a                    <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
Power Plant al any of its mining sites, such Power Plant shall be designed                    <br /><br /><br />
to generate a quantity of electric energy in excess of the electric energy                    <br /><br /><br />
required by the Company for Operations to supply third party users located                    <br /><br /><br />
within a ] 0 km radius thereof on a 7 days per week, 24 hours per days                        <br /><br /><br />
basis in accordance with third party user demand from time to time,                           <br /><br /><br />
provided that the Company shall not be required to build a Power Plant in                     <br /><br /><br />
a manner that it generates an excess of more than 10% over the electric                       <br /><br /><br />
energy required by it for Operations; and further provided, that the                          <br /><br /><br />
Company shall only be obligated to provide the power at the gates of.any                      <br /><br /><br />
Power Plant and interconnection between the third party consumers and                         <br /><br /><br />
the Power Plant and the distribution of the electricity shall be done on the                  <br /><br /><br />
Government's infrastructure. The Company may charge third party users                         <br /><br /><br />
rates at market price for their power usage. The Company shall provide                        <br /><br /><br />
electric power free of charge to Government agencies in the 10 km radius                      <br /><br /><br />
area surrounding any Power Plant; provided that the Government be                             <br /><br /><br />
responsible for and pay the costs associated with interconnection and                         <br /><br /><br />
distribution ojfrom such Power Plant to such Government agencies.                             <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
(c)    To (ho extent that the electrical energy generated by a Power Plant is used            <br /><br /><br />
by the Company in connection with Operations or is (with respect to                           <br /><br /><br />
excess energy only) sold to third parties in the manner provided in Section                   <br /><br /><br />
19.3(b), the Company shall have no liability for any franchise, license or                    <br /><br /><br />
similar fees otherwise imposed by applicable Law on or in connection with                     <br /><br /><br />
die generation or transmission of electricity. AH sales to third parties will                 <br /><br /><br />
be subject to any applicable taxes or fees imposed by applicable Law                          <br /><br /><br />
relating to the sale of electricity, including any service tax, and the                       <br /><br /><br />
Company shall be entitled to recover from such third parties an amount                        <br /><br /><br />
equal to the amount any such taxes or fees to the extent assessed against                     <br /><br /><br />
the Company.                                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
(d)    Any Power Plant shall also be designed and constructed so that it can be               <br /><br /><br />
expanded on a commercially feasible basis to have twice the electricity                       <br /><br /><br />
generating capacity necessary to service Operations.                                          <br /><br /><br />
(e)    As an alternative to Company constructing a Power Plant, the Company                   <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
shall also provide in its Feasibility Report for the purchase of power from                   <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
                                                              7                               <br /><br /><br />
 81                                \                                                      . / <br /><br /><br />
﻿Liic Government, including from one or more Government-owned                           <br /><br /><br />
hydropower projects to be located on the St. Pau! River, and any                       <br /><br /><br />
Infrastructure necessary to interconnect the Company’s facilities with such            <br /><br /><br />
Government-owned power projects, which Infrastructure shall be                         <br /><br /><br />
constructed by the Company. It is understood that the Company shall have               <br /><br /><br />
no responsibility to conduct or fund a feasibility study for development of            <br /><br /><br />
Government-owned hydropower project.                                                   <br /><br /><br />
19.4    Communications Facilities. Systems and Frequencies.                            <br /><br /><br />
The Government will use its reasonable efforts to facilitate:                          <br /><br /><br />
(a)    the receipt by the Company from the Government of such rights, licenses,        <br /><br /><br />
registrations, permits and other authorizations as may be required by                  <br /><br /><br />
applicable Law in connection with the possession, use, importation or                  <br /><br /><br />
purchase of such communications systems as are necessary for internal                  <br /><br /><br />
communications, including radio, telecommunications, electronic mail                   <br /><br /><br />
systems, satellite networks, cellular systems, microwave devices and other             <br /><br /><br />
communications devices and systems subject to the compliance by the                    <br /><br /><br />
Company with the requirements of applicable Law in connection with the                 <br /><br /><br />
receipt of such rights, licenses, registrations, permits and other                     <br /><br /><br />
authorizations; and                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
(b)    to the extent available from the Government, and as approved by the             <br /><br /><br />
Liberian Telecommunications Authority (LTA), the obtaining by the                      <br /><br /><br />
Company of the right to utilize, at generally available rates, of such                 <br /><br /><br />
number of broadcast and communications frequencies for domestic and                    <br /><br /><br />
international use as may reasonably be required for Operations; provided               <br /><br /><br />
that the frequencies used by the Company within the Port or any other port             <br /><br /><br />
shall be subject to approval by the National Port Authority to avoid                   <br /><br /><br />
interference with other communications uses.                                           <br /><br /><br />
19.5    Right to Water.                                                                <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
The Company shall have the right to access (including by means of extraction)          <br /><br /><br />
such water supplies as arc reasonably required by it for the purposes of carrying      <br /><br /><br />
out its Operations subject to the payment by the Company of any charges required       <br /><br /><br />
by applicable Law for the use of water and provided that such access by the            <br /><br /><br />
Company does not affect the water supplies used by the surrounding population          <br /><br /><br />
or, to the extent it does so affect water supplies, the Company provides an            <br /><br /><br />
alternative source of water supply to the affected population.                         <br /><br /><br />
19.6 Peaceful Enjoyment.                                                               <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
The Government hereby warrants and defends the Company’s title to, possession          <br /><br /><br />
and peaceful enjoyment of, all rights granted to it by the Government under this       <br /><br /><br />
Agreement, including its right to all Land and property in Liberia in accordance       <br /><br /><br />
with applicable Law, provided, that the Government shall have no obligations           <br /><br /><br />
with respect to any claims that may arise out of rights of third parties with respect  <br /><br /><br />
to Land as to which the Company has acquired rights pursuant to Section 7.1 or         <br /><br /><br />
Section 7.3(a).                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
﻿ 19.7 Expropriation and Non-Discrimination.                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
Subject to Article 24 of the Constitution of Liberia, the Government undertakes                      <br /><br /><br />
that it shall not, by direct or indirect means, nationalize or expropriate, except (a)               <br /><br /><br />
pursuant to a public purpose and under the process of law, (b) on a non-                             <br /><br /><br />
discriminatory basis, and (c) upon payment of prompt, just and adequate                              <br /><br /><br />
compensation based on fair market value:                                                             <br /><br /><br />
(a)    any Mining Plant, Infrastructure or other property of the Company to the                      <br /><br /><br />
extent used in, connected with or affecting Operations; or                                           <br /><br /><br />
(b)    any Minerals resulting from Operations, the Mining of which is authorized                     <br /><br /><br />
under the Company’s Mining License(s), or the Produces) derived                                      <br /><br /><br />
therefrom;                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
(c)    any equity, shares or ownership interests of whatever nature held in or                       <br /><br /><br />
issued by the Company.                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
The Government further undertakes not to adopt any provision of Law that                             <br /><br /><br />
imposes a material financial or other burden solely on the Company or any of its                     <br /><br /><br />
Affiliates, whether or not such provision specifically identifies the Company or                     <br /><br /><br />
any of its Affiliates as the target thereof, provided that this provision shall not                  <br /><br /><br />
apply to any Law reasonably intended to protect the safety, health, welfare or                       <br /><br /><br />
security of the Government or citizens of Liberia or to fulfill the Government’s                     <br /><br /><br />
international obligations.                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
19.8 Use o’f Existing.Public Utilities and Facilities; Integration with Company                      <br /><br /><br />
Infrastructure.                                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
(a) The Company may purchase services from public utilities and other                                <br /><br /><br />
                     facilities (such as toll bridges, airports and port facilities) operated or     <br /><br /><br />
                     provided by the Government, or by any other Person under license or             <br /><br /><br />
                     authority of the Government, to the extent adequate (after taking into          <br /><br /><br />
                     account the pubtic use thereof and the Company’s obligations under              <br /><br /><br />
                     Sections 6.6, 6 7 and 19.3 as determined in the reasonable judgment of the      <br /><br /><br />
                     Government to meet the Company’s needs with respect to Operations.              <br /><br /><br />
                     The Government shall ensure that all charges for, and other terms and           <br /><br /><br />
                     conditions of, the use by the Company of public infrastructure are fair and     <br /><br /><br />
                     reasonable, taking into account the cost of providing such infrastructure       <br /><br /><br />
                     and the relative availability of alternatives to the Company and to other       <br /><br /><br />
                     users of such infrastructure. The Government may limit the access of the        <br /><br /><br />
                     Company to any such infrastructure to the extent necessary to meet the          <br /><br /><br />
                     demands of the general public, but in any such case of insufficient capacity    <br /><br /><br />
                     to provide for the needs of both the general public and the Company (and        <br /><br /><br />
                     users similarly situated with the Company), die Minister and the Company        <br /><br /><br />
                     (and such similarly situated users) shall in good faith consider how            <br /><br /><br />
                     additional capacity can be provided in a manner that fairly allocates the       <br /><br /><br />
                     additional costs of providing and operating capacity in excess of that          <br /><br /><br />
                     required by the general public to the Company (and others similarly             <br /><br /><br />
                     situated).                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                      8.3                                                            <br /><br /><br />
﻿(b)    Inc Government shall use its reasonable efforts to assist the Company to   <br /><br /><br />
integrate any item of Infrastructure acquired or constructed by the               <br /><br /><br />
Company under an approved Feasibility Report with similar existing                <br /><br /><br />
public utilities or facilities operated or provided by the Government, or by      <br /><br /><br />
any other Person under license or authority of the Government, to the             <br /><br /><br />
extent required by the Company and to the extent reasonable in connection         <br /><br /><br />
with Operations and consistent with the needs of the general public.              <br /><br /><br />
(c)    The Government reserves the right (either directly or through such state   <br /><br /><br />
owned or controlled corporations or entities as are permitted by applicable       <br /><br /><br />
Law to exercise such a right), on reasonable notice to the Company, after         <br /><br /><br />
consultation with the Company and subject to the Company’s prior written          <br /><br /><br />
consent if, in the reasonable opinion of the Company, any of the following        <br /><br /><br />
actions are likely to substantially interfere with the efficient and economic     <br /><br /><br />
conduct of Operations, to construct roads, highways, railroads, power,            <br /><br /><br />
telegraph and telephone lines and other lines of communication within the         <br /><br /><br />
F.xploration Area or the Production Areas if such action is in the public         <br /><br /><br />
interest. The Government will lake account of the reasonable concerns of          <br /><br /><br />
the Company, and seek to minimize any disruption or interruption to the           <br /><br /><br />
conduct of Operations. In the event of unavoidable disruption or                  <br /><br /><br />
interruption to Operations in a Production Area attributable to such              <br /><br /><br />
construction, the Company is entitled only to compensation for any                <br /><br /><br />
verifiable direct, out of pocket additional costs incurred by the Company         <br /><br /><br />
and attributable to such disruption or interruption. The Government shall         <br /><br /><br />
indemnify and hold harmless the Company from all claims by third parties          <br /><br /><br />
for damages attributable to the negligence or misconduct of the                   <br /><br /><br />
Government or contractors retained by the Government in connection with           <br /><br /><br />
such construction.                                                                <br /><br /><br />
19.9 Further Undertakings.                                                        <br /><br /><br />
(a)    The Government undertakes that the contributions and payments set out in   <br /><br /><br />
Sections 8.2, 11.3, 16.1, 16.5, and 16.7 are the exclusive and only               <br /><br /><br />
payments to be made during the Term with respect to the matters                   <br /><br /><br />
addressed in those Sections.                                                      <br /><br /><br />
(b)    The Government undertakes that to the extent that there are any future     <br /><br /><br />
amendments, additions, revisions, modifications or other changes to any           <br /><br /><br />
Law applicable to the Company or its Affiliates in relation to Operations         <br /><br /><br />
that would have the effect of imposing an additional material obligation on       <br /><br /><br />
the Company or its Affiliates with respect to the matters addressed in this       <br /><br /><br />
Agreement (which are not otherwise subject to Section 19.9(a)):                   <br /><br /><br />
(i) the parties shall agree on appropriate transitional arrangements that         <br /><br /><br />
will apply to the Company and/or its Affiliates in relation to the                <br /><br /><br />
introduction of the relevant Law or changes to Law that w'ill                     <br /><br /><br />
provide the Company and/or its Affiliates with a reasonable period                <br /><br /><br />
of time lor the purposes of ensuring compliance with such Law or                  <br /><br /><br />
changes to Law; and                                                               <br /><br /><br />

                                          f                                       <br /><br /><br />
﻿(n) if the relevant new Law or change in Law results in a delay of more              <br /><br /><br />
than 30 days in Operations as a consequence of the Company                           <br /><br /><br />
ensuring compliance with such new Law or change in Law, the                          <br /><br /><br />
Company shall notify the Government of such delay (giving                            <br /><br /><br />
reasons for the delay and details of the work required to be                         <br /><br /><br />
undertaken by the Company to ensure compliance with the new                          <br /><br /><br />
Law or change in Law) and the period of time reasonably required                     <br /><br /><br />
by the Company to ensure compliance. To the extent the Company                       <br /><br /><br />
requires an extension to the period of time for Exploration, the time                <br /><br /><br />
lor the designation of a Proposed Production Area or the lime for                    <br /><br /><br />
filing a Feasibility Report (as the case may be) it may request an                   <br /><br /><br />
extension of time from the Government equivalent to the period of                    <br /><br /><br />
delay resulting from the work to be undertaken by the Company to                     <br /><br /><br />
ensure compliance with the new Law or change in Law, and the                         <br /><br /><br />
Government shall not unreasonably withhold its consent to such                       <br /><br /><br />
extension. If Company believes that the Government has                               <br /><br /><br />
unreasonably withheld its consent to an extension of time or the                     <br /><br /><br />
parties cannot agree on the period of a required extension, the                      <br /><br /><br />
matter shall be referred to a single arbitrator as provided by Section               <br /><br /><br />
27.4.                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
(c) The Government undertakes that all of the funds that will be provided by         <br /><br /><br />
the Company under any provision of this Agreement will be used in                    <br /><br /><br />
accordance with applicable anti-corruption laws.                                     <br /><br /><br />
19.10 Status of this Agreement.                                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
(a)    Notwithstanding that this Agreement becomes Law following ratification        <br /><br /><br />
by the Legislature in accordance with Section 2, this Agreement is a                 <br /><br /><br />
contract between the parties which may only be varied in accordance with             <br /><br /><br />
Section 33.3.                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
(b)    If there are any amendments to Law which arc stated not to apply to mine      <br /><br /><br />
developments agreements issued under the Mining Law then, unless it is               <br /><br /><br />
specified to the contrary, this Agreement shall be deemed for those                  <br /><br /><br />
purposes to be a mine development agreement under the Mining Law.                    <br /><br /><br />

action, proceedings, claims, investigations and negotiations made                    <br /><br /><br />

(v)    all liabilities of the Company in respect of letters of credit or          <br /><br /><br />
instruments serving a similar function issued or accepted for its                 <br /><br /><br />
account by banks and other financial institutions representing or                 <br /><br /><br />
supporting the payment of obligations referred to in clauses                      <br /><br /><br />

account of, or in respect of) the principal of any subordinated debt (or any      <br /><br /><br />
installment thereof) held by the Company, any shareholder of the                  <br /><br /><br />
Company, any Affiliate of the Company, or any Affiliate of either.                <br /><br /><br />
(c) The deductibility or other treatment of any interest payments by the          <br /><br /><br />
Company for purposes of Taxes and Duties shall be governed by the                 <br /><br /><br />
Revenue Code and shall be unaffected by this Section 20.4.                        <br /><br /><br />

20.7 Transactions with Related Persons.                                                <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
The Company will not enter into directly or indirectly any transaction or group of     <br /><br /><br />
related transactions (including the purchase, lease, sale or exchange of properties    <br /><br /><br />
of any kind or the rendering of any service) with any Affiliate or Related Person      <br /><br /><br />
of the Company or any Affiliate or Related Person of any shareholder of the            <br /><br /><br />
Company, except in the ordinary course and pursuant to the reasonable                  <br /><br /><br />
requirements of the Company’s business and upon fair and reasonable terms no           <br /><br /><br />
less favorable to the Company than would be obtainable in a comparable arm’s           <br /><br /><br />
length transaction with a Person not an Affiliate or a Related Person of the           <br /><br /><br />
Company or such shareholder.. Without limiting the generality of the foregoing,        <br /><br /><br />
(i) each transaction between the Company and an Affiliate or the Company or an         <br /><br /><br />
Affiliate of a Company shareholder involving Product(s) shall be on the basis of       <br /><br /><br />
the transfer prices determined pursuant to Section 15.3 and Exhibit 4 and (ii) each    <br /><br /><br />
transaction between the Company and one of its Affiliates or an Affiliate of a         <br /><br /><br />
Company shareholder involving items or services other than Product(s) and a            <br /><br /><br />
jjrice or value in excess of US$500,000 shall be supported by an external transfer     <br /><br /><br />
pricing study prepared by one of the "Big Four" international accountancy and          <br /><br /><br />
professional services firms (a "Big Four Firm") or by another internationally-         <br /><br /><br />
recognized, independent transfer pricing expert approved in advance by the             <br /><br /><br />
Minister of Finance (a ’Transfer Pricing Study”). All Tax returns of the Company       <br /><br /><br />
shall be prepared by, or reviewed prior to filing by, a Big Four Firm or by another    <br /><br /><br />
firm of national reputation in the United States or Europe and shall be prepared       <br /><br /><br />
and timely filed in accordance such transfer pricing studies. The Ministry of          <br /><br /><br />
Finance shall be entitled to review any such transfer pricing studies in connection    <br /><br /><br />
with any audit of any of the Company’s Tax returns.                                    <br /><br /><br />
20.8 The Company.                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
At all times during the Term, (i) the Company shall be a corporation organized         <br /><br /><br />
under the laws of Liberia, (ii) none of the Affiliates, directors, officers or other   <br /><br /><br />
Persons described in Section 21.1 (c) (whether or not listed on Schedule 3) may be     <br /><br /><br />
a Prohibited Person, (Hi) the Company shall be an “Eligible Applicant” under the       <br /><br /><br />
Mining Law and (iv) no officer or director of the Company may be a Person              <br /><br /><br />
described in Sections 4.2(a), (d), (0 or (g) of the Mining Law.                        <br /><br /><br />

﻿ .SECTION 21 REPRESENTATIONS AND WARRANTIES                                             <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
21.1 Representations and Warranties of the Company.                                     <br /><br /><br />
The Company represents and warrants to the Government at the date of this               <br /><br /><br />
Agreement and on the Effective Date as follows:                                         <br /><br /><br />
(a)    The Company is a corporation duly organized, validly existing and in good        <br /><br /><br />
standing under the laws of Liberia, and has the corporate power and                     <br /><br /><br />
authority to execute, deliver and perform its obligations under this                    <br /><br /><br />
Agreement.                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
(b)    This Agreement has been duly authorized by all necessary corporate action        <br /><br /><br />
on the part of the Company, and this Agreement constitutes a legal, valid               <br /><br /><br />
and binding obligation of the Company enforceable against the Company                   <br /><br /><br />
in accordance with its terms, except as such enforceability may be limited              <br /><br /><br />
by (i) applicable bankruptcy, insolvency, reorganization, moratorium or                 <br /><br /><br />
other similar laws affecting the enforcement of creditors’ rights generally             <br /><br /><br />
and (ii) general principles of equity (regardless of whether such                       <br /><br /><br />
enforceability is considered in a proceeding in equity or at law).                      <br /><br /><br />
(c)    Schedule 3 contains (except as otherwise noted) complete and correct lists       <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
or tables setting forth:                                                                <br /><br /><br />
(i)    the Company’s shareholders;                                                      <br /><br /><br />
(ii)    the Company's Affiliates showing forth, in each case, its                       <br /><br /><br />
relationship to the Company and the jurisdiction in which it is                         <br /><br /><br />
organized;                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
(iii)    the directors and senior officers of the Company, each shareholder             <br /><br /><br />
of the Company, and each Person or Group deemed to Control the                          <br /><br /><br />
Company, and    /                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
each Person or Group that is the ultimate beneficial owner of 5% or more                <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
of (x)the voting rights ordinarily empowered to control the management                  <br /><br /><br />
of the Company or (v) the rights to share in the profits of the Company,                <br /><br /><br />
and the chain through which such rights are exercised.                                  <br /><br /><br />
(d)    None of the Affiliates, directors, officers or other Persons identified in       <br /><br /><br />
Schedule 3 is a Prohibited Person. The Company is an “Eligible                          <br /><br /><br />
Applicant” under the Mining Law and no officer or director of the                       <br /><br /><br />
Company is a Person described in Sections 4.2(a), (d), (f) or (g) of the                <br /><br /><br />
Mining Law.                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
(e)    The execution, delivery and performance by the Company of this                   <br /><br /><br />
Agreement will not Q) contravene, result in any breach of, or constitute a              <br /><br /><br />
default under, any agreement or instrument to which the Company is a                    <br /><br /><br />
party or by which it or any of its properties are bound or affected,                    <br /><br /><br />
(ii) conflict with or result in a breach of any of the terms, conditions or             <br /><br /><br />
provisions of any order, judgment, decree, or ruling of any court, arbitrator           <br /><br /><br />

                                                                                     1C <br /><br /><br />
﻿ or governmental authority, applicable to the Company or (hi) violate any               <br /><br /><br />
 provision of any statute or other rule or regulation of any governmental               <br /><br /><br />
 authority applicable to the Company.                                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
(0 There arc no actions, suits, investigations or proceedings pending or, to the        <br /><br /><br />
knowledge of the Company, threatened, against or affecting the Company                  <br /><br /><br />
or any property of the Company in any court or before any arbitrator of                 <br /><br /><br />
any kind or before or by any governmental authority that call into question             <br /><br /><br />
the right of the Company to enter into and perform its obligations under                <br /><br /><br />
this Agreement or that, if resolved against the Company, would materially               <br /><br /><br />
adversely affect its ability to perform its obligations under this Agreement.           <br /><br /><br />
(g)    Neither the Company, nor any of the Company’s Affiliates, has been               <br /><br /><br />
determined under any order, judgment, decree or ailing of any court,                    <br /><br /><br />
arbitrator or governmental authority to be in material violation of (i) any             <br /><br /><br />

Agreement.                                                                              <br /><br /><br />

on behalf of the Company or any Affiliate of the Company has made or                    <br /><br /><br />

any candidate for political office in Liberia.)                                         <br /><br /><br />

4.2(d) of the Exploration Regulations, which shall not apply to the Company.            <br /><br /><br />

- SECTION 22 CONFIDENTIALITY                                                         <br /><br /><br />
22.1    The Agreement.                                                               <br /><br /><br />
This Agreement is not confidential, and the Company is not entitled to               <br /><br /><br />
confidential treatment of information relating to this Agreement except as           <br /><br /><br />
expressly provided in the Exploration Regulations and set out in Section 22.2.       <br /><br /><br />
The Government or the Company may, and the Government expects to, make               <br /><br /><br />
public information 'relating to the timing and amount of Royalties and other         <br /><br /><br />
payments specifically due or paid under the terms of this Agreement or of Taxes      <br /><br /><br />
and Duties payable or paid by the Company or the rates at which Royalties, Taxes     <br /><br /><br />
and Duties or other payments become due or are assessed.                             <br /><br /><br />
22.2    Other Information,                                                           <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
 (a)    Subject to the limitations set out in Section 22.2(b) and subject to Section <br /><br /><br />
 22.1, for a period of three years from disclosure, each party agrees not to         <br /><br /><br />
 divulge information designated in writing by the other party at the time of         <br /><br /><br />
 delivery' as confidential information or which relates to the Company’s             <br /><br /><br />
 Products, Operations, processes, plans or intentions. Product information,          <br /><br /><br />
 know-how, design rights, trade secrets, market opportunities and business           <br /><br /><br />
 and financial affairs (“Confidential Information") to any other Person              <br /><br /><br />
 without the prior written consent of the designating party. By designation          <br /><br /><br />
 of information as Confidential Information a party will be deemed to have           <br /><br /><br />
 represented that after review of such information it has reasonably                 <br /><br /><br />
 determined that the release of such information to third parties would              <br /><br /><br />
 materially adversely affect the party or its economic well-being.                   <br /><br /><br />
 (b)    Confidential Information docs not include information that:                  <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
 (i) was publicly available or otherwise known to a parly prior to the               <br /><br /><br />
 time of disclosure to it and not subject to a confidentiality                       <br /><br /><br />
 obligation;                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
﻿(ii)    subsequently becomes publicly known through no act or omission                    <br /><br /><br />
by a party;                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
(iii)    constitutes financial statements delivered to the Government under               <br /><br /><br />
Section 17.4 that are otherwise publicly available;                                       <br /><br /><br />
(iv)    is of scientific rather than commercial value, such as geological                 <br /><br /><br />
arid geophysical data relating to areas in which the Company no                           <br /><br /><br />
longer holds a valid Exploration License and has not designated as                        <br /><br /><br />
a Proposed Production Area; or                                                            <br /><br /><br />
(v)    has been disclosed pursuant to generally applicable Law or a final                 <br /><br /><br />
order of any court having jurisdiction that is not subject to appeal.                     <br /><br /><br />
(c) Each parly will maintain the confidentiality of Confidential Information              <br /><br /><br />
disclosed to it in a manner consistent with procedures adopted by such                    <br /><br /><br />
party' to protect its own confidential information, provided that such party              <br /><br /><br />
may deliver or disclose Confidential Information to:                                      <br /><br /><br />
(i)    its Affiliates, and its Affiliates’ financial, legal and other                     <br /><br /><br />
professional advisors of the party or its Affiliates (to the extent                       <br /><br /><br />
such disclosure reasonably relates to the administration of this                          <br /><br /><br />
Agreement); or                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
(ii)    any other Person to which such delivery or disclosure may be                      <br /><br /><br />
necessary or appropriate' (A) to effect compliance with any law,                          <br /><br /><br />
rule, regulation or order applicable to such party, (B) in response to                    <br /><br /><br />
any subpoena or other legal process, (C) in connection with any                           <br /><br /><br />
litigation to which such party is a party if reasonably considered                        <br /><br /><br />
necessary to protect such party’s position in such litigation or (D) if                   <br /><br /><br />
an Event of Default has occurred and is continuing but only to the                        <br /><br /><br />
extent such party reasonably determines such delivery and                                 <br /><br /><br />
disclosure to be necessary or appropriate in the enforcement or for                       <br /><br /><br />
the protection of the rights and remedies under this Agreement.                           <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 23 ASSIGNMENTS, TRANSFERS AND CHANGES OF                                          <br /><br /><br />
CONTROL                                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
The restriction on Transfers contained in Section 23.1 and the restriction on Changes of  <br /><br /><br />
Control in Section 23.4 are to be independently applied.                                  <br /><br /><br />
23.1 General Transfer Rule                                                                <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
 No Transfer of (L) this Agreement or a Mining License, or (2) any rights of the          <br /><br /><br />
 Company in a Mine or any Immovable Infrastructure (other than in the ordinary            <br /><br /><br />
 course of renewal and replacement of its properties and other than Transfers of          <br /><br /><br />
 Product(s) in the ordinary course of business) is permitted unless the Transfer (i)      <br /><br /><br />
 has received the prior written consent of the Government, which consent may be           <br /><br /><br />
 given or withheld in its sole discretion, or (ii) is otherwise permitted under the       <br /><br /><br />
 terms of Section 23.2, 23.3 or 23.6. Unless the Company has received the prior           <br /><br /><br />
 written consent of the Government, which consent may be given or withheld in its         <br /><br /><br />
﻿sole uijwjXvioi:, the company may not Transfer any Exploiauon License relating   <br /><br /><br />
to the Exploration Area independently of a Transfer of this Agreement; any       <br /><br /><br />
Transfer by the Company of all of this Agreement shall be deemed to include a    <br /><br /><br />
Transfer of all rights of the Company under any such Exploration License.        <br /><br /><br />
23.2 Permitted Transfer to an Affiliate                                          <br /><br /><br />
(a) A Transfer of (X) this Agreement and each Mining License or Exploration      <br /><br /><br />
License issued pursuant to this Agreement (if any), and (2) all rights of the    <br /><br /><br />
Company in the Mine, Mining Plant, Infrastructure (i) to an Affiliate or (H)     <br /><br /><br />
as a consequence of a merger or consolidation of the Company with an             <br /><br /><br />
Affiliate of the Company in which the Company is not the survivor, is            <br /><br /><br />
permitted if:                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
(t) at the time of the consummation of such transaction the Company              <br /><br /><br />
has not been notified by the Government that it is in material                   <br /><br /><br />
default in (lie performance of its obligations or the discharge of its           <br /><br /><br />
liabilities under this Agreement (other than any obligations that                <br /><br /><br />
have been waived by the Government or defaults that have been                    <br /><br /><br />
cured by the Company to the reasonable satisfaction of the                       <br /><br /><br />
Government) and no order suspending Work by the Company                          <br /><br /><br />
issued under Section 24 of this Agreement or Section 16 of the                   <br /><br /><br />
Exploration Regulations is outstanding and unresolved;                           <br /><br /><br />
(ii)    such transaction is not otherwise in violation of applicable Law;        <br /><br /><br />
(iii)    such transaction does not result in a Change of Control; and            <br /><br /><br />
(iv)    the survivor or transferee, as the case may be, is (x) a corporation     <br /><br /><br />
organized and validly subsisting under the laws of Liberia and (y)               <br /><br /><br />
an “Eligible Applicant” under the Mining Law and a Permitted                     <br /><br /><br />
Transferee under Section 23.8, and delivers to the Minister, the                 <br /><br /><br />
Minister of Finance and the Chairman of the National Investment                  <br /><br /><br />
Commission prior to the consummation of such Transfer:                           <br /><br /><br />
(A)    its agreement, in the form of a deed of adherence to this                 <br /><br /><br />
Agreement or a novation of this Agreement, to assume and                         <br /><br /><br />
perforin or discharge all of the obligations and liabilities of                  <br /><br /><br />
the Company under this Agreement and each Mining                                 <br /><br /><br />
License;                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
(B)    its written representations and warranties to the effect set              <br /><br /><br />
forth in Section 21.1 stated to be true and correct as of a                      <br /><br /><br />
time immediately after giving effect to such Transfer;                           <br /><br /><br />
(C)    the confirmation of the Company, if it continues to exist                 <br /><br /><br />
following such transaction, that it remains liable for the                       <br /><br /><br />
performance and discharge of its obligations and liabilities                     <br /><br /><br />
under this Agreement and each such Mining License, unless                        <br /><br /><br />
otherwise agreed by the Minister; and                                            <br /><br /><br />
