 97                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
﻿(t>) the continuation of the Guarantors that the Guarantees                         <br /><br /><br />
provided pursuant to Section 20.6, to the extent required, to                       <br /><br /><br />
apply to the survivor or transferee, as the case may be.                            <br /><br /><br />
(b) Any failure by the Government to give notice to the Company in                  <br /><br /><br />
accordance with clause (i) of Section 23.2(a) shall not affect the                  <br /><br /><br />
Government's rights and remedies under this Agreement to the extent the             <br /><br /><br />
Company was in default in a material respect in the performance of its              <br /><br /><br />
obligations or the discharge of its liabilities under this Agreement or under       <br /><br /><br />
the Exploration Regulations, which have not been cured to the reasonable            <br /><br /><br />
satisfaction of, or waived by, the Government.                                      <br /><br /><br />
23.3 Permitted Transfer to a Person not an Affiliate.                               <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
A Transfer of (X) this Agreement and each Mining License issued pursuant to this    <br /><br /><br />
Agreement (if any), and (2) all rights of the Company in the Mine, Mining Plant,    <br /><br /><br />
Infrastructure (i) to a Person not an Affiliate of the Company or (n) as-a          <br /><br /><br />
consequence of a merger or consolidation of the Company with a Person not an        <br /><br /><br />
Affiliate of the Company in which the Company is not the survivor, is permitted if  <br /><br /><br />
each of the requirements of Section 23.2(a) is satisfied other than clause (iii) of <br /><br /><br />
Section 23.2(a) and clause (iv)(D) of Section 23.2(a) and in addition the survivor  <br /><br /><br />
or transferee, as the case may be,                                                  <br /><br /><br />
(a)    has demonstrated to the satisfaction of the Government, acting reasonably,   <br /><br /><br />
that it has directly or indirectly the technical skills, experience and             <br /><br /><br />
financial resources necessary (or could be reasonably expected to obtain,           <br /><br /><br />
the financial resources necessaiy as evidenced by a viable financing plan,          <br /><br /><br />
which is supported by an appropriate commitment letter from any provider            <br /><br /><br />
of finance) to carry out its obligations under this Agreement, each                 <br /><br /><br />
Exploration License and each Mining License; and                                    <br /><br /><br />
(b)    has delivered to the Minister of Finance guarantees, to th^ extent required, <br /><br /><br />
in the form and from an entity or entities required by Section 20.6                 <br /><br /><br />
guaranteeing the specified obligations of the survivor or the transferee, as        <br /><br /><br />
the case may be.                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
If the Government objects to any proposed survivor or transferee on the             <br /><br /><br />
basis that such proposed survivor or transferee does not satisfy the                <br /><br /><br />
requirements specified in Section 23.3(a), it shall notify in writing its           <br /><br /><br />
objection to the Company, giving reasons therefor, within one month from            <br /><br /><br />
the date it receives notification from the Company that it proposes to make         <br /><br /><br />
a permitted Transfer in accordance with this Section 23.3. If the Company           <br /><br /><br />
has not received such notification from the Government within one month             <br /><br /><br />
from the date the Government received its notification of a proposed                <br /><br /><br />
permitted Transfer, the proposed survivor or transferee shall be treated as         <br /><br /><br />
having satisfied the requirements specified in Section 23.3(a).                     <br /><br /><br />
23.4 General Change of Control Rule,                                                <br /><br /><br />
No Change of Control of the Company is permitted unless it has received the prior   <br /><br /><br />
written consent of the Government or is otherwise permitted under the terms of      <br /><br /><br />
﻿Sec:'...,:. 35.5 ui 23.'j. For the avoidance ol doubt, the granting of any pledge, <br /><br /><br />
mortgage, charge or other encumbrance, which, if exercised would result in a       <br /><br /><br />
Change of Control, will not be treated as a Change of Control until exercised.     <br /><br /><br />
23.5 Permitted Changes of Control.                                                 <br /><br /><br />
(a)    A Change of Control with respect to (he Company is permitted if the         <br /><br /><br />
Change of Control occurs solely by operation of a Transfer otherwise               <br /><br /><br />
permitted under Section 23.3 or if:                                                <br /><br /><br />
(i)    at the time of the Change of Control the Company has not been               <br /><br /><br />
notified by the Government that it is in material default in the                   <br /><br /><br />
performance of its obligations or the discharge of its liabilities                 <br /><br /><br />
under this Agreement (other than any obligations that have been                    <br /><br /><br />
waived by the Government or defaults that have been cured by the                   <br /><br /><br />
Company to the reasonable satisfaction of the Government) and no                   <br /><br /><br />
order suspending Work by the Company issued under Section 24 of                    <br /><br /><br />
this Agreement or Section 16 of the Exploration Regulations is                     <br /><br /><br />
outstanding and unresolved;                                                        <br /><br /><br />
(ii)    the Company delivers to the Government prior to the Change of              <br /><br /><br />
Control its written representations and warranties to the effect set               <br /><br /><br />
forth in Section 21.1 stated to be true and correct as of a time                   <br /><br /><br />
immediately after giving effect to such Change of Control;                         <br /><br /><br />
(iii)    the Company has demonstrated to the satisfaction of the                   <br /><br /><br />
Government, acting reasonably, prior to the Change of Control that                 <br /><br /><br />
alter giving effect to the Change of Control it will have directly or              <br /><br /><br />
indirectly the technical skills, experience and financial resources                <br /><br /><br />
necessary (or could be reasonably expected to obtain the financial                 <br /><br /><br />
resources necessary' as evidenced by a viable financing plan, which                <br /><br /><br />
is supported by an appropriate commitment letter from any                          <br /><br /><br />
provider of finance) to carry out its obligations under this                       <br /><br /><br />
Agreement, each Exploration License and each Mining License;                       <br /><br /><br />
and                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
(iv)    prior to the Change of Control, either the Guarantors under the            <br /><br /><br />
Guarantees issued pursuant to Section 20.6 have confirmed to the                   <br /><br /><br />
Minister of Finance in writing the continued effectiveness of the                  <br /><br /><br />
Guarantees notwithstanding the Change of Control or the Company                    <br /><br /><br />
lias delivered to the Minister of Finance new Guarantees in the                    <br /><br /><br />
form and from an entity or entities requited by Section 20.6                       <br /><br /><br />
guaranteeing the specified obligations of the Company under this                   <br /><br /><br />
Agreement.                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
(v)    prior to the Change of Control, the withholding tax imposed                 <br /><br /><br />
pursuant to Section 14.3 has been paid.                                            <br /><br /><br />
(b)    If the Government objects to any Changes of Control on the basis that       <br /><br /><br />
following such proposed Change of Control (lie Company would not                   <br /><br /><br />
satisfy the requirements specified in clause (iii) of Section 23.5(a), it shall    <br /><br /><br />
﻿iiouly in writing its objection to the Company, giving reasons therefor,                 <br /><br /><br />
within one month from the date it receives notification from the Company                 <br /><br /><br />
that it proposes to make a permitted Change of Control in accordance with                <br /><br /><br />
this Section 23.5. If the Company has not received such notification from                <br /><br /><br />
the Government within one month from the date the Government received                    <br /><br /><br />
its notification of a proposed permitted Change of Control, the Company                  <br /><br /><br />
shall be treated as having satisfied the requirements specified in clause (iii)          <br /><br /><br />
of Section 23.5(a) following such Change of Control.                                     <br /><br /><br />
(c)    Any failure by the Government to give notice to the Company in                    <br /><br /><br />
accordance with clause (i) of Section 23.5(a) shall not affect the                       <br /><br /><br />
Government’s rights and remedies under this Agreement to the extent the                  <br /><br /><br />
Company was in default in a material respect in the performance of its                   <br /><br /><br />
obligations or the discharge of its liabilities under this Agreement or under            <br /><br /><br />
the Exploration Regulations (as modified by this Agreement), which have                  <br /><br /><br />
not been cured to the reasonable satisfaction of, or waived by, the                      <br /><br /><br />
Government.                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
(d)    If a Person who acquires Control is a wholly-owned subsidiary of a Person         <br /><br /><br />
who has Control and such acquiring Person continues to have Control after                <br /><br /><br />
such transaction then such transaction will not be treated as a Change of                <br /><br /><br />
Control.                                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
23.6 Right to Encumber, and Related Transfers and Changes of Control.                    <br /><br /><br />
The Company may mortgage, charge or otherwise encumber (collectively, a                  <br /><br /><br />
“Mortgage”), in a single financing, all but not less than all of its interest under this <br /><br /><br />
Agreement and each Mining License as security for an obligation or indebtedness          <br /><br /><br />
as contemplated by Section 9.18 of the Mining Law- if such Mortgage also covers          <br /><br /><br />
all right, title and interest of the Company in the Mine, Mining Plant,                  <br /><br /><br />
Infrastructure and related equipment (collectively with its rights under this            <br /><br /><br />
Agreement and each such Mining License, the “Mortgaged Property’^ and the                <br /><br /><br />
holder of such Mortgage agrees in writing with the Minister prior to the granting        <br /><br /><br />
of such Mortgage that it will cause a foreclosure or other exercise of remedies          <br /><br /><br />
under such Mortgage against the rights of the Company in the Mortgaged Property          <br /><br /><br />
to occur only if:                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
(a)    the exercise of remedies results in a Transfer of 100% of the interest of the     <br /><br /><br />
Company in the Mortgaged Property to a corporation other than the                        <br /><br /><br />
Company organized and validly subsisting under the laws of Liberia;                      <br /><br /><br />
(b)    the transferee delivers to the Minister, the Minister of Finance and the          <br /><br /><br />
Chairman of the National Investment Commission prior to such Transfer                    <br /><br /><br />
(i) its agreement, in form and substance reasonably satisfactory to the                  <br /><br /><br />
Minister, the Minister of Finance and the Chairman of the National                       <br /><br /><br />
Investment Commission to assume and perform or discharge all of                          <br /><br /><br />
the obligations and liabilities of the Company under this                                <br /><br /><br />
Agreement and each such. Mining License;                                                 <br /><br /><br />
﻿(u, evidence that ail requited consents or approvals oi the HPA and                      <br /><br /><br />
any other agencies of the Government to the grant of such                                <br /><br /><br />
Mortgage have been obtained; and                                                         <br /><br /><br />
(iii) its written representations and warranties to the effect set forth in              <br /><br /><br />
Section 21.1 staled to be true and correct as of a time immediately                      <br /><br /><br />
after giving effect to such Transfer;                                                    <br /><br /><br />
(c)    the transferee has demonstrated prior to such Transfer to the reasonable          <br /><br /><br />
satisfaction of the Minister, the Minister of Finance and the Chairman of                <br /><br /><br />
the National Investment Commission that it has the technical skills,                     <br /><br /><br />
experience, and financial resources necessary' to carry out its obligations              <br /><br /><br />
under this Agreement and, where relevant, each Mining License; and                       <br /><br /><br />
(d)    all outstanding failures of the Company to make any payments due to the           <br /><br /><br />
Government under this Agreement have been cured at the time of such                      <br /><br /><br />
Transfer (including a failure to pay royalties due but excluding any failure             <br /><br /><br />
to pay taxes due on income or profits), and the transferee has undertaken to             <br /><br /><br />
cure all other defaults of the Company then existing (to the extent they can             <br /><br /><br />
be cured by an entity other than the Company) within 270 days of the date                <br /><br /><br />
of the transfer.                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
Any exercise of remedies under a Mortgage in compliance by such holder in                <br /><br /><br />
accordance with the requirements set forth in this Section 23.6 is both a permitted      <br /><br /><br />
Transfer and a permitted Change of Control.                                              <br /><br /><br />
If requested, the Minister, acting on behalf of the Government, will enter into an       <br /><br /><br />
agreement with any such holder embodying the terms of this Section 23.6 at the           <br /><br /><br />
time any such Mortgage is granted.                                                       <br /><br /><br />
Notwithstanding the foregoing provisions of this Section 23.6, the Company may           <br /><br /><br />
grant purchase money security interests in any Movable property owned by it.             <br /><br /><br />
Any other partial assignment shall be subject to the Government's prior written          <br /><br /><br />
approval.                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
23.7    Reissue of Minina License in Name of Transferee; Mining License Invalid unless   <br /><br /><br />
Reissue Request Timely Received.                                                         <br /><br /><br />
The Minister shall reissue in the name of the transferee any Mining License that is      <br /><br /><br />
the subject of a Transfer permitted under this Section 23 within 30 days after           <br /><br /><br />
receipt of a transfer request from the transferor or the transferee. A Mining            <br /><br /><br />
License becomes invalid 90 days after a Transfer otherwise permitted under this          <br /><br /><br />
Section 23 unless a request to reissue the Mining License in the name of the             <br /><br /><br />
transferee is received by the Minister within such 90-day period.                        <br /><br /><br />
23.8    Permitted Transferee.                                                            <br /><br /><br />
A “Permitted Transferee” is a Person permitted to hold a Mining License under            <br /><br /><br />
the Mining Law who (i) is not a Prohibited Person, does not have an officer or           <br /><br /><br />
director who is n Prohibited Person, and is not controlled by a Prohibited Person,       <br /><br /><br />
and (ii) as to which no Person or Persons holding in the aggregate (x) in excess of      <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
 101                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
﻿5% of the voting lights ordinarily empowered to control the management of such        <br /><br /><br />
Person or (y) in excess of 5% of the rights to share in the profits of such Person is <br /><br /><br />
or are Prohibited Persons. A “Prohibited Person” is a Person that has been (i)        <br /><br /><br />
identified as such in regulations issued under the authority of the Ministry of       <br /><br /><br />
Finance and the Ministry of Justice and applicable to the holders of licenses issued  <br /><br /><br />
under the Mining Law, (ii) has been identified as being subject to sanctions by any   <br /><br /><br />
member organization that Government is a member of, or with which Government          <br /><br /><br />
has entered into treaties or other agreements with, provided such person has been     <br /><br /><br />
provided due process under the law, or (iii) has been identified by Government as     <br /><br /><br />
a Person that would pose a serious risk to the national security, public health and   <br /><br /><br />
safety or the economic or political stability of Government. A “Prohibited Person”    <br /><br /><br />
also includes any Person that issues bearer shares or other instruments to evidence   <br /><br /><br />
ownership of such Person that do not permit the identification of the owners of       <br /><br /><br />
such Person.                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
23.9    Responsibility of Licensee.                                                   <br /><br /><br />
It is the responsibility of the Company and its Controlling Persons to ensure that    <br /><br /><br />
Management Rights with respect to the Company are structured and held in such a       <br /><br /><br />
manner that transfers of such rights arc made in compliance with the Change of        <br /><br /><br />
Control provisions of this Section 23.                                                <br /><br /><br />
23.10    Disclosure: Consents: Exceptions; Fees.                                      <br /><br /><br />
(a)    If the Minister questions whether a Transfer or a Change of Control            <br /><br /><br />
occurred without a required consent, the Company has (he burden of                    <br /><br /><br />
demonstrating that consent was not required                                           <br /><br /><br />
(b)    A Transfer or a Change of Control does not comply with the requirements        <br /><br /><br />
of this Section 23 if any representations and warranties required to be               <br /><br /><br />
delivered in connection with such Transfer or Change of Control were not              <br /><br /><br />
true and correct in any material respect as of the date as of which they              <br /><br /><br />
were made.                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
(c)    A Mining License the subject of a Transfer in violation of this Section 23     <br /><br /><br />
becomes invalid upon such Transfer. A Mining License the subject of a                 <br /><br /><br />
Change of Control in violation of this Section 23 becomes invalid 30 days             <br /><br /><br />
after the occurrence of such Change of Control unless the transaction(s)              <br /><br /><br />
constituting such Change of Control are reversed within such 30-day                   <br /><br /><br />
period and the Company within such 30-day period reports to the Minister              <br /><br /><br />
such occurrence and the steps taken to reverse it within five days after the          <br /><br /><br />
end of such 30-day period.                                                            <br /><br /><br />
(d)    A Ministerial or Governmental consent required under this Section 23 will      <br /><br /><br />
not be given prior to payment of the processing fee provided under Section            <br /><br /><br />
[6.1(f).                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
(e)    For the avoidance of doubt, this Section 23 shall apply in substitution of     <br /><br /><br />
Section 15 of the lixploralion Regulations, which shall not apply to the              <br /><br /><br />
Company or its Affiliates. To the extent that there is any inconsistency              <br /><br /><br />
between the Law-s relating to the matters set out in this Section 23                  <br /><br /><br />
﻿ (.wiit-uicr .:i ciieci ai the bl'fccuvc Date or enacted thereafter) and this               <br /><br /><br />
 Agreement, this Agreement shall prevail.                                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
23.11 Terms used in Section 23.                                                             <br /><br /><br />
for the purpose of this Section 23 a '‘Controlling Person” is a Person who                  <br /><br /><br />
Controls the Company or who is a member of a Group that Controls the                        <br /><br /><br />
Company; and if a trust or other entity holds the rights to share in the profits of a       <br /><br /><br />
Person, the beneficiaries of such trust are deemed to hold the rights to share in the       <br /><br /><br />
profits of that Person.                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 24 SUSPENSION                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
24.1 Power of Minister to Suspend Work.                                                     <br /><br /><br />
The Exploration Regulations govern the right to suspend Work during the term of             <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
the Exploration License subject to the terms of this Agreement. After the issuance          <br /><br /><br />
of a Mining License pursuant to Section 5 the Minister may order the suspension             <br /><br /><br />
of all or the relevant portion of any Operations being carried on by the Company            <br /><br /><br />
under the authority of this Agreement and such Mining License if any of the                 <br /><br /><br />
following events or conditions relating to the Company has occurred and is                  <br /><br /><br />
continuing:                                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
(a)    the Company did not pay a surface rent payment when due and the failure              <br /><br /><br />
is not cured within 15 days after the Company receives notice of the                        <br /><br /><br />
failure from the Minister or the Minister of Finance; or                                    <br /><br /><br />
(b)    the Minister has determined that continuation of such Operations would               <br /><br /><br />
constitute a material continuing violation of Section 9.1 or would                          <br /><br /><br />
otherwise pose significant risks to the health and safety of workers                        <br /><br /><br />
engaged in or affected by such Operations or of individuals residing in or                  <br /><br /><br />
near any Production Area or any other area in which the Company is                          <br /><br /><br />
conducting Operations; or    /                                                              <br /><br /><br />
(c)    an environmental assessment and audit under Section 13 has demonstrated,             <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
or the Minister or the EPA, as the case may be, has determined (acting                      <br /><br /><br />
reasonably) that there exist material failures to comply with the approved                  <br /><br /><br />
EMP and the Company has not remedied such failures to the satisfaction                      <br /><br /><br />
of the Minister or the EPA (acting reasonably), as the case may be, within                  <br /><br /><br />
90 days from notice to the Company from either of them as to the nature of                  <br /><br /><br />
such failures; or                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
(d)    the Company is in violation of Section 6.3(b) (other than an isolated                <br /><br /><br />
immaterial violation); or                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
(e)    the Company is conducting Mining Operations outside of the Production                <br /><br /><br />
Area that is the subject of such Mining I.iccnse; or                                        <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
(0 the Company is in breach of any its obligations under Section 20.4 or                    <br /><br /><br />
Section 20.8 and has not cured such breach within 90 days after receiving                   <br /><br /><br />
notice from the Minister of such breach; or                                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                          < <br /><br /><br />
                                105                                                         <br /><br /><br />
﻿(g)    the Company is in material breach of any its obligations under Section        <br /><br /><br />
17.4 or Section 20.3 and has not cured such breach within 90 days after              <br /><br /><br />
receiving notice from the Minister of such breach; or                                <br /><br /><br />
(h)    the Company is in default of its obligation to pay Royalties under Section    <br /><br /><br />
15.1 in excess of USX 100,000, and such default has not been cured within            <br /><br /><br />
30 days after notice from the Minister or the Minister of Finance.                   <br /><br /><br />
24.2    Order Suspending Work.                                                       <br /><br /><br />
Except as provided in the following sentence, a suspension order shall be in         <br /><br /><br />
writing and signed by the Minister, and will be effective the Business Day           <br /><br /><br />
following its receipt by the Company at its address for notices, or, if delivered to <br /><br /><br />
the person in charge at a field office or other location at which the Operations to  <br /><br /><br />
be suspended are being performed, is effective on delivery. An order of              <br /><br /><br />
suspension based on a violation of Section 9.1 that has resulted in (or is           <br /><br /><br />
determined by the Minister to create a serious risk of resulting in) death or severe <br /><br /><br />
personal injury may be given by telephone confirmed in writing within 24 hours,      <br /><br /><br />
and is effective immediately. Any suspension order (except a telephone order         <br /><br /><br />
under the preceding sentence) shall set forth in a summary manner the facts relied   <br /><br /><br />
upon for the issuance of the order and the name, location and telephone number of    <br /><br /><br />
a responsible person at the Ministry (or the Ministry of Finance, as the case may    <br /><br /><br />
be) who may be contacted for additional information. Subject to Section 24.5,        <br /><br /><br />
neither the Company’s payment obligations under nor the term of this Agreement       <br /><br /><br />
or 'the term of the relevant Mining License are suspended by an order of             <br /><br /><br />
suspension under this Section.                                                       <br /><br /><br />
24.3    Compliance with Suspension Order.                                            <br /><br /><br />
The Company shall comply with an order of suspension properly given under this       <br /><br /><br />
Section 24 until such order is withdrawn (or deemed withdrawn) pursuant to           <br /><br /><br />
Section 24.4 or is directed to be withdrawn pursuant to an administrative order in   <br /><br /><br />
a hearing held pursuant to the Administrative Procedure Act of Liberia, or an        <br /><br /><br />
order in a judicial proceeding, or pursuant to an arbitration under Section 27.      <br /><br /><br />
24.4    Resumption of Work.                                                          <br /><br /><br />
The Company may at any time submit a request that a suspension order be              <br /><br /><br />
withdrawn, setting forth in reasonable detail the facts and circumstances relied     <br /><br /><br />
upon to demonstrate the elimination or correction of the event or condition that     <br /><br /><br />
supported the issuance of the order. The Minister shall withdraw the order if the    <br /><br /><br />
event or condition no longer exists or has been remedied to the satisfaction of the  <br /><br /><br />
Minister, acting reasonably. If within ten Business Days of receiving such           <br /><br /><br />
submission the Minister neither grants such request nor noli lies the Company of     <br /><br /><br />
the reasons for not granting such request, the order involved will be deemed         <br /><br /><br />
withdrawn. If within five Business Days of receiving a resubmitted request for       <br /><br /><br />
withdrawal of the same order, the Minister does not either grant such request or     <br /><br /><br />
give notice to the Company setting forth reasons for not granting such request, the  <br /><br /><br />
order involved will be deemed withdrawn. The initial and each subsequent             <br /><br /><br />
resubmission (if any) shall be conspicuously marked to show all changes              <br /><br /><br />
(additions and deletions) from the previous submission.                              <br /><br /><br />
﻿24.5 Suspension Order Incorrectly Given.                                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
In the event that the Government issues an order of suspension and the Company             <br /><br /><br />
disputes the existence of a breach or otherwise disputes the validity of such an           <br /><br /><br />
order, any dispute shall be resolved in the manner set out in Section 27. In the           <br /><br /><br />
event that an arbitral award determines that the suspension order was incorrectly          <br /><br /><br />
given, the Company shall, as the case may be, (i) obtain an extension of time              <br /><br /><br />
equivalent to the amount of time the suspension order was in effect in relation to         <br /><br /><br />
the time for Exploration, the time for the designation of a Proposed Production            <br /><br /><br />
Area and the time for filing a Feasibility Report or (ii) if it has been detennined        <br /><br /><br />
that a Company Event of Default under Section 25.2(e) is directly attributable to          <br /><br /><br />
' the incorrectly given order, be excused from such Company Event of Default for a         <br /><br /><br />
period reasonably necessary to cure such Company Event of Default.                         <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 25 EVENTS OF DEFAULT; TERMINATION                                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
25.1    Government Events of Default.                                                      <br /><br /><br />
A “Government Event of Default” shall exist:                                               <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
(a)    if (i) the Government shall have failed to comply with its material                 <br /><br /><br />
obligations under this Agreement and such failure has had a Material                       <br /><br /><br />
Adverse Effect on the Company, (ii) such failure is continuing for more                    <br /><br /><br />
than 90 days after the Company notifies the Government of such failure                     <br /><br /><br />
and (Hi) within such 90 day period the Government has not cured the                        <br /><br /><br />
adverse impact of such failure; or                                                         <br /><br /><br />
(b)    any representation or warranty of the Government continued in                       <br /><br /><br />
Section 21.2 proves to be false or incorrect in any material respect on the                <br /><br /><br />
date as of which made.                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
25.2    Company Events of Default.                                                         <br /><br /><br />
f                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
A “Company Event of Default” shall have occurred if any of the following                   <br /><br /><br />
conditions or events shall occur and be continuing:                                        <br /><br /><br />
(a)    the Company shall have failed to make any payment of surface rent and,              <br /><br /><br />
subject to Section 25.3, such failure not cured within 15 days of notice                   <br /><br /><br />
from the Minister or the Minister of Finance; or                                           <br /><br /><br />
(b)    the Company shall have failed to make any other payment due under this              <br /><br /><br />
Agreement, the Exploration Regulations, any Mining License issued                          <br /><br /><br />
pursuant to this Agreement or any undertaking of the Company provided                      <br /><br /><br />
for in this Agreement and, subject to Section 25.3, such failure is not cured              <br /><br /><br />
within 30 days of notice from the Minister or the Minister of Finance; or                  <br /><br /><br />
(c)    Standard Chartered Bank shall revoke the Up-Front Payment Guarantee;                <br /><br /><br />
or                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
(d)    any Parent Guarantor, the Exploration Guarantor or the Mining Guarantor             <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
(if applicable) shall revoke the Parent Guarantee, the Exploration                         <br /><br /><br />
Guarantee or the Mining Guarantee, as applicable, or the applicable                        <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                        5* <br /><br /><br />
 105                                                                                    /  <br /><br /><br />
﻿Guarantor shall no longer satisfy the applicable Guarantor Net Worth                <br /><br /><br />
Requirements, and the Company shall have failed to provide a replacement            <br /><br /><br />
Parent Guarantee, Exploration Guarantee or Mining Guarantee (if                     <br /><br /><br />
applicable) provided by a Person which meets the applicable Guarantor               <br /><br /><br />
Net Worth Requirements within 90 days after receipt of notice thereof               <br /><br /><br />
from the Minister or the guarantor under Environmental Restoration                  <br /><br /><br />
Obligations Guarantee is no longer an Acceptable Third Party Financial              <br /><br /><br />
Institution and the Company shall have failed to provide a replacement              <br /><br /><br />
guarantor in accordance with Section 5.7(c); or                                     <br /><br /><br />
(e)    any representation or warranty of the Company contained in Section 21.1      <br /><br /><br />
or Section 20.6(a) proves to have been false or incorrect in any material           <br /><br /><br />
respect on the date as of which made; or                                            <br /><br /><br />
(f)    the Company shall default in the performance of any other material           <br /><br /><br />
obligation of the Company.under this Agreement, any Mining License, the             <br /><br /><br />
Environmental Restoration Obligations Funding Agreement (if applicable)             <br /><br /><br />
or any undertaking of the Company provided for in this Agreement and                <br /><br /><br />
shall have failed to cure such default within 60 days after notice thereof          <br /><br /><br />
from the Minister (from the Minister of Finance, in the case of a failure to        <br /><br /><br />
pay any Taxes and Duties within the grace period provided by applicable             <br /><br /><br />
Law); or                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
(g)    the Company shall (i) voluntarily make an assignment of all or               <br /><br /><br />
substantially all of its assets for. the benefit of creditors other than an         <br /><br /><br />
assignment made to secure indebtedness incurred in the ordinary course of           <br /><br /><br />
business, (ii) file a petition or application to any tribunal for the               <br /><br /><br />
appointment of a trustee or receiver for all or any substantial part of its         <br /><br /><br />
assets, (in) commence any proceedings for its bankruptcy, reorganization,           <br /><br /><br />
arrangement (other than a scheme of arrangement not involving an                    <br /><br /><br />
insolvent company) or insolvency under any laws applicable it whether               <br /><br /><br />
now or hereafter in effect, or if any such petition or application is filed, or     <br /><br /><br />
any such proceedings are commenced against it, indicate its approval                <br /><br /><br />
thereof, consent thereto or acquiescence therein, or (iv) if any order is           <br /><br /><br />
entered appointing any such trustee or receiver, or adjudicating it bankrupt        <br /><br /><br />
or insolvent, or approving the petition in any such proceedings, permit             <br /><br /><br />
such order to remain in effect for more than 90 days.                               <br /><br /><br />
25.3 Disputed Payments.                                                             <br /><br /><br />
If the Company is notified by the Minister or the Minister of Finance in            <br /><br /><br />
accordance with Section 25.2 that is has failed to make any payment due under       <br /><br /><br />
this Agreement, the Exploration Regulations (as modified by this Agreement), any    <br /><br /><br />
Mining License issued pursuant to this Agreement or any undertaking of the          <br /><br /><br />
Company provided for in this Agreement (a ‘‘Payment Notice”), and the Company       <br /><br /><br />
disputes part or all of the amount which is the subject of the Payment Notice, it   <br /><br /><br />
shall, within ten Business Days of receipt of the Payment Notice, notify the        <br /><br /><br />
Minister or the Minister of Finance of that fact, giving reasons therefor. To the   <br /><br /><br />
extent the parlies are unable the resolve the dispute within a reasonable period of <br /><br /><br />
time (taking into account the subject matter of die dispute), the parties shall     <br /><br /><br />
resolve such dispute in accordance with Section 27. Nothing in this Section 25.3    <br /><br /><br />
﻿shall relieve the Company from being obliged to pay any undisputed amount          <br /><br /><br />
which is the subject of a Payment Notice within the time periods referred to in    <br /><br /><br />
Section 25.2.                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
25.4    Nature of Notice of Default.                                               <br /><br /><br />
Any notice of an alleged Event of Default by either party shall identify with      <br /><br /><br />
reasonable clarity the principal provision or provisions with respect to which the <br /><br /><br />
default arises and the facts alleged to constitute such default.                   <br /><br /><br />
25.5    Notice of Termination: Termination When a Mortgage Exists; Arbitration of  <br /><br /><br />
■Disputes as to Existence of Event of Default,                                     <br /><br /><br />
(a)    If an Event of Default with respect to a parly has occurred and is          <br /><br /><br />
continuing, the other party may give the defaulting party notice of                <br /><br /><br />
termination (a “Termination Notice”), This Agreement and each                      <br /><br /><br />
Exploration License or Mining License shall terminate (50 days after               <br /><br /><br />
receipt of the Termination Notice by the defaulting party (or at such later        <br /><br /><br />
time as may be provided in the Termination Notice), subject to Sections            <br /><br /><br />
25.5(b) and (c)..                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
(b)    If a Mortgage permitted under Section 23.6 exists, the Termination Notice   <br /><br /><br />
will not be effective so long as the Company, the holder of the Mortgage           <br /><br /><br />
and the responsible officer of any relevant tribunal referred to in Section        <br /><br /><br />
25.2(f) ar.e .diligently seeking to transfer the rights and obligations of the     <br /><br /><br />
Company under this Agreement, any Mining License, the Mine and                     <br /><br /><br />
substantially all of the Mining Plant, Infrastructure and related property of      <br /><br /><br />
the Company to a transferee that would be permitted under Section 23 so            <br /><br /><br />
long as (i) such a transfer is completed within 18 months from the                 <br /><br /><br />
commencement of such proceedings, (ii) the operations of the Company               <br /><br /><br />
continue on a commercial scale throughout such period (subject to Force            <br /><br /><br />
Majeure) in substantial compliance w'ith the requirements of this                  <br /><br /><br />
Agreement and the relevant Mining License, and (iii) the Company                   <br /><br /><br />
becomes and remains in compliance with its EMP and its payment                     <br /><br /><br />
obligations under this Agreement.                                                  <br /><br /><br />
(c)    Any dispute relating to the existence of an Event of Default, its remedy    <br /><br /><br />
and any purported termination in connection therewith pursuant to this             <br /><br /><br />
Section 25 shall be resolved in the manner set out in Section 28. If a party       <br /><br /><br />
asserts the existence of an Event of Default and the other party refers to         <br /><br /><br />
arbitration in accordance with Section 27 a dispute as to the existence of         <br /><br /><br />
such Event of Default, termination of this Agreement may not take effect           <br /><br /><br />
other than after the finality of, and in accordance with, an arbitration award     <br /><br /><br />
upholding the existence of such Event of Default. In the event that an             <br /><br /><br />
arbitration award upholds the existence of such Event of Default, the party        <br /><br /><br />
in default shall be entitled to cure the default in accordance with the            <br /><br /><br />
relevant cure period specified in this Section 25. Failure to cure ihc             <br /><br /><br />
default within such period shall entitle the non-defaulting parly to               <br /><br /><br />
terminate this Agreement in accordance with Section 25.5(a). The                   <br /><br /><br />
Company shall reimburse the Government for all expenses incurred by it             <br /><br /><br />
in connection with arbitration held pursuant to this Section 25.5(c) if the        <br /><br /><br />
﻿Government’s determination that a Company Event of Default exists is              <br /><br /><br />
upheld in the arbitration. The Government shall reimburse the Company             <br /><br /><br />
for all expenses incurred by it in connection with arbitration held pursuant      <br /><br /><br />
to this Section 25.5(c) if the Company’s determination that a Government          <br /><br /><br />
Event of Default exists is upheld in the arbitration. For (he avoidance of        <br /><br /><br />
doubt. Section 18 of the Exploration Regulations or any other equivalent          <br /><br /><br />
provision under applicable Law shall not apply.                                   <br /><br /><br />
Automatic Termination.                                                            <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
If, at any time during the Term:                                                  <br /><br /><br />
(a)    the Company has no remaining Exploration Licenses or Mining Licenses       <br /><br /><br />
and is not awaiting the issuance of a Mining License pursuant to Section          <br /><br /><br />
5.9(g); or                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
(b)    no Proposed Production Area has been designated by the Company             <br /><br /><br />
pursuant to Section 5.1 (a) and there are no areas as to which the Company        <br /><br /><br />
has extended the time lor designating Proposed Production Areas pursuant          <br /><br /><br />
to Section 5.3(a)(i) as to which the period for extension has not expired; or     <br /><br /><br />
(c)    no Feasibility Report has been submitted by the Company pursuant to        <br /><br /><br />
Section 5.2(a) and there arc no Proposed Production Areas as to which the         <br /><br /><br />
Company has extended the time for filing a Feasibility' Report pursuant to        <br /><br /><br />
Section 5.3(a)(ii) or has received approval from the Government to deliver        <br /><br /><br />
a Feasibility Report pursuant to Section 5.4, in each case as to which, if the    <br /><br /><br />
applicable Feasibility' Report has not been filed, the applicable time for        <br /><br /><br />
filing has not expired; and                                                       <br /><br /><br />
(d)    there are no other designated Proposed Production Areas as to which (he    <br /><br /><br />
applicable deadline for Filing a Feasibility Report has not expired; or           <br /><br /><br />
(e)    the deadline for Feasibility Report submission specified in Section 5.2(a) <br /><br /><br />
has expired, there are no Proposed Production Areas as to which the               <br /><br /><br />
Company has extended the time for filing a Feasibility Report pursuant to         <br /><br /><br />
Section 5.3(a)(ii) or has received approval from the Government to deliver        <br /><br /><br />
a Feasibility Report pursuant to Section 5.4, in each case as to which, if the    <br /><br /><br />
applicable Feasibility Report has not been filed, the applicable time for         <br /><br /><br />
filing has not expired, and there arc no Feasibility Reports, including any       <br /><br /><br />
amendments, modifications or supplements thereof, under review by the             <br /><br /><br />
Ministry'; and                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
(t) there are no Disapproved Feasibility Reports as to which the applicable       <br /><br /><br />
time periods set forth in Section 5.9(e) have not expired,                        <br /><br /><br />
this Agreement shall automatically terminate without requirement of action by the <br /><br /><br />
Company or the Government and the Company and the Government shall have no        <br /><br /><br />
further obligations under this Agreement other than 0 with respect to the         <br /><br /><br />
Company, its closure management obligations as set out in its Approved Work       <br /><br /><br />
Program and Budget or its approved BMP (as applicable) and (ii) with respect to   <br /><br /><br />
both parties those matters that survive pursuant to, and all other liabilities or <br /><br /><br />
/' 0 .                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
﻿obligations described in, Section 36.8; provided that this Agreement shall not               <br /><br /><br />
terminate pursuant to this Section 25.6 unless the Government has first provided             <br /><br /><br />
written notice of its determination that a condition or event under this Section 25.6        <br /><br /><br />
exists or has occurred (as the case may be) and the Company, within a period of              <br /><br /><br />
not more than sixty (60) days from receipt of such notice, has failed to present             <br /><br /><br />
evidence reasonably acceptable to the Government that such condition or event                <br /><br /><br />
does not exist or has not occurred (as the case may be).                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
25.7 Winding-up Commission.                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
(a) Except as provided in Section 25.7(d), if a notice of termination has been               <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
given, the parties hereto shall set up a winding up commission (hereinafter                  <br /><br /><br />
referred to as the '‘Commission”) which shall consist of two directors of                    <br /><br /><br />
the Company, two members appointed by the Government and a member                            <br /><br /><br />
of an internationally recognized accounting or law firm selected by the                      <br /><br /><br />
Government and reasonably acceptable to. the Company, who will be the                        <br /><br /><br />
“Chairperson of the Winding Up Commission”. The fifth member may                             <br /><br /><br />
not in the last ten years have represented the interests of the Government                   <br /><br /><br />
or the Company and his or her firm may not in the past five years have                       <br /><br /><br />
been regularly retained by the Government or the Company. The                                <br /><br /><br />
Chairperson will be responsible for scheduling meetings, for establishing                    <br /><br /><br />
the agenda of meetings, and for keeping the record of meetings.                              <br /><br /><br />
..(b) The Chairperson of the Winding Up Commission shall issue a notice and                  <br /><br /><br />
agenda for the first meeting of the Commission, which shall be held no                       <br /><br /><br />
later than three weeks after the establishment of the Commission.                            <br /><br /><br />
Thereafter, the Commission shall hold periodic meetings at least once a                      <br /><br /><br />
calendar month.                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
(c)    The Company shall present to the Commission within 30 days of its                     <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
establishment a summary report, and within 60 days of its establishment a                    <br /><br /><br />
detailed report, on the status of Operations as of the date of termination so                <br /><br /><br />
that the Commission will be able to make recommendations to the                              <br /><br /><br />
Government as to whether the Commission and the Company should seek                          <br /><br /><br />
to transfer the assets and operations of the Company to a third party, or                    <br /><br /><br />
should establish plans for the full or partial cessation of operations                       <br /><br /><br />
including the disposition of assets and their demolition or removal                          <br /><br /><br />
according to Section 26 and the restoration of the areas environmentally                     <br /><br /><br />
adversely affected by Operations to such condition as prescribed in the                      <br /><br /><br />
closure management plan provided for in the EMP.                                             <br /><br /><br />
(d)    The operation of this Section 25.7 is suspended under the circumstances               <br /><br /><br />
contemplated by Section 25.5(b) or pending the final decision of an                          <br /><br /><br />
arbitration challenging such termination commenced under Section 27.                         <br /><br /><br />
The notice of arbitration is automatically terminated if a transfer                          <br /><br /><br />
contemplated by Section 25.5(b) is timely completed or if a final decision                   <br /><br /><br />
in an arbitration commenced under Section 27 determines that the notice                      <br /><br /><br />
of termination is invalid or should be disregarded.                                          <br /><br /><br />
