 109                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
﻿      SECTION 26 DISPOSITION OK ASSETS                                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
      General Provision.                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
      Prior to the termination of this Agreement, the Company shall have the right to     <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
      control all its Mining Plant, Infrastructure and other assets {other than any such  <br /><br /><br />
      Infrastructure located in the Port or any other port where the Company may          <br /><br /><br />
      conduct Operations), whether or not the same may revert to and become the           <br /><br /><br />
      property of the Government upon such termination, and, to the extent no longer      <br /><br /><br />
      required for Operations or for compliance with any specific provision of this       <br /><br /><br />
      Agreement, to dispose of in the ordinary course of its business any such assets     <br /><br /><br />
      (other than Land leased from the Government, Immovables or the Company’s            <br /><br /><br />
      rights under any Exploration License or any Mining License).                        <br /><br /><br />
26.2  Disposition of Assets on Termination bv the Government or Expiration of the         <br /><br /><br />
      Term.                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
      Upon the termination of this Agreement for any reason excluding termination by      <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
      the Company upon the occurrence and continuation of a Government Event of           <br /><br /><br />
      Default, the following rules apply:                                                 <br /><br /><br />
      (a) The Company shall deliver to the Government, not more than 90 days after        <br /><br /><br />
      the termination date a list (the ‘'Property List”! describing in reasonable         <br /><br /><br />
      detail and locating:                                                                <br /><br /><br />
      (i)    all Mining Plant and Infrastructure constituting structures or               <br /><br /><br />
      installations of any kind, including structures and installations and               <br /><br /><br />
      other Infrastructure to which the Government has title (including                   <br /><br /><br />
      all Infrastructure located in the Port or any other port where the                  <br /><br /><br />
      Company may conduct Operations), and any Movable assets                             <br /><br /><br />
      required for the full use or operation of any such Mining Plant and                 <br /><br /><br />
      Infrastructure (such as, by way only of example, computers and                      <br /><br /><br />
      computer programs controlling the operation of Mine ventilation                     <br /><br /><br />
      systems and elevators), but excluding other Movable assets,                         <br /><br /><br />
      identifying which assets could be used in continued Operations or                   <br /><br /><br />
      otherwise and which in the good faith judgment of the Company                       <br /><br /><br />
      have no further utility; and                                                        <br /><br /><br />
      (ii)    the Mine, any assets required for the full use or operation of the          <br /><br /><br />
      Mine and all Mining Plant and Infrastructure constituting                           <br /><br /><br />
      improvements to the Land (including such things as roads,                           <br /><br /><br />
      earthworks, bridges and dams, but excluding any Movable assets).                    <br /><br /><br />
      The Property List shall also set forth the estimated fair market value of           <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
      each Movable asset contained on such list. Movable assets identified in             <br /><br /><br />
      clause (i) of this Section 26.2(a) may be grouped for valuation purposes by         <br /><br /><br />
      generic type of asset and physical location, so that, for example, all              <br /><br /><br />
      Movable assets in a particular heavy equipment maintenance shop might               <br /><br /><br />
      be classified for valuation purposes as “mine truck parts and supplies,”            <br /><br /><br />
      “dragline and shovel parts and supplies” and “maintenance equipment”,               <br /><br /><br />
      but such grouping for valuation purposes docs not excuse the Company                <br /><br /><br />
﻿from the duty to describe such Movable assets in reasonable detail and the           <br /><br /><br />
Government may request that the price for specified items included on the            <br /><br /><br />
Property List be broken out from such aggregate valuation. The Property              <br /><br /><br />
List shall be accompanied by a certificate of the Chief Executive Officer of         <br /><br /><br />
the Company to the effect that such list is complete and correct in all              <br /><br /><br />
material respects.                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
(b)    The Company shall, as part of its closure responsibilities, remove all such   <br /><br /><br />
structures and installations described in the Property List pursuant to              <br /><br /><br />
clause (i) of Section 26.2(a) and to which the Company has title except              <br /><br /><br />
insofar as the Government, within 90 days of receipt of such list, has               <br /><br /><br />
directed the Company to transfer to the Government such structures or                <br /><br /><br />
installations, related rights to Land (in the case of any such assets not            <br /><br /><br />
located on Government Land), and any Movable assets which the                        <br /><br /><br />
Government elects to purchase pursuant to Section 26.2(f)- The Company               <br /><br /><br />
shall transfer to the Government, without charge, all of its right title and         <br /><br /><br />
interest in each structure or installation (other than Movable items)                <br /><br /><br />
promptly following its receipt of such authorization or direction as to such         <br /><br /><br />
property. The Company shall also, as part of its closure responsibilities,           <br /><br /><br />
remove those structures and installations described in the Property List             <br /><br /><br />
pursuant to clause (i) of Section 26.2(a) and to which the Government has            <br /><br /><br />
title and those required Movable assets identified on the Property List and          <br /><br /><br />
to which the Government has title, in each case as lo which the                      <br /><br /><br />
Government, within 90 days of receipt of such list, has directed the                 <br /><br /><br />
Company to remove.                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
(c)    The Company shall transfer to the Government, without charge, all of its      <br /><br /><br />
rights, title and interest in all Immovable property and Infrastructure that is      <br /><br /><br />
Movable that is described pursuant to clauses (i) and (ii) of Section 26.2(a)        <br /><br /><br />
within 10 days of the delivery of the Property List.                                 <br /><br /><br />
(d)    If the Company wishes to sell to a third party (other than an Affiliate) any  <br /><br /><br />
Movable assets (except any Movable assets which are referred to in clause            <br /><br /><br />
(i) of Section 26.2(a) and ordinary office equipment, furnishings and                <br /><br /><br />
supplies and consumables reasonably expected to be consumed before the               <br /><br /><br />
Termination Dale) and any other information required for the full use or             <br /><br /><br />
operation or such Movable assets, it shall include such assets and                   <br /><br /><br />
information in the Property List. For the avoidance of doubt, the Company            <br /><br /><br />
shall be permitted to transfer any Movable assets (except any Movable                <br /><br /><br />
assets which are referred to in clause (i) of Section 26.2(a)) to any Affiliate      <br /><br /><br />
on any terms without first offering them to the Government pursuant to               <br /><br /><br />
this Section 26.2.                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
(e)    The Government shall have the first right of refusal to purchase the          <br /><br /><br />
Movable assets contained in the Property List in accordance with Section             <br /><br /><br />
26.2(f).                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
(f)    The delivery of the Property List shall constitute an offer by the Company    <br /><br /><br />
to sell to the Government or its designee any or all Movable assets                  <br /><br /><br />
contained in the Property List at a purchase price equal to the lesser of the        <br /><br /><br />
fair market value or depreciated book value of each such asset, on an “as is         <br /><br /><br />
 V    ; --    S>                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
﻿and where is" btisis. If the Government docs not exercise such purchase        <br /><br /><br />
right as to any Movable asset included in the Property List by notice to the   <br /><br /><br />
Company within 60 days after delivery of the list, then the Company may        <br /><br /><br />
sell such asset to any Person for such price as it may be able to obtain       <br /><br /><br />
therefore or remove such asset from Liberia. If the Government exercises       <br /><br /><br />
its purchase right with respect to any Movable asset and related               <br /><br /><br />
information, it shall pay the purchase price within 90 days of the date upon   <br /><br /><br />
which such purchase price is established, against transfer by the Company      <br /><br /><br />
to the Government of all of its right title and interest in such Movable       <br /><br /><br />
asset.                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
(g)    The Government, by notice to the Company within a reasonable period but <br /><br /><br />
not to exceed one year after any termination of this Agreement, may            <br /><br /><br />
require the Company to dispose of in accordance with applicable Law any        <br /><br /><br />
Movable assets not sold to the Government that remain on Government            <br /><br /><br />
Land or in Mining Plant or Infrastructure that has been transferred to the     <br /><br /><br />
Government, if the Company doe ~not reasonably dispose of or remove            <br /><br /><br />
such asset or assets within a reasonable period after said notice, the         <br /><br /><br />
Government may effect such reasonable disposal or removal at the               <br /><br /><br />
expense ol the Company.                                                        <br /><br /><br />
(h)    Except in accordance with Section 26.2(i) and (j), no transfer to the   <br /><br /><br />
Government of any assets pursuant to this Section 26 with or without           <br /><br /><br />
compensation shall release the Company from any of its environmental           <br /><br /><br />
restoration or remediation obligations under this Agreement which exist as     <br /><br /><br />
at the date of termination of this Agreement.                                  <br /><br /><br />
(i)    Subject to Section 26.2(j) below, following the termination of this     <br /><br /><br />
Agreement and prior to the transfer of any assets to the Government in         <br /><br /><br />
accordance with this Section 26, the Company, the Government and the           <br /><br /><br />
F.PA shall agree upon the nature and extent of the Company’s                   <br /><br /><br />
environmental restoration or remediation obligations in accordance with        <br /><br /><br />
the agreed closure plan comprised in the EMP (as may have been updated         <br /><br /><br />
from time to time) (the “Final Closure Plan"), including such amounts          <br /><br /><br />
required to fund the Company’s obligations as set out in the Final Closure     <br /><br /><br />
Plan. Following the transfer of any assets pursuant to this Section 26 to      <br /><br /><br />
Ihe Government, subject to its obligations in the Final Closure Plan, the      <br /><br /><br />
Company shall have no further liability in respect of any environmental        <br /><br /><br />
restoration or remediation other than as provided for in the Final Closure     <br /><br /><br />
Plan. Once the Company shall have completed the Final Closure Plan it          <br /><br /><br />
shall provide a certificate of the Chief Executive Officer to the              <br /><br /><br />
Government as to its completion. If either the Government confirms its         <br /><br /><br />
agreement in writing or fails to provide within 9 months of the date of such   <br /><br /><br />
certificate a notice setting out in writing the areas where it considers that  <br /><br /><br />
the Company has not satisfied the obligations in the Final Closure Plan        <br /><br /><br />
then the Company shall have no further liability in respect of any             <br /><br /><br />
environmental restoration or remediation. In the event that the                <br /><br /><br />
Government provides such a notice then once the Company has completed          <br /><br /><br />
the items (or any dispute in respect thereof has been settled) then the        <br /><br /><br />
Company shall be entitled to recommence the process.                           <br /><br /><br />
﻿(j)    I f the Government arranges for a qualified replacement operator to acquire     <br /><br /><br />
all of the assets on the Property List and to continue the operations of the           <br /><br /><br />
Mine, it will release the Company from its environmental restoration or                <br /><br /><br />
remediation obligations and amounts set aside for environmental                        <br /><br /><br />
restoration and remediation shall be available to fund the environmental               <br /><br /><br />
restoration or remediation obligations of the replacement operator and the             <br /><br /><br />
Company shall have no further liability in respect of any environmental                <br /><br /><br />
restoration or remediation other than in respect of any obligations set out            <br /><br /><br />
in the Final Closure Plan save that the Company shall not be responsible               <br /><br /><br />
for any environmental restoration or remediation required as a result of the           <br /><br /><br />
continued operations of the Mine. In any such case, the Company shall at               <br /><br /><br />
the request of the Government transfer directly to such replacement                    <br /><br /><br />
operator all assets otherwise to be transferred to the Government under this           <br /><br /><br />
Section 26.2, in the manner provided for in this Section 26.2, provided that           <br /><br /><br />
the Company is not obligated to transfer assets for which payment is                   <br /><br /><br />
required under Section 26.2 except against payment of the purchase price               <br /><br /><br />
required by this Section 26.2.                                                         <br /><br /><br />
(k)    All right, title and interest in all Feasibility Reports shall automatically    <br /><br /><br />
vest in the Government, subject to the Company being able to use such                  <br /><br /><br />
Feasibility Reports in connection with any obligations which survive                   <br /><br /><br />
termination or any other projects in Liberia.                                          <br /><br /><br />
26.3    Special Provisions for Public Use Infrastructure.                              <br /><br /><br />
To the extent the Company has built and is operating under its Mining License or       <br /><br /><br />
this Agreement facilities required by Regulations, this Agreement or other             <br /><br /><br />
applicable Law to be made available for use by third parties (such facilities could    <br /><br /><br />
include, by way of example and not limitation, highways, railroads, port facilities,   <br /><br /><br />
water supplies, electrical supplies, hospitals or schools), unless the Government      <br /><br /><br />
agrees otherwise with the Company, the Government may, in lieu of the                  <br /><br /><br />
procedures set forth in Section 26.2, require (by notice to the Company withjn 90      <br /><br /><br />
days after the delivery of the Property List) the Company to transfer all of its right <br /><br /><br />
title and interest, in and to any such facility (including all Movable Assets          <br /><br /><br />
normally used in conjunction with any such facility and all other information          <br /><br /><br />
required for the full use or operation of such facility) to a Person designated by the <br /><br /><br />
Government, in the case of Immovable assets, without charge or, in the case of         <br /><br /><br />
Movable assets, for the purchase price attributable to such Movable assets and         <br /><br /><br />
related information determined as provided in Section 26.2(f), as applicable, on an    <br /><br /><br />
“as is and where is” basis. If the Government so designates a facility for purchase    <br /><br /><br />
by a third party, the third party shall pay the relevant purchase price within 90      <br /><br /><br />
days of the later of the date upon which such purchase price is established and the    <br /><br /><br />
date such purchaser is designated.                                                     <br /><br /><br />
26.4    Certain Insurance and Maintenance Obligations of the Company.                  <br /><br /><br />
The Company shall insure in accordance with the requirements of this Agreement         <br /><br /><br />
and maintain (in accordance with the requirements of this Agreement) the Mine,         <br /><br /><br />
all Mining Plant and Infrastructure and all Movable assets until (j) title is          <br /><br /><br />
transferred to the Government by the Company, where transfer of the property is        <br /><br /><br />
required under this Section 26 without action by the Government, (ii) payment is       <br /><br /><br />
﻿to be made for such property under this Section 26, where such transfer is to be           <br /><br /><br />
made against payment by the Government or a third party following election of              <br /><br /><br />
transfer by the Government, or (iii) at such time as the right of the Government           <br /><br /><br />
under this Section 26 to elect to require the transfer of such property to it or a third   <br /><br /><br />
party has expired, in the case of property the transfer of which is not required by        <br /><br /><br />
the Government in accordance with this Section 26.                                         <br /><br /><br />
26.5    Determination of Movable Asset Fair Market Value.                                  <br /><br /><br />
Unless the Government notifies the Company that it disagrees with the                      <br /><br /><br />
Company’s fair market value estimates for a Movable asset (and related                     <br /><br /><br />
information) included in the Property List at or prior to the time it notifies the         <br /><br /><br />
Company of its desire to acquire such asset, the Company’s valuation shall be              <br /><br /><br />
final. If the Government does give notice of disagreement, fair market value shall         <br /><br /><br />
be determined by internationally recognized appraisal firm experienced in the              <br /><br /><br />
valuation of mining Movable assets, The firm will be selected by the                       <br /><br /><br />
Government, but shall be from a list of three such firms selected by the Company           <br /><br /><br />
if the Company provides such list when it provides the Property' List. The costs of        <br /><br /><br />
the appraiser in respect of each appraisal shall be allocated by the appraiser and         <br /><br /><br />
shall be borne by the Company unless the valuation placed on the asset by the              <br /><br /><br />
appraiser is at least 95% of the valuation placed on the asset by the Company, in          <br /><br /><br />
which case the cost of the appraiser shall be by the Government. If the Company            <br /><br /><br />
is unable or fails to provide for the transfer of any information required for the full    <br /><br /><br />
use or operation of any Movable asset (or if for any reason the Government or a            <br /><br /><br />
purchaser designated by the government elects not to acquire and such                      <br /><br /><br />
information), its fair market value shall be determined based on its value to a            <br /><br /><br />
Person who shall acquire in the marketplace the necessary information.                     <br /><br /><br />
26.6    Disposition of Minina Plant and Infrastructure on Termination bv the Company.      <br /><br /><br />
(a)    Upon a termination of this Agreement by the Company upon the                        <br /><br /><br />
t    occurrence and continuation of a Government Event of Default, all Mining              <br /><br /><br />
Plant and Infrastructure or installations of any kind (other than any                      <br /><br /><br />
Movable items or any information related thereto) become the property of                   <br /><br /><br />
the Government except to the extent the Government elects to transfer the                  <br /><br /><br />
relevant Land to the Company. The right is reserved for any Shareholder                    <br /><br /><br />
or the Company to submit a claim to arbitration for appropriate relief and                 <br /><br /><br />
remedy.                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
(b)    All Movable assets (and information related to the use or operation of such         <br /><br /><br />
Movable assets) shall be and remain the property of the Company. The                       <br /><br /><br />
Company shall remove all such property front Land not owned or leased                      <br /><br /><br />
by the Government within two years of the date of termination.                             <br /><br /><br />
26.7    Miscellaneous.                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
 In connection with any transfer of rights in property pursuant to this Section 26,        <br /><br /><br />
 the Company shall execute such instruments of transfer sufficient to transfer all         <br /><br /><br />
 right, title and interest of the transferor as the transferee may reasonably request.     <br /><br /><br />
﻿ 26.8 Liens.                                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
Any transfer of property to the Government or a third parly pursuant to this                                           <br /><br /><br />
Section 26 shall be free and clear of Liens or other charges and encumbrances of                                       <br /><br /><br />
any kind arising out of any action or inaction of the Company or any Person                                            <br /><br /><br />
claiming by, through or under the Company (other titan any Liens granted                                               <br /><br /><br />
pursuant to and in accordance with Section 23.6).                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
26.9 Intellectual Property.                                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
To the extent that any intellectual property is required for the full use or operation                                 <br /><br /><br />
of the Mine, Mining Plant and Infrastructure which is transferred to the                                               <br /><br /><br />
Government pursuant to this Section 26, to the extent the Company owns or has a                                        <br /><br /><br />
right to such intellectual property, so far as it is reasonably able to do so and                                      <br /><br /><br />
subject to any third party rights in relation to such intellectual property, the                                       <br /><br /><br />
Company shall grant a license or assign its rights to the intellectual property to the                                 <br /><br /><br />
Government. To the extent the terms on which the Company is granted the rights                                         <br /><br /><br />
to use such intellectual property prohibit its assignment without third party                                          <br /><br /><br />
consent, the Company shall use reasonable endeavors to obtain such consent on                                          <br /><br /><br />
behalf of the Government. “Intellectual property” includes trademarks, patent                                          <br /><br /><br />
licenses, copyrights, software, electronically stored data and “know-how”.                                             <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 27 MEDIATION; ARBITRATION                                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
27.1 Mediation.                                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                     (a) Where any dispute, controversy or claim between the Government and the                        <br /><br /><br />
                     Company or any Shareholder or Sesa Goa (the Company, Sesa Goa, and                                <br /><br /><br />
                     any Shareholders) together, the “Investor Parties”) arising out of or in                          <br /><br /><br />
                     relation to or in connection with this Agreement, including any dispute as                        <br /><br /><br />
                     to its existence, interpretation, construction, validity or termination, the                      <br /><br /><br />
                     rights or liabilities of the parties, the enforceability, performance, expiry,                    <br /><br /><br />
                     termination or breach of the Agreerdent whether based on contract, tort or                        <br /><br /><br />
                     otherwise (a "Dispute"), the Government and the Investor Parlies shall                            <br /><br /><br />
                     attempt to reach an amicable settlement through mutual discussion. If,                            <br /><br /><br />
                     notwithstanding the parties’ attempts, it is not possible to reach such a                         <br /><br /><br />
                     settlement within 20 Business Days of one party giving the other parties                          <br /><br /><br />
                     notice of the Dispute, the Dispute shall be first referred to a mediator to be                    <br /><br /><br />
                     agreed upon by the Government and the Investor Parties. Mediation shail                           <br /><br /><br />
                     commence by written notice from the complaining party or parties calling                          <br /><br /><br />
                     for mediation, with a statement of its grievance, followed in 15 Business                         <br /><br /><br />
                     Days after appointment of the mediator by a written response in writing                           <br /><br /><br />
                     from the other parly (or parlies)stating its response to the grievance. The                       <br /><br /><br />
                     complaining party may elect to file a reply within 15 days after receipt of                       <br /><br /><br />
                     the response, but such reply shall be limited only to new facts raised in the                     <br /><br /><br />
                     response. If the parties cannot agree upon a mediator within 30 Business                          <br /><br /><br />
                     Days after service of the notice from the complaining party, the mediator                         <br /><br /><br />
                     shall be appointed by the I,CIA.                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                    3* <br /><br /><br />
                                                                              v                                        <br /><br /><br />
                                                 115                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
﻿(b)    The mediator .shall submil written nonbinding recommendation(s) to the          <br /><br /><br />
parties which shall include, but not be limited to, terms on which the                 <br /><br /><br />
dispute, controversy or claim may be resolved or settled.                              <br /><br /><br />
(c)    Within 10 Business Days of the submission of the mediator’s                     <br /><br /><br />
recommendations), both the Government and the Investor Parlies shall                   <br /><br /><br />
submit to the other its written response to the recommendation(s), detailing           <br /><br /><br />
which items, if any, it accepts or rejects or which items, if any, it wishes           <br /><br /><br />
further direct negotiations within the context of the recommendation(s).               <br /><br /><br />
Where the mediator’s recommcndation(s) are rejected by either of the                   <br /><br /><br />
parties and it is evident that further direct negotiations will not resolve or         <br /><br /><br />
settle the dispute, controversy or claim, the matter shall be submitted to             <br /><br /><br />
arbitration pursuant lo Section 27.2.                                                  <br /><br /><br />
(d)    No Dispute shall be submitted to arbitration before mediation has been          <br /><br /><br />
exhausted. T he cost and expenses of the mediator shall be equally borne               <br /><br /><br />
by Government and the Investor Parties.                                                <br /><br /><br />
27.2    Submission to UNC1TRAL Arbitration.                                            <br /><br /><br />
(a)    Any Dispute between the Government and the Company not settled                  <br /><br /><br />
pursuant to Section 27.1 shall be referred to and finally resolved by                  <br /><br /><br />
arbitration conducted in accordance with the UNC1TRAL Rules. Any                       <br /><br /><br />
such arbitration shall be administered by the LCIA.                                    <br /><br /><br />
(b)    Unless the Government and the Company agree that any matter subject to          <br /><br /><br />
arbitration under this Agreement shall be referred for resolution by a single          <br /><br /><br />
arbitrator, any arbitral tribunal constituted pursuant to Section 27.2(a) shall        <br /><br /><br />
consist of three arbitrators appointed in accordance with the UNCITRAL                 <br /><br /><br />
Rules. The Government and the Company shall each appoint one                           <br /><br /><br />
arbitrator and the two arbitrators so appointed shall appoint a third                  <br /><br /><br />
arbitrator who shall act as president of the arbitral tribunal. Where cither           <br /><br /><br />
the Government or the Company fails to appoint an arbitrator within 45                 <br /><br /><br />
Business Days of being called upon to do so by the other party or where                <br /><br /><br />
the party-appointed arbitrators have not appointed a third arbitrator within           <br /><br /><br />
20 Business Days after the appointment of the second of them, either party             <br /><br /><br />
may apply to the LCIA Court to appoint that arbitrator.                                <br /><br /><br />
27.3    Seat of Arbitration.                                                           <br /><br /><br />
The seat of any arbitration conducted pursuant to this Agreement shall be London,      <br /><br /><br />
England and the proceedings shall be conducted in the English language. The            <br /><br /><br />
Government and the Company agree to submit irrevocably to the jurisdiction of          <br /><br /><br />
the English courts for the limited purpose of enforcing this agreement to arbitrate.   <br /><br /><br />
27.4    Single Arbitrator.                                                             <br /><br /><br />
To ihe extent permitted by law or applicable arbitration rules, where this             <br /><br /><br />
Agreement provides, or if the parties agree that any matter subject to arbitration     <br /><br /><br />
under this Agreement shall be referred for resolution by a single arbitrator, the      <br /><br /><br />
parties shall promptly appoint such an arbitrator by agreement between them. In        <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
 /                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
﻿the absence of agreement as to the choice of arbitrator, an arbitrator shall be               <br /><br /><br />
appointed by the LCIA Court. The decision of the single arbitrator shall be final             <br /><br /><br />
and binding unless appealed by any party to a full panel of arbitrators appointed as          <br /><br /><br />
provided in this Section 27, who shall examine the single arbitrator’s decision               <br /><br /><br />
only as to manifest error of law, findings of fact that are not supported by any              <br /><br /><br />
credible evidence, and abuse of authority, misconduct or other unau.thorized act by           <br /><br /><br />
the single arbitrator.                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
27.5    Single Claim; No Concurrent Proceedings.                                              <br /><br /><br />
Concurrent arbitration proceedings shall not be permitted and all matters relating            <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
to a Dispute, whether initiated by the Government, the Company, Sesa Goa, or                  <br /><br /><br />
any Shareholder(s), shall be decided in a single proceeding. Whenever an                      <br /><br /><br />
arbitration has been initiated before LCIA with respect to a Dispute, any                     <br /><br /><br />
subsequent arbitration initiated with respect to the same Dispute shall be abated.            <br /><br /><br />
27.6    Special Provisions.                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
Any decision of the arbitrator(s) shall be public. Any monetary award shall be                <br /><br /><br />
assessed and payable in Dollars (determined at the Prevailing Market Rate of                  <br /><br /><br />
Exchange if the award involved an obligation expressed in any currency other                  <br /><br /><br />
than Dollars). The arbitrators may not award specific performance or similar                  <br /><br /><br />
equitable remedies against the Government. No party shall have any liability for              <br /><br /><br />
either consequential damages or exemplary or punitive damages. Enforcement of.                <br /><br /><br />
any UNCITRAL award shall be in accordance .with the provisions of the New                     <br /><br /><br />
York Convention.                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
27.7    Exclusive Remedy                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
Failing mediation, arbitration hereunder shall be the parties’ exclusive remedy and           <br /><br /><br />
no party to arbitration shall be required to exhaust any local administrative or              <br /><br /><br />
judicial remedy.                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
                      t                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
27.8    Severability                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
The provisions of this Section 27 shall be severable from the remainder of this               <br /><br /><br />
Agreement and shall remain in full force and effect notwithstanding any                       <br /><br /><br />
cancellation or termination of this Agreement.                                                <br /><br /><br />
27.9    Shareholder Benefit and Appointment and Government Acknowledgement.                   <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
(a) Any Shareholder shall benefit from the rights conferred on the Company                    <br /><br /><br />
 under this Agreement, including but not limited to under this Section 27,                    <br /><br /><br />
 and shall be entitled to be a party and to make claims in its own name in                    <br /><br /><br />
 any arbitration under this Agreement and to all the remedies that would be                   <br /><br /><br />
 available to the Company and the Government hereby acknowledges and                          <br /><br /><br />
 consents to any Shareholder having such rights. Whether advanced in the                      <br /><br /><br />
 name of any Shareholder or the Company, only a single claim may be                           <br /><br /><br />
 made with respect to any Dispute under this Agreement and any award                          <br /><br /><br />
 shall be limited by the amount that the Company could claim for breach of                    <br /><br /><br />
 this Agreement.                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                           £f <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
                                                       117                                    <br /><br /><br />
﻿(b)    The Company hereby irrevocably appoints any Shareholders), jointly (but         <br /><br /><br />
not severally), to act on its behalf with respect to all matters pursuant to           <br /><br /><br />
this Section 27. Such appointment shall include the right to initiate,                 <br /><br /><br />
conduct, manage, and settle any and all aspect of any arbitration pursuant             <br /><br /><br />
to such Section, and the Government hereby acknowledges and consents to                <br /><br /><br />
such appointment.                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
(c)    Any Shareholder may transfer its interest in the Company (including a           <br /><br /><br />
Controlling interest in the Company) in accordance with this Agreement,                <br /><br /><br />
in which case any new Shareholder shall enter into a deed of adherence to              <br /><br /><br />
this Agreement in the form set out in Exhibit 8 and the Company and the                <br /><br /><br />
Government acknowledge and agree that any new Shareholder's entry into                 <br /><br /><br />
such a deed of adherence shall constitute a written arbitration agreement              <br /><br /><br />
between Ihe new Shareholder, the Company and the Government on the                     <br /><br /><br />
terms set out in this .Section 27.                                                     <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 28 NOTICES                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
28,1 Written Communications.                                                           <br /><br /><br />
All orders, approvals, declarations and notices of any kind between the parties        <br /><br /><br />
(hereinafter each referred to as a •‘Communication”) shall be in writing and           <br /><br /><br />
delivered by hand, by fax, by electronic mail, by postage prepaid registered mail,     <br /><br /><br />
by. prepaid internationally recognized courier service, or by any other means of       <br /><br /><br />
communication agreed upon in writing by the parties. Communication by fax or           <br /><br /><br />
electronic mail is valid under this Agreement only to fax numbers or electronic        <br /><br /><br />
email addresses set forth below or identified as acceptable to a party by notice to    <br /><br /><br />
the other party pursuant to this Section 28. A Communication other than an             <br /><br /><br />
electronic mail shall bear an original or facsimile reproduction of the signature of   <br /><br /><br />
a representative of the sending party responsible for such Communication and all       <br /><br /><br />
Communications shall indicate the identity of such representative and state how        <br /><br /><br />
he or she may be reached by telephone and, if practical, electronic mail. A            <br /><br /><br />
Communication under this Agreement is not effective until delivery.                    <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
28.2 Delivery.                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
 Subject to Section 28.5, delivery of a Communication to a party shall be deemed       <br /><br /><br />
 to have occurred in any one of the following circumstances:                           <br /><br /><br />
 (a)    Fax confirmation of receipt is electronically issued to the sender by the fax  <br /><br /><br />
 receiving device.                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
 (b)    Electronic mail confirmation of receipt originated by the recipient is         <br /><br /><br />
 received at the electronic mail address of the sender.                                <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
 (c)    Written confirmation of receipt is received by the postal or courier service   <br /><br /><br />
 delivering the Communication.                                                         <br /><br /><br />
 (d)    The recipient has otherwise directly or indirectly acknowledged receipt of     <br /><br /><br />
﻿(e) Verification of receipt of the Communication has been obtained in any                                 <br /><br /><br />
manner specifically agreed to in writing by the parties. Other confirmation                               <br /><br /><br />
of receipt acceptable to the recipient is obtained by the sending party.                                  <br /><br /><br />

All Communications from the Government to the Company shall be addressed as                               <br /><br /><br />

28.4    Change of Address.                                                                <br /><br /><br />
Any party may, upon prior notice to the other party, at any time change the               <br /><br /><br />
designation of a Person named to receive Communications under this Agreement,             <br /><br /><br />
or the address or fax number of the office in Liberia or elsewhere authorized to          <br /><br /><br />
receive such Communications.                                                              <br /><br /><br />
28.5    Quantities.                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
All notices, reports, applications, feasibility reports and related plans and             <br /><br /><br />
documents, financial statements and similar materials furnished to the                    <br /><br /><br />
Government by the Company under this Agreement shall be delivered to each                 <br /><br /><br />
Government addressee provided for under Section 28.3 or Section 28.4 (but not             <br /><br /><br />
more than live addressees at any one time) in duplicate paper copies, and, if more        <br /><br /><br />
than six pages long, shall be accompanied by a reproducible electronic copy in            <br /><br /><br />
Microsoft Word or Adobe PDF formal that is compatible with versions of such               <br /><br /><br />
program that have been readily available in Monrovia for at least 36 months. The          <br /><br /><br />
Government may change the required electronic data format for such documents              <br /><br /><br />
to any other readily available format on at least 60 days prior notice to the             <br /><br /><br />
Company.                                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 29 FORCE MAJEURE                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
29.1 Application.                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
In the event of a party being rendered unable, in whole or in part, by Force              <br /><br /><br />
Majcure to carry out any obligation under this Agreement, other than an                   <br /><br /><br />
obligation of the Company to make payments of money to the Government, the                <br /><br /><br />
party shall give notice and the particulars of such Force Majeure in writing to the       <br /><br /><br />
other party as soon as practicable after the occurrence of the cause relied on.           <br /><br /><br />
Thereafter, any obligation of the party giving such notice that such party is unable      <br /><br /><br />
to carry out because of such Force Majeure shall be suspended during the                  <br /><br /><br />
continuance of any such inability so caused, but for no longer period. The party          <br /><br /><br />
giving such notice shall take all reasonable steps to mitigate such disability with       <br /><br /><br />
all reasonable dispatch. All time periods specified in this Agreement for the             <br /><br /><br />
performance of obligations or the enjoyment of rights that are affected by Force          <br /><br /><br />
                                                                           *              <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                            121                                           <br /><br /><br />
﻿Majeure, oilier than obligations for the payment of money, shall be extended until      <br /><br /><br />
the effect of such Force Majeure is remedied as above provided or otherwise             <br /><br /><br />
ceases, However, the Term and all Mining Terms shall be extended as a result of         <br /><br /><br />
an event of Force Majeure if and only if such event causes the stoppage of              <br /><br /><br />
substantially ail of a material part of Operations.                                     <br /><br /><br />
29.2    Definition.                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
The term “Force Majeure” as used in this Agreement shall mean acts of God,              <br /><br /><br />
accidents, wars, acts of war, invasions, acts of public enemies, hostilities (whether   <br /><br /><br />
war is declared or not), restrictions on trade or other activities imposed by any       <br /><br /><br />
sovereign nation or state, embargoes, blockades, revolutions, riots, civil              <br /><br /><br />
commotions, acts of terrorism, sabotage, strikes and/or other industrial, labor or      <br /><br /><br />
employer-employee disputes (if not cured for a period of more than two months),         <br /><br /><br />
fires, explosions, earthquakes or any other natural disasters, expropriation of         <br /><br /><br />
facilities or goods, epidemics, public health emergencies and any similar cause,        <br /><br /><br />
provided any such cause was not within the reasonable control of the parly              <br /><br /><br />
claiming the benefit of Force Majeure and could not have been avoided or                <br /><br /><br />
overcome by such party through the exercise of due diligence.                           <br /><br /><br />
29.3    No Required Settlement,                                                         <br /><br /><br />
Nothing in Sections 29.1 and 29.2 above shall, in and of itself, be construed to        <br /><br /><br />
require the Company to settle any strike, lockout or other labor or industrial          <br /><br /><br />
dispute.                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
29.4    Termination As a Result of Force Maieure.                                       <br /><br /><br />
The Company shall be entitled to terminate this Agreement and shall have no             <br /><br /><br />
further obligations under this Agreement if the circumstances giving rise to a          <br /><br /><br />
Force Majeure event are continuing for a period of more than 360 days, provided         <br /><br /><br />
that the Company has notified the Minister of such fapt, following which the            <br /><br /><br />
Agreement shall terminate 180 days following such notification being sent to the        <br /><br /><br />
Minister.                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 30 GOVERNING LAW                                                                <br /><br /><br />
30.1    Applicability of Liberian Law,                                                  <br /><br /><br />
Except as explicitly provided in this Agreement and the Revenue Code, the               <br /><br /><br />
Company shall be subject to ail of the internal laws of Liberia as in effect from       <br /><br /><br />
time to time, including with respect to labor, environmental, health and safety,        <br /><br /><br />
customs and tax matters.                                                                <br /><br /><br />
30.2    Construction and Interpretation.                                                <br /><br /><br />
This Agreement and the rights, obligations and duties of the parties hereunder          <br /><br /><br />
shall be construed and interpreted in accordance with Liberian law.                     <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />

 \ I                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
﻿ SECTION 31 PERIODIC REVIEW                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
31.1    Profound Change iit Circumstances.                                                     <br /><br /><br />
For the purpose of considering Profound Changes in Circumstances from those                    <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
existing on the Effective Date or on the date of the most recent review of this                <br /><br /><br />
Agreement pursuant to this Section 31.1, the Government on the one hand and the                <br /><br /><br />
Company on the other hand, shall meet once every five (5) years after the date                 <br /><br /><br />
hereof or earlier, if one parly reasonably considers a Profound Changes in                     <br /><br /><br />
Circumstances to have occurred, to establish whether or not a Profound Changes                 <br /><br /><br />
in Circumstances has occurred. To the extent that a Profound Changes in                        <br /><br /><br />
Circumstances has occurred the parties shall enter into good faith discussions to              <br /><br /><br />
consider such modifications to this Agreement as they may in good faith agree are              <br /><br /><br />
necessary. The parties shall effect such modifications to this Agreement that the              <br /><br /><br />
parties agree are necessary.                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
31.2    Other Consultation.                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
In addition to the consultation and review provided by Section 31.1, each party                <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
may at any time request a consultation with the other party with respect to any                <br /><br /><br />
matter affecting the rights and obligations of the parties pursuant to this                    <br /><br /><br />
Agreement or any matter relating to Operations. The parties shall meet to review               <br /><br /><br />
in good faith the matter raised as soon after such request as is reasonably                    <br /><br /><br />
convenient for them both. Subsequent to such consultation, the parlies shall take              <br /><br /><br />
such action, if any, that is mutually agreed to address the matter, subject to the             <br /><br /><br />
requirements of Section 33.3.                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 32 WAIVER OF SOVEREIGN IMMUNITY                                                        <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
The Government hereby irrevocably waives, in relation to any dispute arising in                <br /><br /><br />
connection with this Agreement, whether relating to acts of a sovereign or                     <br /><br /><br />
governmental nature or otherwise, all claims of immunity from the j urisdiction of,            <br /><br /><br />
and from the enforcement of any arbitral award rendered by, an arbitral tribunal               <br /><br /><br />
constituted pursuant to this Agreement as well as all claims of immunity from the              <br /><br /><br />
service of process or the jurisdiction of any court situated in any state, country or          <br /><br /><br />
nation in aid of the jurisdiction of such arbitral tribunal or in connection with the          <br /><br /><br />
enforcement of any such award.                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 33 MISCELLANEOUS                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
33.1 Where Payments to Government are Made.                                                    <br /><br /><br />
Unless this Agreement expressly provides otherwise, all amounts payable by the                 <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
Company to the Government under this Agreement shall be paid to the Ministry                   <br /><br /><br />
of Finance for deposit in the general revenues account of the Government against               <br /><br /><br />
delivery of a receipt or other official document evidencing payment of the amount              <br /><br /><br />
and the purpose for which paid.                                                                <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />

                                                                                            \  <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                           %   <br /><br /><br />
                              123                                                              <br /><br /><br />
﻿33.2 Entire Agreement.                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
This Agreement, including the Schedules and Exhibits attached to it, represents        <br /><br /><br />
(he entire agreement between the parties and shall with effect from the Effective      <br /><br /><br />
Date, supersede all previous oral and written negotiations and agreements between      <br /><br /><br />
the parties.                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
33.3    Amendment and Interpretations.                                                 <br /><br /><br />
Any modification or amendment of this Agreement shall be by the mutual written         <br /><br /><br />
agreement of the parties (with the Minister, the Minister of Finance, Minister of      <br /><br /><br />
Justice and the Chairperson of the National Investment Commission, or such other       <br /><br /><br />
persons as may be notified by the Government to the Company, acting for the            <br /><br /><br />
Government) and shall not become effective until (i) approved by the President of      <br /><br /><br />
the Republic and (ii) (except for non-material modifications and amendments),          <br /><br /><br />
approved by the Legislature. Interpretations of this Agreement agreed to by the        <br /><br /><br />
parties which affect the determination of amounts due under this Agreement are         <br /><br /><br />
not valid and do not bind the Government unless the Minister of Justice and            <br /><br /><br />
Minister of Finance have consented thereto in writing.                                 <br /><br /><br />
33.4    Limitation of Liability.                                                       <br /><br /><br />
Neither party shall have any liability under this Agreement for consequential          <br /><br /><br />
damages or any form of exemplary or punitive damages.                                  <br /><br /><br />
33.5    Non-Waiver of Rights.                                                          <br /><br /><br />
Either party may (i) extend the time for the performance of any of the obligations     <br /><br /><br />
of the other party, (ii) waive any inaccuracies in the representations and warranties  <br /><br /><br />
contained herein or in any document delivered pursuant hereto, or (hi) waive any       <br /><br /><br />
non-compliance by the other party with, or default by the other party under, any       <br /><br /><br />
provision of this Agreement, provided that such extension or waiver shall be in        <br /><br /><br />
writing. In the case of fhe Government, any such extension or waiver shall be          <br /><br /><br />
executed by the Minister, the Minister of Finance, Minister of Justice, and the        <br /><br /><br />
Chairperson of the National Investment Commission, or such other persons as            <br /><br /><br />
may be notified by the Government to the Company, provided that, save as               <br /><br /><br />
expressly set out in this Agreement, any such extension or waiver that, if given       <br /><br /><br />
effect, would modify any provision of applicable statutory Law (other than this        <br /><br /><br />
Agreement), shall not become effective until, in addition, it is approved by the       <br /><br /><br />
Legislature. The non-exercise or partial exercise by one or the other of the parties   <br /><br /><br />
of any of its rights under the terms of this Agreement shall not in any case           <br /><br /><br />
constitute a waiver of that right. Without prejudice to the generality of the          <br /><br /><br />
foregoing sentence, the failure of the Government to make any inspection               <br /><br /><br />
described in this Agreement or provided for under applicable Law or ascertain in       <br /><br /><br />
any such inspection the existence of any breach by the Company of any of its           <br /><br /><br />
obligations under this/Agreemcnt, any plan described in Sections 5.4 through 5.6       <br /><br /><br />
or applicable tawfehall pot affect the ability of the Government to require full       <br /><br /><br />
compliance by tte'fcompany with such obligations.                                      <br /><br /><br />

                                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
 33.6    Third Party Beneficiary                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
 Apart from the Government, the Company, Sesa Goa, and the Shareholders, as                              <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
 provided in Section 27.9, no Person shall have any rights under this Agreement.                         <br /><br /><br />
 33.7    Assignment and Succession.                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
 The terms and conditions of this Agreement shall inure to the benefit of and be                         <br /><br /><br />
 binding upon the successors by operation of law and permitted assignees of the                          <br /><br /><br />
 parties including in the case of the Government, all future manifestations or forms                     <br /><br /><br />
 of public power exercising sovereign authority over all or part of the present                          <br /><br /><br />
 territory of Liberia.                                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
 33.8    Survival.                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
Notwithstanding termination of this Agreement by any party or for any reason,                            <br /><br /><br />
including a termination due to a finding that this Agreement or a portion thereof is                     <br /><br /><br />
void, invalid, or unenforceable, Section 1, the final sentence of Section 19.8(c),                       <br /><br /><br />
Sections 20.1, 20.5, 20.6, 22, 25.7, 26, 27, 28, 30, 32, and this Section 33, all                        <br /><br /><br />
liabilities of either party accruing prior to such termination and all closure                           <br /><br /><br />
management and environmental remediation, restoration or reforestation                                   <br /><br /><br />
obligations of the Company under this Agreement or each EMP shall survive such                           <br /><br /><br />
termination. Moreover, any such termination shall be without prejudice to rights,                        <br /><br /><br />
duties and obligations of either party that have accrued prior to termination and,                       <br /><br /><br />
notwithstanding such termination, such provisions of this Agreement as are                               <br /><br /><br />
reasonably necessary for the full enjoyment and enforcement of such accrued                              <br /><br /><br />
rights, duties and obligations shall survive such termination for the period                             <br /><br /><br />
necessary.                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
33.9    Severability.                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
Should any Section of this Agreement, or any provision or term of any Section, be                        <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
found, pursuant to Section 27, to be void, invalid or unenforceable, in whole or in                      <br /><br /><br />
part, then the remaining Sections, and those unaffected provisions or terms of any                       <br /><br /><br />
other Sections which contain some void; invalid or unenforceable provisions or                           <br /><br /><br />
terms, shall nevertheless remain valid and subsisting and shall be construed as if                       <br /><br /><br />
this Agreement had been executed without such void, invalid or unenforceable                             <br /><br /><br />
Sections, provisions or terms. Any otherwise void, invalid or unenforceable                              <br /><br /><br />
Section, term or provision of this Agreement shall be so construed, or reformed, as                      <br /><br /><br />
to alter, amend or change any such term, provision or condition to the extent                            <br /><br /><br />
necessary to render it valid, lawful and enforceable, while also giving maximum                          <br /><br /><br />
effect to the parlies’ originally intended purpose or result, short of creating any                      <br /><br /><br />
void, invalid or unenforceable provision, term or condition.                                             <br /><br /><br />
33.10    Publication.                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
                          The Government shall make public this Agreement and any amendments or          <br /><br /><br />
                          written interpretations of this Agreement.                                     <br /><br /><br />

﻿33.11 Counterparts.                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
 This Agreement may be signed in any number of counterparts, each of which shall    <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
 be an original, with the same effect as if the signatures thereto and hereto were  <br /><br /><br />
 upon the same instrument.                                                          <br /><br /><br />
