                                                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
 SECTION 700. DEFINITIONS                                                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
 (a)    Producer. The term “producer” means a “mining project producer” or a “petroleum project producer” as              <br /><br /><br />
 specified in subsections (b) and (c).                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
 (b)    Mining Project                                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
 (1)    Producer. A "mining project producer" (or the short form “producer,” used for convenience when the                <br /><br /><br />
 context is clear) is a person who---                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
 (A)    Carries out mineral exploration under a mineral exploration license issued under the Mining Law; or               <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
 (B)    Carries out mineral exploration, development, or production activity under a mineral development                  <br /><br /><br />
 agreement or a Class A mining license issued in accordance with the Mining Law.                                          <br /><br /><br />
 (2)    Mineral Exploration License Area. A "mineral exploration license area" is the geographic area covered by          <br /><br /><br />
 a mineral exploration license.                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
 (3)    Mining License Area. A "mining license area" is the geographic area covered by a Class A mining license.          <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />

                                                                                                                        V <br /><br /><br />

                               OTHER APPROVED FISCAL PROVISIONS                                                              <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
This Exhibit shall be read in conjunction with the Revenue Code. To the extent of                                            <br /><br /><br />
any conflict with the Revenue Code, this Exhibit shall govern to the extent that this Agreement                              <br /><br /><br />
so provides.                                                                                                                 <br /><br /><br />

SECTION 17. STABILITY OF FISCAL REGIME FOR MINING, PETROLEUM, AND RENEWABLE                                                  <br /><br /><br />
RESOURCE PROJECTS                                                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
When entering into an agreement with a Chapter 6 contractor, or a Chapter 7 producer, the                                    <br /><br /><br />
Government of Liberia is permitted to accept a clause stabilizing the following aspects of taxation to the terms under       <br /><br /><br />
Code provisions for a period not to exceed 15 years from the effective date of the agreement:                                <br /><br /><br />
(1)    The income tax rate;                                                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
(2)    The rate of royalty;                                                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
(3)    The special rule for extended net operating loss carryforward;                                                        <br /><br /><br />
(4)    The special rule for depreciation and other cost recovery;                                                            <br /><br /><br />
(5)    The rate for withholding of tax on pay ments;                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
(6)    The exemption provided in Section 1001(c)(6) and 1001(g)(5);                                                          <br /><br /><br />
(7)    The exemption provided in Section 1708(b); and                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
(8)    The exemption provided in Section 2009(i).                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
***                                                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
Section 18. Advance Pricing Agreement                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
(a) General Rule. The term "advance pricing agreement" (“APA”) means an agreement with the Government of                     <br /><br /><br />
Liberia establishing a transfer pricing methodology (“TPM”) intended to reflect transactions between related                 <br /><br /><br />
parties as they would be ifthey had been between unrelated parlies dealing at arm’s length. If a person who has              <br /><br /><br />
entered into an APA complies hilly with its terms and conditions, the Ministry of Finance will not contest the               <br /><br /><br />
application of the TPM to the .subject matter of the APA.                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
(1)    In addition to the TPM, an A PA may specify the related parry transactions or transfers the agreement covers          <br /><br /><br />
(“covered transactions”), the APA term, operalional and compliance provisions, appropriate adjustments,                      <br /><br /><br />
critical assumptions regarding future events, mandatory recordkeeping, annual reporting responsibilities,                    <br /><br /><br />
and other provisions that may be appropriate, necessary, or desirable.                                                       <br /><br /><br />
(2)    An APA is a supplement to administrative and judicial mechanisms for resolving transfer pricing issues.               <br /><br /><br />
(3)    A person who has entered into an APA must maintain books and records sufficient to enable the Ministry of             <br /><br /><br />
Finance to examine whether the producer has complied with the APA.                                                           <br /><br /><br />
(4)    Both while an APA request is pending and after an APA is executed, a person who lias entered into an APA              <br /><br /><br />
is under a continuing duty to supplement material facts and information submitted in connection with the                     <br /><br /><br />
person’s request for the APA. If, after an APA is executed, the person discovers that information provided                   <br /><br /><br />
in connection with the APA request was false, incorrect, or incomplete in some material respect, the person                  <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />

33    If any term or other provision of this Guarantee is invalid, illegal or incapable of being   <br /><br /><br />
enforced by any rule of law, or public policy, all other conditions and provisions of this         <br /><br /><br />
Guarantee shall nevertheless remain in full force and effect so long as the economic or            <br /><br /><br />
legal substance of the transactions contemplated hereby is not affected in any manner              <br /><br /><br />
materially adverse to any party; provided, however, that this Guarantee may not be                 <br /><br /><br />
enforced without giving effect to the provisions of Section 1 hereof. No party hereto shall        <br /><br /><br />
assert, and each party shall cause its respective affiliates not to assert, that this Guarantee    <br /><br /><br />
or any part hereof is invalid, illegal or unenforceable. Upon such determination that any          <br /><br /><br />
term or other provision is invalid, illegal or incapable of being enforced, the parties hereto     <br /><br /><br />
shall negotiate in good faith to modify this Guarantee so as to effect the original intent of      <br /><br /><br />
the parties as closely as possible in a mutually acceptable manner in order that the               <br /><br /><br />
transactions contemplated hereby be consummated as originally contemplated to the fullest          <br /><br /><br />
extent possible.                                                                                   <br /><br /><br />

                                                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />

long as one of such courts shall have subject matter jurisdiction over such suit, action or                         <br /><br /><br />
proceeding, and that any cause of action arising out of this Guarantee shall be deemed to                           <br /><br /><br />
have arisen from a transaction of business in the State of New York. Each of the parties                            <br /><br /><br />
hereby irrevocably consents to the exclusive jurisdiction of such courts (and of the                                <br /><br /><br />
appropriate appellate courts therefrom) in any such suit, action or proceeding and                                  <br /><br /><br />
irrevocably waives, to the fullest extent permitted by law, any objection that it may now or                        <br /><br /><br />
hereafter have to the laying of the venue of any such suit, action or proceeding in any                             <br /><br /><br />
court or my objection (hat any such suit, action or proceeding brought in any such court                            <br /><br /><br />

﻿Guarantee; and (iiij ibis Guarantee constitutes a legal, valid and binding obligation of                  <br /><br /><br />
Guarantor, enforceable against Guarantor in accordance with its terms.                                    <br /><br /><br />
28    Within 120 days following the end of each financial year of Sesa Goa Ltd., Sesa Goa Ltd.            <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
shall deliver to Beneficiary the financial statements and opinion regarding Sesa Goa (as                  <br /><br /><br />
opposed to the Company) described in Sections 17.4 (a) and (b), respectively, of the MDA.                 <br /><br /><br />

29    This Guarantee shall remain in full force and effect and shall be binding on Guarantor,             <br /><br /><br />
jointly and severally, and their respective successors and permitted assigns until the                    <br /><br /><br />
satisfaction in full of the Guaranteed Obligations.                                                       <br /><br /><br />

21    Guarantor’s obligations as guarantor shall not be impaired, modified, changed, released,    or <br /><br /><br />
limited in any manner whatsoever by any impairment, modification, change, release, or                <br /><br /><br />
limitation of the liability of the Company or its estates in bankruptcy, resulting from the          <br /><br /><br />
operation of any present or future provision of the bankruptcy laws or other similar statute,        <br /><br /><br />
or from the decision of any court.                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
22    Beneficiary shall have the full right, in its discretion and without any notice to or consent  <br /><br /><br />
from Guarantor, from time to time and at any time and without affecting, impairing,    or            <br /><br /><br />
discharging, in whole or in part, the liability of Guarantor hereunder: (a) to extend, in            <br /><br /><br />
whole or in part, by renewal or otherwise, and on one or any number of occasions, the time           <br /><br /><br />
for the performance of any term or condition of the MDA; (b) to settle, compromise,                  <br /><br /><br />
release, substitute, surrender, modify, or impairHo enforce and exercise, or to fail or refuse       <br /><br /><br />
to enforce or exercise, any claims, rights, or remedies, of any kind or nature, which                <br /><br /><br />
Beneficiary may at any time have against the Company.                                                <br /><br /><br />
23    This Guarantee is an absolute, unconditional and continuing guarantee of performance and       <br /><br /><br />
not of collection. Guarantor hereby agrees that its obligations hereunder are irrevocable,           <br /><br /><br />
and are independent of the obligations of the Company; that a separate action or actions             <br /><br /><br />
may be brought and prosecuted against Guarantor regardless of whether any action is                  <br /><br /><br />
brought against the Company or whether the Company is joined in 'any such action or                  <br /><br /><br />
actions; and Guarantor hereby waives the benefit of any statute of limitations affecting its         <br /><br /><br />
liability hereunder or the enforcement hereof.                                                       <br /><br /><br />
24    In the event that Beneficiary retains or engages an attorney or attorneys to successfully      <br /><br /><br />
enforce this Guarantee Guarantor shall reimburse Beneficiary for all expenses incurred,              <br /><br /><br />
including attorneys' fees and disbursements in connection with such enforcement                      <br /><br /><br />
25    Guarantor shall have no right of subrogation whatsoever with respect to the Guaranteed         <br /><br /><br />
Obligations or to any collateral securing such obligations unless and until such obligations         <br /><br /><br />
have been paid in full.                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
26    Guarantor may not assign its obligations under this Guarantee to any Person without the        <br /><br /><br />
prior written consent of Beneficiary. Guarantor agrees that this Guarantee shall be binding          <br /><br /><br />
upon and enforceable against Guarantor and Guarantor’s successors or permitted assigns.              <br /><br /><br />
27    Guarantor hereby represents and warrants that: (i) the execution, delivery and performance     <br /><br /><br />
by Guarantor of this Guarantee and the fulfillment of and compliance with the terms and              <br /><br /><br />
provisions hereof have been duly authorized by Guarantor (with such authorization in full            <br /><br /><br />
force and effect), and do not and will not conflict with or violate any provision of its             <br /><br /><br />
formation or organizational documents or conflict with, or result in any breach of, or               <br /><br /><br />
constitute a default under, any agreement to which Guarantor is a party or by which                  <br /><br /><br />
Guarantor is bound; (ii) no other action is necessary for Guarantor to enter into this               <br /><br /><br />

THIS GUARANTEE (this “Guarantee"! is made as of ____[_J, 2011 by ELENILTO                            <br /><br /><br />
MINERALS & MINING LLC and SESA GOA LTD (“Guarantor”), to and for the benefit of the                  <br /><br /><br />
Republic of Liberia (“Beneficiary”).                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
WITNESSETH:                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
A.    By a Mineral Development Agreement, dated as of August 3, 2011, made by and among              <br /><br /><br />
Beneficiary, Western Cluster Limited (the “Company”) and Elenilto Minerals & Mining                  <br /><br /><br />
LLC and SESA GOA LTD (as such agreement may be amended from time to time, the                        <br /><br /><br />
“MPA"), die Company has agreed to execute and complete certain obligations upon the                  <br /><br /><br />
terms, and subject to the conditions set forth in, the MDA.                                          <br /><br /><br />
B.    The Company is directly or indirectly controlled by Guarantor or an Affiliate of die           <br /><br /><br />
* Guarantor and Guarantor or one of its Affiliates will be considerably benefited by the             <br /><br /><br />
MDA.                                                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
C.    At the request of Beneficiary, Guarantor has agreed to guarantee due performance of the        <br /><br /><br />
obligations of the Company as specified herein on the terms and subject to the conditions            <br /><br /><br />
set out herein.                                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the foregoing, and other good and valuable                       <br /><br /><br />
consideration the receipt -of. which is hereby acknowledged and accepted, Guarantor hereby           <br /><br /><br />
agrees as follows:                                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
18    Guarantor hereby irrevocably, unconditionally and absolutely guarantees any obligation or      <br /><br /><br />
liability of the Company under, or undertaken in connection with Sections 6.2 and 20.5(a)            <br /><br /><br />
of the MDA, provided, that in no event shall Guarantor be obligated to expend more than              <br /><br /><br />
US$50 million (the “Guaranteed Obligations”), regardless of whether recovery on such                 <br /><br /><br />
Guaranteed Obligations may be or hereafter become barred by any statute of limitations or            <br /><br /><br />
such Guaranteed Obligations may otherwise be or become unenforceable.                                <br /><br /><br />
19    Guarantor agrees that this Guarantee shall be deemed a continuing guarantee of those           <br /><br /><br />
Guaranteed Obligations. Guarantor hereby expressly acknowledges and agrees that,                     <br /><br /><br />
notwithstanding anything to the contrary set forth in the MDA, for purposes of this                  <br /><br /><br />
Guarantee, “Guaranteed Obligations” shall be deemed to include all (he obligations and               <br /><br /><br />
liabilities of any Affiliate of the Company to which rights and obligations under the MDA            <br /><br /><br />
have been assigned.                                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
20    Guarantor hereby irrevocably waives (i) diligence, presentment, protest, notice of dishonor,   <br /><br /><br />
demand, extension of time for payment, notice of non-payment, and indulgences and                    <br /><br /><br />
notices of every kind, (ii) any lack of validity or enforceability of this Guarantee, the MDA        <br /><br /><br />
or any agreement or instrument relating thereto, and (iii) any other circumstance that might         <br /><br /><br />
otherwise constitute a defense available to, or a discharge of Guarantor under, applicable           <br /><br /><br />

term or other provision is invalid, illegal or incapable of being enforced, the parties hereto                                                            <br /><br /><br />
shall negotiate in good faith to modify this Guarantee so as to effect the original intent of                                                             <br /><br /><br />
the parties as closely as possible in a mutually acceptable manner in order that the                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
transactions contemplated hereby be.consummated as originally contemplated to the fullest                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
extent possible.                                                                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />

law. Guarantor hereby consents to any and all forbearances and extensions of time of                 <br /><br /><br />
payment in connection with the MDA, and to any and all changes in terms, covenants, and              <br /><br /><br />
conditions thereof; it being the intention hereof that Guarantor shall remain liable as a            <br /><br /><br />
principal until all Guaranteed Obligations shall have been fully satisfied, or this Guarantee        <br /><br /><br />
is otherwise terminated under Section 12 hereof, notwithstanding any act, omission, or               <br /><br /><br />
thing which might otherwise operate as a legal or equitable discharge of Guarantor.                  <br /><br /><br />
4    Guarantor’s obligations as guarantor shall not be impaired, modified, changed, released, or     <br /><br /><br />
limited in any manner whatsoever by any impairment, modification, change, release, or                <br /><br /><br />
limitation of the liability of the Company or its estates in bankruptcy, resulting from the          <br /><br /><br />
operation of any present or future provision of the bankruptcy laws or other similar statute,        <br /><br /><br />
or from the decision of any court.                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
5    Beneficiary shall have the full right, in its discretion and without any notice to or consent   <br /><br /><br />
from Guarantor, from lime to time and at any time and without affecting, impairing, or               <br /><br /><br />
discharging, in whole or in part, the liability of Guarantor hereunder: (a) to extend, in            <br /><br /><br />
whole or in part, by renewal or otherwise, and on one or any number of occasions, the time           <br /><br /><br />
for the performance of any term or condition of the MDA; (b) to settle, compromise,                  <br /><br /><br />
release, substitute, surrender, modify, or impair, to enforce and exercise, or to fail or refuse     <br /><br /><br />
to enforce or exercise, any claims, rights, or remedies, of any kind or nature, which                <br /><br /><br />
Beneficiary may at any time have against the Company.                                                <br /><br /><br />
6    This. Guarantee is an absolute, unconditional and continuing guarantee of performance and       <br /><br /><br />
not of collection.- Guarantor hereby agrees that its obligations hereunder are irrevocable,          <br /><br /><br />
and are independent of the obligations of the Company; that a separate action or actions             <br /><br /><br />
may be brought and prosecuted against Guarantor regardless of whether any action is                  <br /><br /><br />
brought against the Company or whether the Company is joined in any such action or                   <br /><br /><br />
actions; and Guarantor hereby waives the benefit of any statute of limitations affecting its         <br /><br /><br />
liability hereunder or the enforcement hereof.                                                       <br /><br /><br />
7    In the event that Beneficiary retains or engages an attorney or attorneys to successfully       <br /><br /><br />
enforce this Guarantee, Guarantor shall reimburse Beneficiary for all expenses incurred,             <br /><br /><br />
including attorneys’ fees and disbursements in connection with such enforcement.                     <br /><br /><br />
8    Guarantor shall have no right of subrogation whatsoever with respect to the Guaranteed          <br /><br /><br />
Obligations or to any collateral securing such obligations unless and until such obligations         <br /><br /><br />
have been paid in full.                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
9    Guarantor may not assign its obligations under this Guarantee to any Person without the         <br /><br /><br />
prior written consent of Beneficiary. Guarantor agrees that this Guarantee shall be binding          <br /><br /><br />
upon and enforceable against Guarantor and Guarantor’s successors or permitted assigns..             <br /><br /><br />
10    Guarantor hereby represents and warrants that: (i) the execution, delivery and performance     <br /><br /><br />
by Guarantor of this Guarantee and the fulfillment of and compliance with the terms and              <br /><br /><br />
provisions hereof have been duly authorized by Guarantor (with such authorization m full             <br /><br /><br />
force and effect), and do not and will not conflict with or violate any provision of its             <br /><br /><br />

           FORM OF EXPLORATION GUARANTEE                                                              <br /><br /><br />

THIS GUARANTEE (this “Guarantee”) is made as of_[_], 2011 by ELENILTO                                 <br /><br /><br />
MINERALS & MINING LLC and SESA GOA LTD, a Delaware and an Indian entities,                            <br /><br /><br />
respectively (“•Guarantor"), to and for the benefit of the Republic of Liberia (“Beneficiary”).       <br /><br /><br />
WITNESSETH:                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
A.    By a Mineral Development Agreement, dated as of August 3, 2011, made by and among               <br /><br /><br />
Beneficiary, Western Cluster Limited (the “Company”) and Guarantor (as such                           <br /><br /><br />
agreement may be amended from time to time, the “MPA”), the Company has agreed to                     <br /><br /><br />
execute and complete certain obligations upon the terms, and subject to the conditions set            <br /><br /><br />
forth in, the MDA.                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
B.    The Company is directly or indirectly controlled by Guarantor or an Affiliate of the            <br /><br /><br />
Guarantor and Guarantor or one of its Affiliates will be considerably benefited by the                <br /><br /><br />
MDA.                                                                                                  <br /><br /><br />

obligations of the Company as specified herein on the terms and subject to the conditions             <br /><br /><br />
set out herein,                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />

consideration the receipt of which is hereby acknowledged and accepted, Guarantor hereby              <br /><br /><br />
agrees as follows:                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
1    Guarantor hereby irrevocably, unconditionally and absolutely guarantees any obligation or        <br /><br /><br />
liability of the Company under Section 10.1 of the Exploration Regulations with respect to            <br /><br /><br />
any Exploration conducted pursuant to the MDA, provided, that in no event shall                       <br /><br /><br />
Guarantor be obligated to expend more than an amount in U.S. Dollars equal to \5%pf the               <br /><br /><br />
Approved Work Program pursuant to this Guarantee (the “Guaranteed Obligations”),                      <br /><br /><br />
regardless of whether recovery on such Guaranteed Obligations may be or hereafter                     <br /><br /><br />
become barred by any statute of limitations or such Guaranteed Obligations may otherwise              <br /><br /><br />
be or become unenforceable subject to clause 12.                                                      <br /><br /><br />
2    Guarantor agrees that this Guarantee shall be deemed a continuing guarantee of those             <br /><br /><br />
Guaranteed Obligations. Guarantor hereby expressly acknowledges and agrees that,                      <br /><br /><br />
notwithstanding anything to the contrary set forth in the MDA, for purposes of this                   <br /><br /><br />
Guarantee, “Guaranteed Obligations” shall be deemed to include ail the obligations and                <br /><br /><br />
liabilities of any Affiliate of the Company to which such rights and obligations under the            <br /><br /><br />
MDA have been assigned.                                                                               <br /><br /><br />

demand, extension of time for payment, notice of non-payment, and indulgences and                     <br /><br /><br />
notices of every kind, (ii) any lack of validity or enforceability of this Guarantee, the MDA         <br /><br /><br />

﻿                    FORM OF PARENT GUARANTEE                                                         <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
THIS GUARANTEE (this “Guarantee”-) is made as of August 3, 2011 by ELENILTO                          <br /><br /><br />
MINERALS & MINING LLC, BLOOM FOUNTAIN LIMITED, and SESA GOA LTD                                      <br /><br /><br />
(collectively, “Guarantor” and each a Guarantor Entity), to and for the benefit of the Republic of   <br /><br /><br />
Liberia (“Beneficiary”).                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
WITNESSETH:                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
A.    By a Mineral Development Agreement, dated as of August 3, 2011, made by and among              <br /><br /><br />
Beneficiary, Western duster Limited (the “Company”) and Elenilto Minerals & Mining                   <br /><br /><br />
LLC, BLOOM FOUNTAIN LIMITED, and SESA GOA LTD (as such agreement may                                 <br /><br /><br />
be amended from time to time, the “MPA”), the Company has agreed to execute and                      <br /><br /><br />
complete certain obligations upon the terms, and subject to the conditions set forth in, the         <br /><br /><br />
MDA.                                                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
B.    The Company is directly or indirectly controlled by Guarantor or an Affiliate of the           <br /><br /><br />
Guarantor and Guarantor or one of its Affiliates will be considerably benefited by the               <br /><br /><br />
MDA.                                                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
C.    At the request of Beneficiary, Guarantorhas agreed to guarantee due performance of the         <br /><br /><br />
obligations of the Company as specified herein on the terms and subject to the conditions            <br /><br /><br />
set out herein.                                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
NOW, THEREFORE, in consideration of the foregoing, and other good and valuable                       <br /><br /><br />
consideration the receipt of which is hereby acknowledged and accepted, each Guarantor Entity        <br /><br /><br />
hereby agrees, jointly and severally, as follows:                                                    <br /><br /><br />
1    Guarantor hereby irrevocably, unconditionally and absolutely guarantees any obligation or       <br /><br /><br />
liability of the Company under, y undertaken in connection with the MDA (the                         <br /><br /><br />
“Guaranteed Obligations”), regardless of whether recovery on such Guaranteed                         <br /><br /><br />
Obligations may be or hereafter become barred by any statute of limitations or such                  <br /><br /><br />
Guaranteed Obligations may otherwise be or become unenforceable.                                     <br /><br /><br />
2    Guarantor agrees that this Guarantee shall be deemed a continuing guarantee of those            <br /><br /><br />
Guaranteed Obligations. Guarantor hereby expressly acknowledges and agrees that,                     <br /><br /><br />
notwithstanding anything to the contrary set forth in the MDA, for purposes of this                  <br /><br /><br />
Guarantee, “Guaranteed Obligations” shall be deemed to include all the obligations and               <br /><br /><br />
liabilities of any Affiliate of the Company to which rights and obligations under the MDA            <br /><br /><br />
have been assigned.                                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
3    Guarantor hereby irrevocably waives (i) diligence, presentment, protest, notice of dishonor,    <br /><br /><br />
demand, extension of time for payment, notice of non-payment, and indulgences and                    <br /><br /><br />
notices of every kind, (ii) any lack of validity or enforceability of this Guarantee, the MDA        <br /><br /><br />
or any agreement or instrument relating thereto, and (iii) any other circumstance that might         <br /><br /><br />
otherwise constitute a defense available to, or a discharge of Guarantor under, applicable           <br /><br /><br />
law. Guarantor hereby consents to any and all forbearances and extensions of time of                 <br /><br /><br />
﻿(c) the Liberia Minerals and Mining Law of 2000 (the ‘‘Minina Lew"',, the Liberia                                        <br /><br /><br />
Revenue Code of 2000, the environmental laws and regulations of the Republic of                                          <br /><br /><br />
Liberia and all other applicable laws and regulations of the Republic of Liberia, as                                     <br /><br /><br />
such laws and regulations may from time to time be amended, modified or                                                  <br /><br /><br />
supplemented (subject to the terms of the MDA).                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
4.2.    The Licensee will be required under the exploration regulations to make detailed                                 <br /><br /><br />
quarterly reports of all field and sampling activities and results, and to make quarterly                                <br /><br /><br />
deposits with the Ministry of all geological information and samples gained from its                                     <br /><br /><br />
exploration work in the Exploration Area, other than that position of the samples                                        <br /><br /><br />
subjected to destructive analysis or testing, in each case within specified periods after the                            <br /><br /><br />
end of a quarter.                                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
4.3.    The term of this License is five years from the Effective Date, subject to any extension to                      <br /><br /><br />
such term pursuant to and in accordance with the terms of the MDA and subject to the                                     <br /><br /><br />
earlier termination or relinquishment of this License pursuant to the terms of the MDA.                                  <br /><br /><br />
4.4.    The address of the Licensee in Monrovia for notices relating to this License is as follows:                      <br /><br /><br />
4                                                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
The Licensee may change this address to another address in Monrovia by notice to the                                     <br /><br /><br />
Minister at the principal office of the Ministry in Monrovia in the manner provided in                                   <br /><br /><br />
the Exploration Regulations.                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
4.5 If the Licensee discovers in the Exploration-Area exploitable deposits of the minerals                               <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
referred to in Section 1.2 of this License, subject to and in accordance with the terms of                               <br /><br /><br />
the MDA and the Mining Law, the Licensee will have the right to obtain a Class A                                         <br /><br /><br />
Mining License for the mining of such deposits in accordance with the MDA, the                                           <br /><br /><br />
Mining Law and the applicable regulations of the Ministry governing the issuance of                                      <br /><br /><br />
and operations under a Class A Mining license.                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 5. LICENSE BINDING ON GOVERNMENT.                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
This License is duly issued and binding on the Government of Liberia when signed by the                                  <br /><br /><br />
Assistant Minister for Mineral Exploration and approved by the Minister.                                                 <br /><br /><br />

Mines and Energy (the “Ministry11), to 1                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />

this License in the exploration area defined in Section 3 of this License (the                                                 <br /><br /><br />
“Exploration Area”) in order to ascertain the existence, location, quantity and quality or                                     <br /><br /><br />
commercial value of deposits in the Exploration Area of such minerals.                                                         <br /><br /><br />
