(c) Deductions i\ot Allowed. The following expenses are not allowed as a deduction from gross income:                 <br /><br /><br />
(1)    A payment to an expatriate employee as reimbursement for taxes and duties paid by the employee to the          <br /><br /><br />
Government.                                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
(2)    A loss Irom a hedging transaction.                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
(3)    An incentive deduction allowed by Section 204(d).                                                              <br /><br /><br />
(4)    An amount otherwise allowable as a special tax incentive deduction by Section 16.                              <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 706. SPECIAL RULE FOR DEPRECIATION                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
(a)    Commencement of Period. For property placed in service before commercial production begins, the period for     <br /><br /><br />
depreciation of property deseibed in Section 204(b) (the cost of which is attributable to a mining production         <br /><br /><br />
project) begins in the first tax period in which the mining production project’s commercial production begins.        <br /><br /><br />
(1)    Up-front payments that arc mandatory under a contract are treated as the post of property placed in service    <br /><br /><br />
before commercial production begins, and arc to be amortized over a period of 10 years.                               <br /><br /><br />
(2)    The costs of community development contributions or social contributions that are mandatory under a            <br /><br /><br />
contract are deductible in the year incurred.                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
(b)    Tangible Moveable Property. The cost of tangible moveable property shall be recovered over the period and by   <br /><br /><br />
the method described in Section 204(b)( I).                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
(c)    Five-Year Cost Recovery Period.                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
(1)    [n place of the 15-year period set out in Section 204(b)(2) and (3) for recovering the cost of tangible fixed  <br /><br /><br />
property and intangible property, a mining project is allowed to recover the cost of a mining production              <br /><br /><br />
asset on an asset-by-ns.sei basis using the straight-line method over a five-year period at the rate of 20            <br /><br /><br />
percent per year.                                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
(2)    i'he term “mining production asset”means---                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
(A) Tangible fixed property used directly in the mining and quarrying of metallic and nonmetallic minerals            <br /><br /><br />
and the milling, beneficiatioii, and other primary preparation of minerals, but not equipment used to                 <br /><br /><br />
smelt, reduce, refine, or process minerals or mineral ores; and                                                       <br /><br /><br />
﻿(B) Intangibles acquired to develop the site, for example the cost of ground-cover stripping, preparation of             <br /><br /><br />
waste dumps, emplacement of haulage roads, and similar pre-development expenditures.                                     <br /><br /><br />
(d) /5-Year Cost Recovery Period. A mining project’s other tangible fixed property and intangible property shall be      <br /><br /><br />
depreciated on an asset-by-asscl basis over a 15-year period or the expected period of commercial production             <br /><br /><br />
(whichever is shorter) using the straight-line method.                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
'0| Termination of Project, if a mining project is terminated before the end of the cost recovery* period, the           <br /><br /><br />
remaining unrecovered cost is treated as an expense deduction in determining taxable income for the tax period           <br /><br /><br />
in which the project is terminated.                                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 707. SPECIAL RULE FOR NET OPERATING LOSS CARRYFORWARD                                                            <br /><br /><br />
For the purposes of determining taxable income of a mining project, the Section 203(e) period for                        <br /><br /><br />
carryforward of net operating loss shall begin with the first tax period in which commercial production begins and       <br /><br /><br />
shall be seven years.                                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 708. SPECIAL RULE FOR INTEREST DEDUCTION                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
(a)    Interest incurred in a tax period and subject to the limitation of Section 203(d) may be carried                  <br /><br /><br />
forward to the next tax period.                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
(b)    The amount of the carryfoiward is treated as interest inclined in the subsequent period, and is                   <br /><br /><br />
deductible to the extent permitted under Section 203(d)                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
(c)    The interest carryforward allowed by this section does not expire.                                                <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 709. SPECIAL RULE FOR MINING EXPLORATION AND DEVELOPMENT                                                         <br /><br /><br />
EXPENDITURES                                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
Mining exploration expenses and mining development expenses are attributable to a mining                                 <br /><br /><br />
production project under the rules of Section 700 and arc deductible in the first lax period in which commercial         <br /><br /><br />
production begins.                                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 710. SPECIAL RULE FOR DECOMMISSIONING EXPENSES                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
(a)    Qualification. A mining project's payment for decommissioning expenses is deductible from gross income            <br /><br /><br />
under Section 705(b) only in the amount paid during the tax period---                                                    <br /><br /><br />
(1)    To defray reclamation or decommissioning expenses upon cessation of commercial production, and                    <br /><br /><br />
remedying damage caused to land used by the project or environmental damage the project may have                         <br /><br /><br />
caused (including damage that extends beyond the mining license area), but not if drawn from a trust fund                <br /><br /><br />
described in paragraph (2); or                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
(2)    To att approved trust fund established to defray future expenses of the type specified in paragraph (1),          <br /><br /><br />
subject to any limitations or requirements specified in regulations.                                                     <br /><br /><br />
(b)    Recapture. An amount taken as a deduction under subsection (a) but not used for the specified purpose---          <br /><br /><br />
(1)    If remaining after the tax period in which commercial production ends, shall be included in income for the        <br /><br /><br />
following (ax period; or                                                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
(2)    If used for another purpose, shall be included in income in the tax period within which the amount is so          <br /><br /><br />
used.                                                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 711. TREATMENT OF PROPERTY TRANSFERS                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
(a) General Rule. Unless an exception applies under this Chapter, a mining project's gain or loss                        <br /><br /><br />
on the transfer of depreciable property used by the project is treated in accordance with section 20*1. Transfer of non- <br /><br /><br />
﻿depreciable propert) used in .no uusiiies:;, 01 traiss(ci of properly other than properly connected with mining, is         <br /><br /><br />
determined in accordance with the property transfer rules of Section 207.                                                   <br /><br /><br />
(b) Special Cases.                                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
(!) Hedging. Hedging transactions by a mining project are taxable as a separate business activity, and hedging              <br /><br /><br />
gains and losses incurred are not includible or deductible in determining taxable income of the project or                  <br /><br /><br />
for the purposes of Section 730.                                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
(2) Investment Gain. Gain on property the project holds for investment is determined under Section 207 and                  <br /><br /><br />
is includible in income of a project, except to the extent reduced by investment loss under the rule of                     <br /><br /><br />
Section 203(b)(2).                                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 712. SUCCESSOR AGREEMENT; TRANSFER OF INTEREST IN MINING PROJECT                                                    <br /><br /><br />
(a) Successor Agreement. If an agreement for a mining project (the "original agreement") is terminated and a new            <br /><br /><br />
agreement (the "successor agreement") is entered into with the same producer for the same geographic area (the              <br /><br /><br />
"successor project"), the project's loss carryforward existing at the termination date of the development                   <br /><br /><br />
agreement is deductible in the first tax period of the successor project under the successor agreement, provided:           <br /><br /><br />
(1)    The whole of the geographic area covered by the contract area of the successor agreement is within the               <br /><br /><br />
contract area of the original agreement; and                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
(2)    The successor agreement entered into force within one month following the termination of die original                <br /><br /><br />
agreement                                                                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
(b) Transfer of Interest. If the bolder of an interest in a mining project transfers that interest---                       <br /><br /><br />
(1)    The taxable income of the project shall continue to be determined using the tax cost and other tax attributes        <br /><br /><br />
applicable at the date of the interest transfer; and                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
(2)    The transferor of the interest shall determine gain or loss under Section 207, which also applies to                 <br /><br /><br />
determine the transferee's tax cost in the interest.- •    ’                                                                <br /><br /><br />
(O Contract Area. For the purposes of subsection (a), the term ‘‘conlracl area” means mineral exploration license           <br /><br /><br />
area or mining license area, whichever is applicable.                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 713. TRANSACTIONS BETWEEN RELATED PERSONS                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
(a) General Rule. A mining project’s gairt, loss, and other lax consequences in transactions with related persons are       <br /><br /><br />
determined in accordance with ihe definitions in Section 10 (in Part I, General Provisions), and the provisions             <br /><br /><br />
of this Part, especially Section 207, Property Transfers; Section 208, Related Persons; Section 209, Finance                <br /><br /><br />
Leasing; Section 210, Income Splitting, and Section 211, Transactions Between Related Persons.                              <br /><br /><br />
(c)    Disclosure. A mining project producer must---                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
(1)    Disclose the existence of related-party transactions and contemporaneously document the manner in which              <br /><br /><br />
prices are set in transfers to related persons;                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
(2)    Notarize an agreement governing a related-party transaction in accordance with the law of the related                <br /><br /><br />
person's country of residence; and                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
(3)    Upon request of the Ministry', provide copies of agreements and other documents substantiating the                   <br /><br /><br />
existence of related-party transactions and the manner by which prices are set.                                             <br /><br /><br />
(d)    Advance Pricing Agreement. The Government of Liberia and a producer may agree to a transfer pricing                  <br /><br /><br />
methodology in an advance pricing agreement in accordance with Section 18.                                                  <br /><br /><br />
(e)    Regulations. The Minister is required to issue regulations clarifying, to the degree feasible, the reference prices, <br /><br /><br />
comparables, and standards that will be used to evaluate transfer prices. Regulations are required to take into             <br /><br /><br />
account the Guidelines described in Section 18(b).                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
﻿SECTION 714. PARTNERSHIPS AND JOINT VENTURES                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
(a)    Pass-Through of Tax Attributes. If a mining project producer is organized as a partnership or similar form of     <br /><br /><br />
unincorporated joint venture, the mining project's income, expenses, loss, credits, and character of income or           <br /><br /><br />
loss shall be attributed to the partners in accordance with their interests (including the items specified in Section    <br /><br /><br />
705). for the purpose of determining taxable income, loss, credits, and lax liability separately for each partner.       <br /><br /><br />
(b)    Application of Other Rules. If subsection (a) applies---                                                          <br /><br /><br />
(1)    The provisions of this Chapter shall apply separately to each partner;                                            <br /><br /><br />
(2)    Each partner shall be considered a taxpayer for purposes of this Pari (Part If, Income Tax) and a mining          <br /><br /><br />
project producer for purposes of this Chapter, and shall be liable for income tax as determined under this               <br /><br /><br />
Chapter.                                                                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
SECTIONS 715-729. RESERVED                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 730. SURTAX ON INCOME FROM HIGH-YIELD PROJECTS                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
(a)    Purpose. This section applies to determine whether a mining project is sufficiently high-yield to be subject to   <br /><br /><br />
surtax and, i F so, the amount of tax.                                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
(b)    Definition of High-Yield. A mining project is considered high-yield and thus subject to surtax when the           <br /><br /><br />
project’s pre-tax rale of return on total investment is greater than 22.5 percent, the threshold rate of return for      <br /><br /><br />
application of this Section.                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
(c)    Method to Calculate Yield. A mining project's accumulated negative net cash flow shall be determined by           <br /><br /><br />
applying an annual accumulation factor of 1.225 to negative net cash Row carried forward from a prior tax                <br /><br /><br />
period. At the close of each tax period, accumulated negative net cash flow earned forward from the prior                <br /><br /><br />
period shall be increased by current negative net cash flow or offset by current positive net cash flow. A project       <br /><br /><br />
is not high-yield and subject to surtax unless its accumulated net cash flow at the close of a period is positive.       <br /><br /><br />
(d)    Surtax Rate. Positive net accumulated cash flow at the close of a tax period is taxable at a rate of 20 percent,  <br /><br /><br />
and the amount of this liability is deductible from gross income for the tax period in accordance with Section           <br /><br /><br />
705(b).                                                                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
(e)    Re-Set Accumulation to Zero. Following a tax period for which tax is due under tiiis section, a mining project's  <br /><br /><br />
accumulated negative cash flow is re-set to zero and (he method of subsection (d) is re-applied using zero as the        <br /><br /><br />
starting point for the succeeding lax period.                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
(I) Steps to Calculate Yield. Beginning with the first tax period in which a mining project has a Class A mining         <br /><br /><br />
license and has begun construction, the following steps are used to calculate yield in accordance with subsection        <br /><br /><br />
(c).                                                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
(1)    Cost. State the expenditures, as specified in Section 731, for the tax period. This is the project's cost         <br /><br /><br />
through the dose of the period. Go to Step 2.                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
(2)    Revenues. State the project's revenues, as specified in Section 732, for the tax period, including revenues,      <br /><br /><br />
if any, from the exploration period as defined in Section 700. This amount is the project's revenues                     <br /><br /><br />
through the close of the period. Go to Step 3.                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
(3)    Test Net Cash Flow.                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
(A)    Determine net cash flow. Subtract from revenues the amount of cost to arrive at net cash flow (R • C =            <br /><br /><br />
NCF).                                                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
(B)    Net cash flow zero or negative. If net cash flow is zero or negative, the project is not yet a high-yield         <br /><br /><br />
project and the surtax does not apply. Multiply the negative net cash flow by 1.225 to arrive at the                     <br /><br /><br />
project's accumulated negative net cash flow to be carried to the next lax period. Go to Step 4.                         <br /><br /><br />
﻿(C) Net is positive. If riet cash flow is positive, tax is determined under subsection (d), and this amount is        <br /><br /><br />
deductible in determining taxable income under Section 703. Accumulated negative net cash flow is                     <br /><br /><br />
te-set to zero in accordance with subsection (e), Go to Step 4.                                                       <br /><br /><br />
(4) Reprise. Re-apply steps (1) through (3) for each succeeding tax period, beginning with the period after the       <br /><br /><br />
one tested under Step 3                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
(A)    Add costs incurred in the succeeding period to any accumulated negative net cash flow carried from             <br /><br /><br />
the prior period (zero if re-set) as under Step 1. Go to (B).                                                         <br /><br /><br />
(B)    State revenues for the succeeding period as under Step 2. Go to (C).                                           <br /><br /><br />
(C)    Test net cash flow as under Step 3.                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 731. DETERMINATION OF EXPENDITURES FOR SECTION 730 PURPOSES                                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
(a)    Expenditures Counted. For the purposes of determining cost under Section 730(g)(1), a mining                   <br /><br /><br />
project's expenditures for a tax period is the sum of the following amounts incurred during the period, and           <br /><br /><br />
does not include the amount of any income tax paid:                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
(1)    Expenses deductible in computing taxable income, but not the allowance for                                     <br /><br /><br />
“ depreciation or interest and finance charges or the surtax deduction under Section                                  <br /><br /><br />
705(b)(7);                                                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
(2)    Capital expenditures to acquire or construct a tangible or intangible asset for use                            <br /><br /><br />
in mining operations, but not an addition to (or reduction in) working capital; and                                   <br /><br /><br />
(3)    Mining exploration expenditures, mining development expenditures, and capital                                  <br /><br /><br />
 j    goods expenditures as defined in Section 700. For a project's first tax period, include                         <br /><br /><br />
^    expenditures for prior exploration, development, and capital goods attributable to the                           <br /><br /><br />
project under Section-700(h).                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
(b)    Transfer of interest.. Consideration paid for transfer of an interest in a mining project is                   <br /><br /><br />
disregarded in determining the project's total expenditures.                                                          <br /><br /><br />
(c)    Only Production Expenditures. If an amount referred to in subsection (a) is related to                         <br /><br /><br />
commercial production as well as to some other non-production activity of a mining project, only the                  <br /><br /><br />
amount attributable to commercial production is included in determining the project’s total expenditures.             <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 732. DETERMINATION OF TOTAL REVENUES                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
f                                                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
(a) Revenues Counted. For purposes of Section 730(0(2), a mining project's total revenues fora tax period is the      <br /><br /><br />
sum of the following amounts:                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
(1)    The project's gross income for income tax purposes for the tax period, including amounts                       <br /><br /><br />
from hiring or leasing-out property or the granting of t ights to use property (but not including                     <br /><br /><br />
interest income);                                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
(2)    The project's consideration received for the tax period for the disposal, destruction, or                      <br /><br /><br />
loss of any property (including materials, equipment, plant, facilities, and intellectual property or                 <br /><br /><br />
rights) used in mining operations if the expenditure incun-ed in acquiring the property was                           <br /><br /><br />
deducted in computing the project's net cash flow for any tax period;                                                 <br /><br /><br />
(») Any amount received for the tax period for provision of information or data obtained                              <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
from any survey, appraisal, or study relating to mining operations, if the expenditure incurred in                    <br /><br /><br />
undertaking the survey, appraisal, or study was previously deducted in computing the project’s net                    <br /><br /><br />
cash flow for any lax period;                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                    1 <br /><br /><br />
﻿(4)    Any other amount received for the tax period that is a reimbursement, refund, or other                                  <br /><br /><br />
recoupment of an amount previously deducted in computing the net cash flow of the project for                                  <br /><br /><br />
any tax period; and                                                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
(5)    If property used in mining operations has been destroyed or lost, any compensation,                                     <br /><br /><br />
indemnity, or damages the project received in respect of the property under an insurance policy,                               <br /><br /><br />
indemnity agreement, settlement, condemnation action, or judicial decision.                                                    <br /><br /><br />
(b)    Transfer of Interest. Consideration received for transfer of an interest in a mining project is not included in the     <br /><br /><br />
project's total revenues.                                                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
(c)    Only Production Revenues. I fan amount referred to in subsection (a) is related to commercial production as             <br /><br /><br />
well as to some other non-production activity of a mining project, only the amount attributable to commercial                  <br /><br /><br />
production is included in determining the project's total revenues.                                                            <br /><br /><br />
SECTIONS 733-739. RESERVED                                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 806. WITHHOLDING OF TAX ON PAYMENTS TO NONRESIDENTS                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
(a)    Payments. A person listed in this subsection who makes a payment of the kind specified in this section is               <br /><br /><br />
required to withhold tax at the rate specified in this section. The payor is treated as a withholding agent for all            <br /><br /><br />
purposes of this Code. This subsection applies to the following types of persons:                                              <br /><br /><br />
(1)    a resident legal or natural person;                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
(2)    a nonresident's permanent establishment in Liberia;                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
(3)    a government agency;                                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
(4)    unless expressly exempted by international agreement or treaty, a nongovernmental organization operating                <br /><br /><br />
in Liberia or a diplomatic mission to Liberia;                                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
(5)    A foreign corporation authorized to do business in Liberia.                                                             <br /><br /><br />
(b)    Interest, Dividends, Royalties, License Fees, And Similar Payments. A payor who makes a payment to a                    <br /><br /><br />
nonresident of Uberia-source non-exempt interest, dividends, royalties, license fees, a payment in respect of                  <br /><br /><br />
mineral rights, or other income (except rent) derived from rights in property (including any form of intellectual              <br /><br /><br />
property) is required to withhold tax at a rate of 15 percent ofthe amount of the payment.                                     <br /><br /><br />
(c)    Gaming Winnings. A payor who makes a payment to a nonresident of winnings from gaming within Liberia is                 <br /><br /><br />
required to withhold tax at a rate of 20 percent of the amount ofthe payment.                                                  <br /><br /><br />
(d)    Payers of Rent. A payor who makes a payment to a nonresident of Liberia-source rent is required to withhold tax         <br /><br /><br />
at a rate Of 15 percent of the amount of each payment.                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
(e)    Payments for Services Rendered A payor who makes a payment to a nonresident for Liberian-source services                <br /><br /><br />
rendered is required to withhold tax at the rate of 15 percent ofthe amount ofthe payment if payment is of a                   <br /><br /><br />
son that, if made to a resident, would be includible in gross income under Section 20! (including Board fees,                  <br /><br /><br />
management fees, commissions, and the like).                                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
(f)    Special Rule for Payments by Mining Projects, Petroleum Projects, anti Renewable Resource Projects. In lieu             <br /><br /><br />
of the rates otherwise applicable under this section, in the case of the following types of Liberian-source                    <br /><br /><br />
payments to a nonresident, which for the purpose hereof is considered a Liberian-source for the payee, made by                 <br /><br /><br />
a mining project producer, petroleum project producer, or renewable resource project contract holder, the                      <br /><br /><br />
withholding rates stated below shall apply to the following withholding obligations---                                         <br /><br /><br />
(1)    Interest, 5 percent.                                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
(2)    Dividends, 5 percent.                                                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
(3)    Payments for services, 6 percent.                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
(g)    Payments of Acquisition Price. Upon the payment to a nonresident of the acquisition price for an interest in an         <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
                                                                 4) v                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
 V                                                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
﻿investment asset in Liberia, (he payor is required to withhold tax at the rate of 15 percent of the amount of the             <br /><br /><br />
payment and pay it over to the Government of Liberia in accordance with the rules of subsection (h).                          <br /><br /><br />
(!) For purposes of this subsection, the term "investment asset” means a direct or indirect interest in real                  <br /><br /><br />
property located in Liberia, shares of stock ill a resident legal person, or an ownership interest or rights in a             <br /><br /><br />
partnership, joint venture, or similar arrangement that has significant operations, property, or property                     <br /><br /><br />
rights in Liberia.                                                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
(2) This subsection does not apply if the investment asset is an ownership interest in a legal person described in            <br /><br /><br />
Section 801(b) or (c).                                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
(h)    Withholding Requirements, Remittance, And Statement. Within 10 days after the last day of a month, a payor             <br /><br /><br />
who has made a payment to a nonresident is required to remit to the tax authorities the total amount required to              <br /><br /><br />
be withheld during that month, Each remittance of tax under this section must be accompanied by a statement                   <br /><br /><br />
specifying the name and address of each nonresident to whom a payment was made, the type and amount of each                   <br /><br /><br />
payment, and the amount of tax withheld (and, if the Minister requests, underlying documentation in accordance                <br /><br /><br />
with Section 55, including contracts). If the withholding agent is a resident, the place for remittance is the                <br /><br /><br />
withholding agent’s filing location (as designated in Section 50). If the withholding agent is a nonresident, the             <br /><br /><br />
place of remittance is the Ministry of Finance.                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
(i)    Election. A nonresident subject to tax under this section may elect to file an income tax return by submitting it at   <br /><br /><br />
the time and in the manner required by Pan I and Chapter 9 of this Code, and is thereby required to pay the                   <br /><br /><br />
amount of income tax on taxable income specified in Section 200 or Section 201. An amount of tax withheld                     <br /><br /><br />
pursuant to Section 806 is creditable against income tax liability and refund of an overpayment may be available              <br /><br /><br />
as described in Section 72. A nonresident’s election to file an income tax return is effective for the tax period for         <br /><br /><br />
which the election is made and lor the next four succeeding tax periods.                                                      <br /><br /><br />
(j)    Payments by Government Agency. A government agency that makes a payment to a nonresident in circumstances              <br /><br /><br />
other than those governed by subsections (a) through (g) is required to withhold a portion of the payment as                  <br /><br /><br />
specified in regulations, but not more than 4%.                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
.SECTION 905. WITHHOLDING OF TAX ON PAYMENTS TO RESIDENTS                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
(a)    Payments. A person listed in this subsection who makes a payment of (he kind specified in this section is              <br /><br /><br />
required to withhold lax at the rate specified in this section. The payor is treated as a withholding agent tor all           <br /><br /><br />
purposes of this Code. This subsection applies to the following types of persons:                                             <br /><br /><br />
(1)    a resident legal or natural person;                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
(2)    a nonresident with a branch in Liberia or doing business in Liberia;                                                   <br /><br /><br />
(3)    a government agency; or                                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
(4)    unless expressly exempted by international agreement or treaty, a nongovernmental organization operating               <br /><br /><br />
in Liberia or a diplomatic mission to Liberia.                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
(b)    Interest, Dividends, Royalties, License Fees, and Similar Payments. A payor who makes a payment to a                   <br /><br /><br />
resident of non-exempt interest, dividends, royalties, license fees, or other income (except rent) derived from               <br /><br /><br />
rights in property (including any form of intellectual property), including a payment in respect of mineral rights,           <br /><br /><br />
is required to withhold lax at a rate of 15 percent of the amount of the payment                                              <br /><br /><br />
(c)    Gaming Winnings. A payor who makes a payment to a resident of winnings from gaming within Liberia is                   <br /><br /><br />
required to withhold lax at a rate of 20 percent of the amount of the payment.                                                <br /><br /><br />
(d)    Payers of Rent A payor who makes a payment to a resident of rent is required to witlihold tax at a rate of 10          <br /><br /><br />
percent of the amount of each payment if the total amount of rental payments made during a 12-month period is                 <br /><br /><br />
expected to be $70,000 or more.                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
(c) Payments of Wages or Salary to Employees. A payor who makes a payment of wages or salaries to an employee                 <br /><br /><br />
in an amount that during the tax year exceeds the standard deduction amount of Section 205(a) is required to                  <br /><br /><br />
withhold tax from each payment in accordance with the income tux rates specified in Section 200(a).                           <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
 v I                                                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
﻿(0 Payments for Services neuaered.                                                                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
(a)    If a payor makes a payment to a resident for services rendered, and the services are not the subject of a contract                                                <br /><br /><br />
of employment, (he payor is required to withhold lax at the rate of 10 percent of the amount of the payment,                                                             <br /><br /><br />
(b)    This subsection applies only if---                                                                                                                                <br /><br /><br />
(1)    the payment is of a soil includible in gross income under Section 201 (including Board fees, management                                                           <br /><br /><br />
fees, commissions, and the like); and                                                                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
(2)    the payment is S 100,000 or more (or of any amount if the total amount of payments made to the payee is (or                                                       <br /><br /><br />
is expected to be) $1,000,000 or more for the payer's tax year).                                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
(c)    A payment for the acquisition of goods is not a payment for services rendered. If the payment is for a mixture of                                                 <br /><br /><br />
goods and services, withholding is required only on the portion of the payment that is allocable to the services.                                                        <br /><br /><br />
(g) Payments of Acquisition Price. A payor who makes a payment to a resident representing all or part of the                                                             <br /><br /><br />
acquisition price of an investment asset in Liberia is required to withhold tax at the rate of 10 percent of the                                                         <br /><br /><br />
amount of the payment.                                                                                                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
                              (1)    For purposes of this subsection, (he term "investment asset” means a director indirect interest in real                             <br /><br /><br />
                              property located in Liberia, shares of stock in a resident legal person, or an ownership interest or rights in a                           <br /><br /><br />
                              partnership, joint venture, or similar arrangement that lias significant operations, property, or property                                 <br /><br /><br />
                              rights in Liberia.                                                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
                              (2)    This subsection does not apply if the investment asset is an ownership interest in a legal person described in                      <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
                              Section 801(b) or (c).                                                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
(h) Special Rule for Payments by Mining, Petroleum, and Renewable Resource Projects and Registered                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
Manufacturers. In lieu of the rates otherwise applicable under this section, in the case of the following types of                                                       <br /><br /><br />
payments made to a resident by a mining project producer, petroleum project producer, or renewable resource                                                              <br /><br /><br />
project contract holder, the withholding rates stated below apply to the following withholding obligations---                                                            <br /><br /><br />
                              (!) Interest. 5 percent.                                                                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
                              (2)    Dividends, 5 percent.                                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
                              (3)    Payments for services, 6 percent.                                                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
(i)                           Payments to High-Risk Suppliers. If a payor makes a payment to a high-risk supplier of goods, the payor must                               <br /><br /><br />
                              withhold tax at the rate (not to exceed 20 percent) specified in regulations. The term “high-risk supplier” means                          <br /><br /><br />
                              a person in a category of suppliers identified in regulations as presenting a high risk of (ax avoidance.                                  <br /><br /><br />
(i>                           Withholding Requirements, Remittance, And Statement. Within 10 days after the last day of a month, a payor                                 <br /><br /><br />
                              described in (a) is required to remit to the tax authorities the total amount required to be withheld during that                          <br /><br /><br />
                              month. Each remittance of tax under this section must be"accompanied by a statement specifying the name and                                <br /><br /><br />
                              address of each resident to whom a payment was made, the type and amount of each payment, and the amount                                   <br /><br /><br />
                              of lax withheld (and, if the Minister requests, underlying documentation in accordance with Section 55,                                    <br /><br /><br />
                              including contracts). The place for remittance is the payor’s filing location (designated in Section 50).                                  <br /><br /><br />
(k) Treatment Of Withholding. A person who has had tax withheld from a payment during a tax period may claim a                                                           <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
credit against income tax due on the income tax return for that period. A person not otherwise required to file an                                                       <br /><br /><br />
income lax return may elect to file a return to establish entitlement to credit or refund The rules of Section 72                                                        <br /><br /><br />
apply to an overpayment of tax withheld under this section.                                                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
(I) Information Reporting for Payments to Resident Legal Person. If a payor described in (a)makcs a payment                                                              <br /><br /><br />
that would be subject to withholding under subsection (f) if made to a natural person, but is made to a resident                                                         <br /><br /><br />
legal person, then the payor (while not required to withhold tax on such payments) is required to provide the tax                                                        <br /><br /><br />
authorities with a statement setting out the name, address, and taxpayer identification number of each payee to                                                          <br /><br /><br />
whom such payments were made, the amount of the payments, and related information icquestcd on the form                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
﻿special! by ilic .Yiinsici. ; !>»• si;.;e:m:i;. is dec within 15 days after tilt; las; .jay ilu month in which a payment  <br /><br /><br />
is made. The place for filing the statement is the withholding agent’s filing location (designated in Section 50).        <br /><br /><br />
(m) Penalties. A person who has a withholding obligation under this section and fails to withhold and remit the           <br /><br /><br />
amount of tax required to be withheld is subject to the Section 52 penalty for late payment and failure to pay.           <br /><br /><br />
For the purpose of applying the Section 52 penalty to a failure to withhold and remit tax, references in Section          <br /><br /><br />
52 to the “payment due date” are to be understood as referring to the remittance due date under this section. A           <br /><br /><br />
person who fails to provide the lax authorities with a required statement under subsection (I) is subject to a fine       <br /><br /><br />
of $10,000 for each required statement not provided.                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
(u) Payments by Government Agency. A government agency that makes a payment to a resident in circumstances                <br /><br /><br />
other than those described in subsections (a) through (i) is required to withhold a portion of the payment as             <br /><br /><br />
specified in regulations, but not more than 4%.                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
-SECTION 1001. TAXABLE SUPPLY                                                                                             <br /><br /><br />
»+*                                                                                                                       <br /><br /><br />
< e) Exempt Supply. The following supplies are exempt supplies---                                                         <br /><br /><br />
■***                                                                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
(6) Subject to subsection (1), a supply made to a registered manufacturer; a renewable resource contractor                <br /><br /><br />
subject to Part II, Chapter 6 and in the business of agriculture; a mining project producer or petroleum                  <br /><br /><br />
project producer subject to Part II, Chapter 7; or the holder of a Forestry R esource License engaged in the              <br /><br /><br />
business of forestry, if the supply is of---                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
(A) raw materials or other inputs for use directly in manufacturing;                                                      <br /><br /><br />
.(B) raw materials for use directly in forestry;                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
(C)    '/aw materials for use directly in a renewable resource project described in Pan II, Chapter 6;                    <br /><br /><br />
(D)    raw materials for use directly in a mining project or petroleum projeci described in Part II,                      <br /><br /><br />
Chapter 7; and                                                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
(E)    capital goods.                                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
(g) Definitions In this Part, unless the context otherwise requires -                                                     <br /><br /><br />
(5) Capital Goods. The term "capital goods" means---                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
(A)    Plant or equipment (but not motor vehicles of any kind), and spare pans for these goods, for use                   <br /><br /><br />
exclusively and directly in manufacturing, agriculture, or forestry.                                                      <br /><br /><br />
(B)    The following goods for a producer's use exclusively and directly in a mining or petroleum projeci or              <br /><br /><br />
in mining or petroleum exploration or development:                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
(i)    Plant or equipment (including four-wheel-drive motor vehicles but not motorcycles, sedans or                       <br /><br /><br />
luxury vehicles as defined by regulation) and spare pans for these goods; and                                             <br /><br /><br />
(ii)    From the inception of exploration until the date commercial production begins, intermediate inputs                <br /><br /><br />
(including but not limited to explosives, drilling mud, grinding balls, tires for trucks used in                          <br /><br /><br />
operations, and similar items specified in regulations).                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 1702. IMPORT DUTIES                                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
(a) Levy and Payment. Customs import duties shall be levied on and paid by the importer in respect of goods               <br /><br /><br />
listed in this Chapter's Schedule !, External Tariff Schedule at the rates specified therein.                             <br /><br /><br />
﻿(b) Exception. In the case of an impon qualifying under Section i 708 for exemption from import duty, no duty is         <br /><br /><br />
payable. An exempt import is nonetheless subject to the Customs User Fee described in Section 1802.                      <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 1708. EXEMPTION FROM IMPORT DUTIES                                                                               <br /><br /><br />
(b) Special Rule for Mining and Petroleum Projects During the period from the inception of exploration until the         <br /><br /><br />
date commercial production begins, a Chapter 7 mining project or petroleum project is allowed an import duty             <br /><br /><br />
exemption of the following goods                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
(1)    Plant or equipment (including four-wheel-drive motor vehicles but not sedans or luxury vehicles as defined        <br /><br /><br />
by regulation) and capital spare parts for these goods;                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
(2)    Intermediate inputs (including but not limited to explosives, drilling mud, grinding balls, tires for trucks      <br /><br /><br />
used in operations, and similar items specified in regulations); and                                                     <br /><br /><br />
(3)    Raw materials, except that no exemption is permitted from the 10 percent duty on gasoline and gas oil.            <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 1802. CUSTOMS USER FEE                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
(a)    Minister’s Authority to Set Fee. The Minister has the authority and obligation to fix just and reasonable fees to <br /><br /><br />
be charged by the Bureau of Customs or on its behalf for issuing documents and performing other services in              <br /><br /><br />
connection with the operation of the Customs service, including pre-shipment inspection, that are not set forth          <br /><br /><br />
herein or in any other statute or regulation, and must do so by regulation and by widely circulated notice.              <br /><br /><br />
(b)    Fee Limit on Imports. The Customs user fee for imports must not exceed 1.5 percent of (he CIF Liberian Port       <br /><br /><br />
value of imported goods or US S 10,000 per item, whichever is less.                                                      <br /><br /><br />
(1)    Except as specified in (2), the fee applies to all imports at all borders regardless of whether the goods are     <br /><br /><br />
exempt from import duty because it is intended to cover the cost of the inspection service for non-exempt                <br /><br /><br />
persons and the duty-free service for exempt persons.                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
(2)    Petroleum products are exempt from the import Customs user fee.                                                   <br /><br /><br />
(3)    If an import is entered solely for the purpose of transshipment out of Liberia, it is not subject to the fee in   <br /><br /><br />
this subsection (b) but is subject to the fee descr ibed in subsection (c).                                              <br /><br /><br />
(c)    Fee Limit on Exports. No Customs user fee shall be levied on any export except for unprocessed exportables,       <br /><br /><br />
semi-processed exportables, and goods in transshipment. The fee for goods in transshipment or unprocessed                <br /><br /><br />
exportables must not exceed 2.5 percent of the FOB value. The fee for semi-processed exportables must not                <br /><br /><br />
exceed 1.25 percent of the FOB value. The fee uppliesrfcgardless of whether the goods are exempt from export             <br /><br /><br />
duty.                                                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />
(d)    Scunning Fee. The Minister is empowered to charge a lee directly related to the scanning of cargo containers.     <br /><br /><br />
The fee must be proportionate to the length of the container, and may not exceed US $7 per foot.                         <br /><br /><br />
SECTION 2009. EXEMPTIONS                                                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
The following categories of real properly shall be exempt from real property taxes:                                      <br /><br /><br />
(i) Real property within a mineral exploration license area, a mining license area, or a petroleum area and used         <br /><br /><br />
for a mining project or petroleum project subject to Part II, Chapter 7.                                                 <br /><br /><br />

            THE PRICING AGREEMENT                                   <br /><br /><br />

                                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
                               Principles Relating to Community Funding                                  <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
Subject to the following paragraph, the Annual Social Contribution shall be deposited and held           <br /><br /><br />
in one or more separate segregated accounts as determined by the Government from time to time            <br /><br /><br />
for use in accordance with Section 8 and this Exhibit 6.                                                 <br /><br /><br />
Where any audit conducted pursuant to Section 8.2(b) demonstrates a material discrepancy                 <br /><br /><br />
between the actual disbursements or expenditures made pursuant to Section 8.2 and the budgeted           <br /><br /><br />
and/or reported disbursements or expenditures as determined by the Committee, the Company                <br /><br /><br />
shall be entitled to require that the monies be retained in an escrow account pending an                 <br /><br /><br />
agreement between itself, the Government and the Committee regarding an alternative funding              <br /><br /><br />
mechanism be established for the purposes of managing the contributions and disbursements                <br /><br /><br />
made pursuant to Section 8 (forjjxample, through the establishment of a trust arrangement).              <br /><br /><br />
The following principles shall be applied to any particular project or activity within the Program:      <br /><br /><br />
Governance of the community development and infrastructure investments                                   <br /><br /><br />
•    Selection of the community development and infrastructure projects shall be apolitical and          <br /><br /><br />
completely transparent.                                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
•    No direct payments to individuals will be made, .save-for the purpose of paying for goods           <br /><br /><br />
or services duly rendered in the execution or oversight of one or more funded projects                   <br /><br /><br />
which has been authorized by the Committee.                                                              <br /><br /><br />
•    The Company retains the right to independently audit (at its own expense) any                       <br /><br /><br />
disbursement or expenditure made from the Annual Social Contribution or any project                      <br /><br /><br />
supported with funds from the Annual Social Contribution.                                                <br /><br /><br />
•    Other that/the obligations set forth in Section 8.2 of the Agreement, the Company will              <br /><br /><br />
have no further obligations with respect to any project supported with funds from the                    <br /><br /><br />
Annual Social Contribution, including, but.not limited to, any on-going or periodic                      <br /><br /><br />
maintenance and repair costs or other operational costs in connection with the projects                  <br /><br /><br />
funded by the Program Budget.                                                                            <br /><br /><br />
Project Selection Criteria and Process                                                                   <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                         <br /><br /><br />
 Members of the Committee will work collaboratively to identify, prioritize, and select                  <br /><br /><br />
 appropriate community development and Infrastructure projects.                                          <br /><br /><br />

                                  FORM OF DEED OF ADHERENCE                                        <br /><br /><br />
THIS    DEED OF ADHERENCE is made                                                                  <br /><br /><br />
on    201 [*] and is SUPPLEMENTAL to a mineral                                                     <br /><br /><br />
development agreement dated [__) [_|, 2011 and made between The Government of the                  <br /><br /><br />
Republic of Liberia, Western Cluster Limited, Eleninlto Minerals & Mining LLC, Sesa Goa Ltd        <br /><br /><br />
and Bloom Fountain Ltd, as amended from time to time (die “MDA”).                                  <br /><br /><br />
WHEREAS:                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
1/                                                                                                 <br /><br /><br />
(A) By a transfer dated [•] 201[*], (insert name and address of transferor] (the ‘‘Old             <br /><br /><br />
Shareholder”) transferred to [insert name and address of transferee] (the “New                     <br /><br /><br />
Shareholder”) Control in the Company.                                                              <br /><br /><br />
(B) This Deed is entered into in compliance with the terms of Section 27.7 of                      <br /><br /><br />
the MDA.                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />
NOW THIS DEED WITNESSES AS FOLLOWS:                                                                <br /><br /><br />
1    This Deed is made for the benefit of the original parties to the MDA and any other person     <br /><br /><br />
or persons who after the date of the MDA (and whether or not prior to or after the date of         <br /><br /><br />
this Deed) adhere to the MDA.                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
2    Save where the context otherwise requires, words and expressions defined in the MDA           <br /><br /><br />
have the same meanings when used herein.                                                           <br /><br /><br />
3    The New Shareholder accepts the appointment in accordance with the provisions of              <br /><br /><br />
Section 27.9(c) of the MDA and agrees that this document shall constitute a written                <br /><br /><br />
arbitration agreement in the terms set out in Section 27 of the MDA.                               <br /><br /><br />
4    This Deed and the rights of the parties hereunder shall be construed and interpreted in       <br /><br /><br />
accordance with Liberian law and the provisions of the MDA shall apply mutatis mutandis            <br /><br /><br />
as if set out herein.                                                                              <br /><br /><br />
5    For the purposes of Section 28 (Notices) of the MDA, the name and address of the New          <br /><br /><br />
Shareholder are as set out below in this Deed:                                                     <br /><br /><br />
[Insert notices details]                                                                           <br /><br /><br />

the date stated at the beginning of this Deed of Adherence.                                        <br /><br /><br />

   We hereby declare that the Mineral Development Agreement ("MDA") relating to the Western                                                             <br /><br /><br />
   Cluster iron-ore deposits has been executed between the Depositor, the Beneficiary, Sesa Goa                                                         <br /><br /><br />
   Limited, Western Cluster Limited and the Government of Liberia.                                                                                      <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
                                                                                                                                                        <br /><br /><br />
   We further declare and confirm that the MDA has been ratified by the National Legislature of the                                                     <br /><br /><br />
   Republic of Liberia on (•) 2011.                                                                                                                     <br /><br /><br />
   Accordingly, based on the above declaration and under authority granted by the Depositor and the                                                     <br /><br /><br />

   Agent to release the Escrow Amount to the Beneficiary and the Government of Liberia in the                                                           <br /><br /><br />
   amounts and such accounts as are specified below.                                                                                                    <br /><br /><br />

We hereby declare that the Mineral Development Agreement{"MOA") relating tc> the Western                                   <br /><br /><br />
Cluster iron-ore deposits has been executed between the Depositor, the Beneficiary, Sesa Goa                               <br /><br /><br />
Limited, Western Cluster Limited and the Government of Liberia.                                                            <br /><br /><br />

Republic of Liberia on (•] 2011.                                                                                           <br /><br /><br />

Accordingly, based on the above declaration and under authority granted by the Depositor and the                           <br /><br /><br />
Beneficiary, I, the Minister of Justice on behalf of the Republic of Liberia hereby Instruct the Escrow                    <br /><br /><br />

amounts and such accounts as are specified below.                                                                          <br /><br /><br />
